loans.name: María Clementina

texts.es:
María Clementina es una madre de familia de 56 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola y comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida al paso, para lo cual cuenta con un pequeño local situado en su domicilio. El domicilio se encuentra en una calle céntrica de su domicilio, además ella prepara sus alimentos con buena sazón y ofrece a sus clientes buen trato, por lo que su negocio tiene muy buena acogida. Esta es la principal fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta su familia, su esposo suele ayudarla en esta actividad.

María desea adquirir más insumos para preparar más comida, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en lo logro de su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Clementina is a 56-year-old mother living with her family in the Tambogrande district, a rural and commercial area located in the Piura region, more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

She engages in preparing and selling fast food, and she does it in a small stand she has established in her house. Her activity is very well acknowledged not only because her house is located in a central street of her hometown, but also because the meals she prepares are really tasty and she treats her customers well. As this is the main source of income her family can count on, her husband usually helps her with it.

María wants to buy more ingredients to prepare more meals, and for this reason she has thought it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan on 1000 PEN that she plans to invest in order to reach her goal.

loans.use: To improve her activity by buying ingredient to preapre and sell meals.

loans.name: Edwige

texts.fr: Edwige est née le 17 Octobre 1965 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à un informaticien nommé Séïdou, Edwige est mère de trois enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Edwige s'est installée au quartier Dandji à Cotonou. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Edwige a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire et mène depuis cinq ans comme activité la vente de produits GSM (téléphones portables, etc.) dans sa boutique à son domicile. Edwige s'approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. C'est la troisième fois que Edwige sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit en vue d'agrandir son activité et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Edwige was born on October 17, 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Seidou, a computer specialist, Edwige is the mother of three children, some of whom are in school. About a dozen years ago, Edwige settled in the Dadji district in Cotonou. The spouses jointly take care of the family needs. Edwige stopped her studies at the high school level. Since about five years ago, she has been selling  GSM mobility products (handsets etc) in a store located in her home. Edwige stocks up in Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. It is the third time that Edwige is seeking a loan from ALIDe, with the goal of expanding her business and increasing her sales volume and revenues. The first two loans have been well repaid

loans.use: Purchasing mobile phones

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa T. is from the village of Commonwealth, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 52 years old. Felipa is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Felipa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling "Hypo" stain remover in the local community. Felipa is just starting this business.

In 2007, Felipa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felipa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Felipa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Felipa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Herminia

texts.es:
María de 27 años de edad, está soltera vive con su madre y un hermano, residen en Usulután, es empleada en una tienda distribuidora de lácteos, encargada de ventas, esta tienda está ubicada en la ciudad de El Transito, María tiene ya 5 años de contar con este empleo.
Ella por el momento su necesidad es cubrir los gastos educativos para su hermano menor, ya que ella se encarga de pagar la colegiatura por el año y comprar útiles, por eso solicita un préstamo y salir de este gasto lo antes posible.
Su objetivo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a su familia y que su hermano se prepare estudiando para que tenga en un futuro una oportunidad de empleo distinta a la de ella.
texts.en:
Maria is 27 years old, single and lives with her mother and brother. She lives in Usulutan. She works for a store that sells milk products. She is in charge of sales. This store is located in the city of El Transito. Maria has been working here for the past five years.
Right now Maria needs to pay for the cost of schooling for her younger brother. She is in charge of paying his yearly educational expenses including school supplies. She is asking for a loan to pay for these costs as soon as possible.
Her objectives are to continue working in order to help her family and her brother. He is studying so that he has greater opportunities in the future. She would like him to have a different type of work than she has.

loans.use: To pay for her brother's educational expenses and school supplies.

loans.name: Antonieto

texts.en:
Antonieto T. is from the town of Tagbilaran. He is 45 years old. Antonieto is married and has 4 children aged 15, 14, 11 and 5. To make a living, Antonieto owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. Antonieto works hard to sustain his children's education.

Antonieto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonieto has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Antonieto is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Baudelaire

texts.fr:
Jeune client de 27 ans, célibataire de son état sans enfant, a l’obtention de son Bac, ses parents n’ayant pas pu le soutenir pour des études universitaires, en 2007, il ouvre une cabine téléphonique et fait la vente des cartes prépayées de tous les réseaux téléphoniques.
Ses ventes sont de 50000 frs à 150000frs par jour.

A l’octroi de son prêt, il veut faire la distribution des cartes téléphoniques comme Zain, MTN, Airtel. Et ajouter deux nouveaux téléphones, et faire un abonnement Sotelco et Congo Telecom.
 Tres ambitieux, il veut a la longue avec ses bénéfices ouvrir une boutique de ventes des appareils cellulaires et être fournisseurs des cartes prépayés et refill
texts.en:
Young 27 year old client, single without children, on working for his Baccalauriat degree, his parents not having been able to support him for academic works, in 2007, he opened a phone box and sells prepaid cards of all the phone networks.

His sales are between 50000 frs to150000frs per day. 

With the loan, he wants to distribute telephone cards like Zain, MTN, Airtel. 

And to add two new telephones, and to make a subscription to Sotelco and Congo Telecom. 

Very ambitious, he wants with the loan to open a shop for sales of cellular devices and to supply prepaid and refillable cards.

loans.use: Buy telephones, recharge cards for MTN Warid, Airtel, And telcom subscription

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
Hilario tiene 42 años y es un padre emprendedor y trabajador que busca el bienestar de su familia, él tiene trabajos eventuales pero en su casa tiene un galpón donde cría animales menores como cuyes. Como todos los pobladores de San Isidro de Chicon se dedican a la ganadería y a la agricultura nuestros socio no es la excepción, él vive en la Comunidad de San Isidro de Chicon que se encuentra ubicado a 15 minutos  de la ciudad de Urubamba, Cusco – Perú. Hilario en esta oportunidad requiere el microcrédito para comprar animales menores como cuyes y otros. 

Hilario pertenece al banco comunal “Los Dinámicos de San Isidro de Chicon” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
42-year old Hilario is a hardworking, enterprising man always looking out for the wellbeing of his family. He works on a casual basis and also has a shed at home where he raises animals such as guinea pigs. The people of the community earn their living by raising animals or working in agriculture, and Hilario is no exception. He lives in the community of San Isidro de Chicon which is located 15 minutes from the town of Urubamba, Cusco, Peru.

Hilario is seeking a loan to buy animals such as young guinea pigs and other species. He belongs to the Los Dinámicos de San Isidro de Chicon community bank, a part of the Arariwa Association. He is grateful for the chance to obtain a loan and promises to pay it back according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy animals such as young guinea pigs

location.town: San Isidro de Chicon- Urubamba - Cusco

loans.name: Hendrcih

texts.en:
Hendrich A. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is a widow with six children all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (in-laws).   

Hendrich has a business selling food from a stall.  She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days out of every week. Hendrich sells her products at the market by means of wholesale/retail.    Hendrich has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more fresh cowpeas, beans and apples.    She also generates additional income through rental rooms.    

The main business challenges for Hendrich include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and open another stall.   Hendrich lives in a home that she owns and she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and medication.

loans.use: to buy baskets of fresh peas, beans and apples

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more stock for his general store

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es: Sandra Milena C. S. de 33 años vive en el barrio Santuario de la ciudad de Barranquilla, ella es casada y madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 1 a 6 años; Sandra Milena tiene su propio negocio donde comercializa productos de aseo personal y doméstico, como talcos, desodorantes, cremas dentales, desinfectantes, papel higiénico, medicamentos de venta libre y artículos de la canasta familiar, mediante el sistema de crédito y también de contado;  este negocio se deriva de la actividad que su esposo desempeñó como impulsador de estos productos en una empresa y cuando dejó de trabajar en ella,   utilizó su liquidación en el montaje de un negoció  independiente y ya conocido por él, enseñando también a Sandra a realizarlo para que lo apoyara y generaran ingresos juntos. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará jabones, desodorantes, talcos, cremas dental. Su sueño es más adelante tener un vehículo propio que le facilite la distribución de mercancías para la conservación de los productos que comercializa y lograr aumentar su capital de trabajo para fortalecer su negocio y con ello poder brindar a sus hijos una educación de calidad que canalice su éxito. Mientras tanto Sandra continúa trabajando con su esposo manejando una rentabilidad no menor del 22% la cual tiene como meta incrementarla, aplicando los créditos a su negocio y consiguiendo mejores oportunidades de compras que beneficien a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sandra Milena C. S., 33, lives in the Santuario neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla.  She's married and the mother of 3 children between the ages of 1 and 6.  She has her own business selling personal hygiene and home products like powders, deodorants, tooth paste, disinfectants, toilet paper, over-the-counter drugs, and groceries.  She takes cash and credit.  

The business grew out of her husband's job. He promoted similar products for a company, and when he stopped working there, he used his severance pay to start his own independent business, since he already knew the field.  He taught Sandra, too, so she could help out and they could make money together.  

This will be Sandra's first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She'll buy soaps, deodorants, powders, ant tooth paste.  Her dream is to later on have her own car to make it easier to store and distribute merchandise, and to grow working capital to strengthen the business. That way she can give her children a quality education so they can be successful.

In the meantime, Sandra keeps on working with her husband, bringing in a profit of no less than 22%, which it's her goal to increase.  She's using her loans for her business and to gain better opportunities to buy products which will benefit her customers.

loans.use: to buy soaps, deodorants, powders, and tooth paste to sell.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila  es una mujer de 44 años de edad, cuenta con un lugar propio para vivir que tiene los servicios de agua y luz, ubicado en el caserío Corral de Arena a unos 15 minutos de distancia del distrito de  Olmos  y a más de una hora de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los habitantes del distrito de Olmos y zonas aledañas o cercanas  se dedican a la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Lucila se dedica desde hace unos años al servicio de la venta de comida en su pequeño restaurante que ha colocadoen la parte anterior de su misma casa para mayor seguridad delmismo en el caserío Corralde Arena. Sus clientes son personas que han venido de otros lugares a vivir ahí y desean degustar de comidas típicas (por ejemplo cuy con papas sancochadas) de la sierra de Ayacucho, por eso el nombre que le ha colocado a su restaurante ( ¨El rinconcito Ayacuchano¨), también da pensión a los que trabajan en el área de agricultura.  Con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de sus platos de comidad trata de solventar sus gastosdiarios.

Por eso ha solicitado a Edpyme Altyernativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar insumos para la preparación de su platos y así pueda ofrecer una variedad de comidas y no unas cuantas, también va utilizar éste préstamo para mejorar la infraestructura de su negcio para que las personas que lleguen a comer allí se sientan cómodos, satisfechos con la atención y la comida.  Al tener mejoras en su negocio va poder tener más clientes y  tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Lucila con su trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante se ha ganado la confianza y el respeto de sus vecinos, demostrando que cuando uno tiene un sueño lo puede lograrlo con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
texts.en:
Lucila is a 44 year old woman who has her own place to live that includes the basic services, running water and electricity, located in the Corral de Arena settlement, 15 minutes from the Olmos district, and more than one hour from the Chiclayo province.

Lucila has been selling food for several years from her small restaurant located in the rear part of her house for better security.  Her customers are who have lived in other places and want to have typical foods from the Ayacucho region (such as Guinea pig with potatoes).  This is why the restaurant is called “El Rinconcito Ayacuchano.”  She also provides for the pension fund for those who work in agriculture in the area.  She tries to pay the daily expenses with the income from the food.

She has requested a loan of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Altyernativa, so that she can prepare her dishes and be able to offer a variety of foods to her customers.  She will also use the money from this loan to improve the business’ infrastructure so that the people who go to eat will feel satisfied with the service as well as the food.  By improving the business, she will have more customers and a better quality of life.

Lucila, with her work and desire to get ahead, has earned her neighbors’ trust, showing that when one has a dream, one can achieve it through hard work and dedication.

loans.use: to improve her restaurant

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet sells rice, sugar and wheat flour. She is 36 years old and is married with one child who does not go to school. Janet borrowed a loan to stock more rice, sugar and wheat flour to sell. She hopes to buy a piece of land in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more rice, sugar and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Enoc David

texts.es:
Enoc, tiene un taller de carpintería, este oficio lo aprendió hace 20 años cuando ayudaba a su padre, actualmente no tiene un horario de trabajo, pues el taller está ubicado en su propia casa, Enoc, está casado y tiene tres hijos de 5, 4y 1 años de edad.
Él necesita invertir en la compra de madera de cedro, pintura, pegamento y clavos, para esto solicita un préstamo que le permita realizar la inversión,  teniendo la posibilidad de aumentar la fabricación de muebles y brindando un mejor servicio a los clientes.
Sus aspiraciones son fortalecer el taller con todos los materiales necesarios, atender a muchos clientes y fabricar más muebles de calidad.
texts.en:
Enoc has a carpentry workshop and learned his trade 20 years ago when he helped his father.  Currently he has no fixed work schedule since his shop is set up inside his house.  Enoc is married and has three children, ages 5, 4 and 1.

He is in need of buying cedar wood, paint, glue and nails and is requesting a loan to carry out the investment.  This will enable him to increase furniture production and improve customer service.

His goals are to strengthen his shop by stocking all kinds of materials, make quality furniture and attend to his customers.

loans.use: To buy cedar wood, paint, glue and nails.

loans.name: Juan Orlando

texts.es:
Juan Orlando desde hace muchos años trabaja en la venta de frutas, esta labor la aprendió de su padre, ya que gracias a este negocio su padre sacó adelante toda su familia.

El negocio de Juan Orlando se encuentra ubicado en el andén de su casa y para poder ampliarlo necesita un crédito que le permita comprar legumbre y así tener diversidad de productos y nuevos clientes.

Con su negocio él ha podido tener el sustento diario de su familia y les puede brindar un buen una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juan Orlando has sold fruit for many years.  Juan learned this business from his father who supported their whole family this way.  Juan Orlando has his business in front of his house and he needs a loan so he can expand it.  He will buy legumes and a variety of products to diversify what he sells which will enable him to gain more customers.  He has supported his family with this business and provides them a good life.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of items.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhin, age 30, is married with two children who attend school. Her husband is a motor taxi driver in the community. 

Mrs. Chhin is a domestic rice trader and she rents a small store where she operates her rice-selling business. She always buys rice in bulk at a wholesale price from her suppliers, and then resells it at a profit. Usually Mrs. Chhin earns around $2.50 a day to meet the needs of her family. For more income, Mrs. Chhin needs capital to purchase more rice to sell. 

In the future, Mrs. Chhin hopes she can buy her own store.  She also wants to support her children's education by putting them through a university.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Nueva Esperanza, es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, actualmente cuenta con 14 miembros. Todas ellas son vecinas y amigas de la ciudad. Se unen con un objetivo en común, que es la obtención de mayores ingresos para la manutención de sus casas.
La Sra. Petrona, se dedica a la venta de leche, por medio de este trabajo ella puede solventar todos los gastos que tiene. Manifiesta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que se levanta a muy tempranas horas para repartir los lácteos, ya que los clientes se lo demandan.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas lácteos, con lo cual podrá asegurar el cumplimiento de las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee called “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) is from the city of San Ignacio; it currently has 14 members.  All of them are neighbors and friends from the city.  They meet with one common goal: to obtain higher income for the support of their households.

Petrona sells milk.  Through this work she’s able to cover her expenses.  She states that the work is very demanding because she must rise very early to deliver the dairy products because her customers so require.

She asks for the loan to buy more dairy products in order to continue to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy milk to resell.

loans.name: Mayra Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mayra, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene dos hijos de 9 y 4  años, el mayor estudia en escuela mientras que al menor lo deja en una guardería por su trabajo. Su esposo es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga trabaja en una fábrica de atún en la ciudad de Manta pero adema de eso también tiene un bar en su casa, ella vende golosinas,  helados, colas, jugos, aguas, cervezas entre otras cosas, nos cuenta que ella atiende su negocio en las tardes una vez que llega de su trabajo y en los días libres aunque de vez en cuando su mamá le ayuda en su negocio. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio más de 4 años y que este le sirvió mucho para tener para sus gastos. 

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar helados, sodas, energizantes, cervezas, entre otras cosas. Lleva 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales como los créditos emergentes por ejemplo.
 
Su sueño es tener una gran despensa.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in the La Sequita parish, which belongs to the Montecristi cantón, which is a prosperous cantón of Manabí. It is known as the birthplace of the “Old Fighter”, Eloy Alfaro. It is also famous for the straw hats that are well-known in and outside the country.

This is where we meet Mayra. She is 26 years old, married, and has two children who are 9 and 4 years old. The oldest studies at school, while the younger one goes to a kindergarten at her work. Her husband is a salesman. 

Our friend works in a tuna processing plant in the city of Manta, but in addition to this she also has a pub in her house. She sells sweets, ice creams, sodas, juices, water, and beer, among other things. She tells us that she tends her business in the afternoons when she gets home from work and on her free days, though sometimes her mother helps her with the business. She says she has had this business for more than 4 years and that it has helped her a lot in meeting her expenses.

She will use this loan to buy ice creams, sodas, energy drinks, and beers, among other things. She has been in the communal bank for 8 years and she likes the additional benefits, such as emergency loans, for example.

loans.use: to buy ice creams, sodas, energy drinks, and beers, etc.

loans.name: Sara Elena

texts.es:
Sara  era empleada de un restaurante cuando  al poco tiempo decidió empezar su negocio propio, hizo un préstamo familiar  y poco a poco fue creciendo. Su Restaurante (Venta de Encebollados) está ubicado en su domicilio en  una zona  periurbana donde la inseguridad está a la orden dia, ya que refiere que hace pocos días asaltaron a un cliente que estaba comiendo en su restaurante.
Ella se levanta a las 4 am  de la mañana para cocinar la yuca, el pescado  con la ayuda de su hijo, prepara las mesas y adecua el lugar.
Ha sido duro para ella estar sola en la crianza de sus hijos ya que está divorciada, pero está intentando conseguir el préstamo  y comprar ollas, Cocina, Mesas para seguir acrecentando sus ingresos, para que el negocio prospere y así cumplir su sueño de tener un local en el centro de la ciudad, arreglar su casa y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en la mejor herencia que los padres pueden dejar, el estudio.
texts.en:
Sara used to work at a restaurant but soon decided to begin her own business.  She started out with a family loan and was able to continue to grow.  Her restaurant (Venta de Encebollados) is located at her house in an area of the city that is a bit unsafe.  A few days ago a customer eating at her restaurant was assaulted. 

She gets up at 4:00 a.m. to cook yucca and fish.  Her son helps set up the tables and get the place ready.

Since her divorce it has been hard for her to raise her children, but she is trying to obtain a loan to buy pots, a stove and tables to continue earning an income and growing the business.  Her dream is to open a restaurant in the center of town, fix up her house, and making sure her children get an education.

loans.use: To buy pots, a stove and tables.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and bamboo for her fishing business. 

Imelda has been in this business for seven years. She earns additional income from a variety store. 

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and bamboo

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 45 years old and single. He helps his parents provide for the needs the family, including his siblings' education. Emmanuel did not have the opportunity to go to college.  He is willing to make sacrifices for his siblings and he hopes they will also help him at times when he's in need.

He has been a "tricycle" (motorcycle taxi with sidecar) operator for about six months, and earns about 180 Philippine pesos (PHP) per day. It is not much, but Emmanuel says, ”It is better to gain a little than to gain nothing”.

Emmanuel plans to use this 6,000 PHP loan to buy oil and paint for his motorcycle taxi.  He also plans to use part of the loan to purchase gasoline.

loans.use: to buy oil, gasoline, and paint for a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Eliza's Group

texts.en:
Eliza is the leader of this group.  She is 41 and married to a farmer.  Together with her husband she brings up two daughters and three sons.  Two younger children are preschool age (under seven) and the other children are students.  The older son helps his parents in farming.  

In order to earn money the family cultivates agricultural products.  This year they grew two hectares of potatoes.  Eliza applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase fuel for collecting the harvest and to buy potato packaging bags.  In the future Eliza wants to get another loan to purchase apples and pears for resale.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy potato packaging bags and fuel

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana es una mujer de 55 años soltera, no tiene ningún tipo de educación formal. Tiene un hijo de 12 años quien está estudiando. Además mantiene y cuida a dos sobrinos que viven con ella desde hace algunos años. Los cuatro viven en la parroquia "Luz de América" en el cantón "Santo Domingo". Santo Domingo es cantón y ciudad de la nueva Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, que era parroquia rural de Quito,  Santo Domingo está entre la costa y la sierra del Ecuador, punto de enlace entre Quito, Guayaquil, Portoviejo,  y otras ciudades importantes. Situado en los flancos externos de la cordillera occidental, así como en la planicie costeña inferior a los 1000 msnm, es la zona de mayor pluviosidad del país. Tiene una gran riqueza hidrológica: existen cinco cuencas y micro cuencas importantes. Es una zona climática lluviosa subtropical, posee una temperatura promedio de 22 °C.

Juliana trabaja en el campo, plantando cacao y criando animales, dice que este oficio lo aprendió de su familia y que lo ha venido realizando toda su vida. Trabaja todo el día a todas horas, a veces le ayudan sus hijos. Quiere invertir en plantas de cacao y abono de esta manera podrá obtener un mejor ingreso. Considera a sus sobrinos como sus hijos y al igual que al suyo propio quiere verlos profesionales. Es su primer crédito con Fundación Alternativa y durante la entrevista le contó al oficial de crédito que lo que le gustaba de esta institución era que le hacían "sentir importante". 

Su sueño es poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y sobre todo poder seguir trabajando para que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Juliana is a 55 year old single woman with no formal education. She has a 12 year old son who is in school. She also supports and takes care of two nephews who have lived with her for a few years. The four of them live in the parish of Luz de América in the Santo Domingo canton. Santo Domingo is a canton and city n the new province if Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, which was a rural parish of Quito. Santo Domingo is between the coast and the sierra of Ecuador. It connectsQuito, Guayaquil, Portoviejo,  and other important cities. Located on the flanks of the Western range and the coastal plane below 1000 meters above sea level, it is the rainiest zone in the country. It has great hydrological wealth: there are five important river basins and mini-basins. It is in sub-tropical rainy climate and has an average temperature of 22 °C.

Juliana works in the field planting cacao and raising animals. She says she learned this trade from her family and has done it all her life. She works all day long and sometime her children help her. She wants to invest in cacao plants and fertilizer so she can have more income. She considers her nephews as her own and along with her son she wants them to have a profession. This is her first loan with Fundación Alternativa and during the interview she told the loan officer that she liked the institution because it made her "feel important". 

Her dream is to be able to give her family a better quality of life and above all to keep working so that her children lack for nothing.

loans.use: to buy cacao plans and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jenelie

texts.en: Jenelie is 24 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She works very hard at her fishing business and is applying for a loan for PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy new equipment. She has been in this line of work for five years and would like to save enough money to buy a new fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy new fishing equipment.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 31 years old . She is a single mother with one child. Juliet has a stall that displays her products like cooked viands, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for almost three years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy ingredients for the menu of the day and to save for the improvement of her stall. Juliet has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Juliet hopes to improve her business so that she can pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the menu of the day

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 38 years old. He is married to Wilkister and together they have three children. He sells jikos, metal boxes, and sufurias. He has been in the business for the past six years. He gets a monthly income of KES 9,990 from the business.

This is his first loan term from KADET. He will use the loan amount to purchase metallic boxes for resale. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children.

His dream is to educate his children to the college level and build a home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase metal boxes for resale

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is 38 years old and lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and two children. Her husband earns a living selling rubber.

Hanh started her own business selling gas in 2001. This business helps her to get a steady income to cover her family's everyday expenses. Hanh would like a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of gas tanks from different suppliers. She hopes this will enabL. her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enabL. her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy gas tanks from different suppliers.

loans.name: Abdella

texts.en:
Abdella is a 37-year-old business man, who lives in Juba. He is married and has two children between the ages of one and seven. The children go to school. 

Abdella runs a cosmetics store business, and he has been in the business for two years. He has no employees. Abdella heard about Finance Sudan through the outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 2,000 to purchase more cosmetics like, Caro light, Rubbi, and many others. In addition to this business, Abdella has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Abdella would like to hope for an increase in the business and in sales in the shop.

His major challenge is only the competitors, but he says, "We shall compete with them."

Abdella says that he and his friends have a lot of thankfulness to Finance Sudan for helping them start up their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en: Gantumur is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger (yurt) in the Dornod province of Mongolia. Her husband is a plumber. Both of her children attend school with her eldest child in college. She started her grocery retail business in 1997 by renting a counter in a market. She is a respected businesswoman in the market. Over the years, she has gained many regular customers and trusted suppliers. Her business income has been relatively the same ever since she started her business. She expanded her business by renting one more counter in the market. However, she is lacking supplies to run the counter. Therefore, she is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy supplies. She is a sharp and diligent woman who says, "Things are getting pretty tight since my son joined college. I have to [do] everything I can in order to support my child."

loans.use: to buy supplies for her grocery counter in the market.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS ORQUIDEAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luisa; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropas interiores como polos, truzas y medias, la socia tiene una tienda donde trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de ropas interiores. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar truzas, polos y medias al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luisa belongs to the "Las Orquideas" communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, which is part of Cusco province, in Cusco department.

She is 48, single, and has six children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling underwear, such as T-shirts, underpants, and stockings. The borrower has a store where she works from 9:00am until 6:00pm. By means of this business, she is raising her children. 

Her dream is to expand her business selling underwear. She is applying for the loan to buy underpants, T-shirts, and stockings at wholesale. The borrower is happy about the loan, and promises to make her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy underpants, T-shirts, and stockings at wholesale.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Meet 35 -year-old Hassan from Goderich in the western area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with four children between the ages of three and 10 years. Two of his children are currently attending school. His other source of income comes from commercial bikes. In 2004, Hassan established his building material store. He began his business because he needed a permanent source of income. He works at his business 30 days every month. Even though his customer base has grown, his operating capital is not sufficient for maintaining an inventory of products with high turnover.

Hassan requires a loan in order to buy more building materials such cables, fitting, shovels, head pans, toilet seats, paint, iron rods, and cement. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to solve one of his eye sight problems, make greater profits, and improve his family's welfare. In the future, Hassan plans to open an outlet in another location in the same community. He thanks you for your support

loans.use: To buy more building materials such as cables, fitting, paint, iron rods, and cement.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Karla Vanesa es una emprendedora exitosa y una persona trabajadora, luchadora que ha sacado a su familia adelante con mucho esfuerzos, este negocio lo inicio con sus propios fondos para emprenderlo que es la venta de variedad de ropa y cosméticos. Karla Vanesa ha trabajado con Fundación León 2000 con créditos que se le ha brindado y que ellas nos expresa  que gracias al apoyo ha aumentado su inventario y de igual manera sus clientes que la visita, ella sueña con tener su propio local para que la visiten sus clientes fijos y eventuales. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para incrementar su inventario en la compra de ropa, pantalones, camisas, cosméticos, trajes y ropa interior que son buscados por sus clientes.
texts.en: Karla Vanesa is a successful entrepreneur and a hardworking person.  She’s moved her family forward with much effort and dedication.  She started the business selling clothes and cosmetics with her own funds.  Karla Vanesa has been working with Fundación León 2000 loans she’s gotten and she states that thanks to the support her inventory has grown as well as the number of customers who visit her.  She dreams with having her own locale where her regular and walk-in customers can visit her.  At present, she is requesting a loan to increase inventory.  She will buy pants, shirts, cosmetics, suits and underwear which are sought after by her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with five children between the ages of 10 and 22 years old. She describes herself as determined and hardworking.  Amina operates a retail business where she sells juice; she has been involved in this business for three years.  Amina’s business is located near a school and her primary customers are students. Her biggest business challenge is the low purchasing power during cold season. 

Amina will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy passion fruit to make juice.  Amina's business goal is to run several similar retail juice outlets within five years.

loans.use: To purchase passion fruit to make juice to sell.

loans.name: Moulaye

texts.fr:
Moulaye est un éleveur avéré qui exerce le métier depuis plus de 20 ans. Il fait de l’embouche ovine, métier qu’il a choisi par pure amour, la preuve il faut voir sur  la photo comment il est entouré par ses bêtes. 
Monsieur  Moulaye est marié et père de famille ; et c’est grâce aux revenus de son activité qu’il entretien son foyer.
Moulaye est à son 3ème crédit et sollicite un crédit de 200000F CFA afin de pouvoir acheter 7 moutons  et les revendre à l’approche des fêtes de Tabaski. Dans l’avenir, il envisage de chercher des fonds pour financer ses activités à un niveau plus élevé.
texts.en:
Moulaye is a professional livestock breeder who has been working in this field for over 20 years.  He fattens sheep, an activity he chose because he simply loved it (the photo shows how much he likes to be among his livestock...).

Moulaye is married and has a family. Thanks to his income, he supports his household.

This is Moulaye's third loan.  He is requesting 200,000 CFA francs for the purchase of seven sheep which he will resell before the Tabaski holiday ("Feast of the Sacrifice").

In the future, he would like to have more funds, in order to finance his activity at a higher level.

loans.use: to buy sheep, and raise them for resale.

loans.name: Katatei

texts.en:
Nkitarri is 39 years old, married to Leposo and supports a family of eight members. 

She is  a wheat farmer and she has been in the business for the last five years. Her monthly income is KES 45,000.

She is currently servicing her fifth loan from KADET of KES 80,000 that will help her to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides. She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. Her future dreams is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Jodel

texts.en: This loan helps Jodel get connected to his local prepay microgrid. Jodel, 27, lives in a small pink wooden house in Les Anglais, in southern Haiti. He is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to be able to pay for electricity from his local microgrid. He would like to power a TV, freezer and radio with this electricity. Mainly, he is looking forward to this electricity source as it will allow him to save money - Jodel will now be able to benefit from a reliable, durable, and clean power source. After running pilots since 2012 that proved the benefits of prepay quality electricity to people in Les Anglais (first with 14 households, and up to 54), EarthSpark International is developing a full-scale, solar-powered microgrid. This micro-grid is expected to meet the needs of up to 500 households. Kiva loans allow EarthSpark to increase the number of beneficiaries by reducing the up-front costs for customers, and will be repaid over time by electricity sales. To see a video of Les Anglais and the hybrid solar grid, please click here.

loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Hihotodé Alfreda Georgia

texts.fr: Hihotodé Alfreda Georgia est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain Barthélémy. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisé et trois à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble. Hihotodé Alfreda Georgia  assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales.  Hihotodé Alfreda Georgia  a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins, Hihotodé Alfreda Georgia vend de façon ambulante de la nourriture. Hihotodé Alfreda Georgia  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. En vue de renforcer davantage son activité, afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Hihotodé Alfreda Georgia  sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des pâtes alimentaires, des œufs et de l'huile végétales.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is an active young man. Alexander has his own business — he sells sunflower seeds. Alexander has two hired employees that roast and pack sunflower seeds. Alexander sells the seeds to wholesale buyers.

Alexander has a goal to develop his business further. In the future, he wants to buy his own workshop. 

Alexander is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to buy three tons of sunflower seeds.

loans.use: to buy three tons of sunflower seeds

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 29 years old, is married to Pamela and supports two children.

He is a small-scale farmer, a business he has done for a few years and it has been profitable.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to lease more land to expand his farming.

He plans to use the gained profits to repay his loan and improve his farming activity.

His hopes is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to lease more land to expand his farming.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is 35 years, a resident of Kabaale in Rakai district. He is married with three children who all go to school. Goefrey is a hard working and focused man. 

Geofrey deals in cattle fattening, which he started in 2007. He has a retail shop that supplements his family income. He works 7 days a week and 12 hours per day and started this business with the aim of supplementing on his daily income and to be able to look after his family.

Goefrey wants a loan of ugx 1,300,000 to buy veterinarinary drugs and feed for his cattle. This will fatten them and therefore increase their sales value, increasing his profit. However, his challenges are inadequate capital to expand the business, and competition.

He also appreciates the good intentions of Kiva lenders in partnership with UGAFODE to support small-scale enterpreneurs.

loans.use: To buy supplies for cattle to boost his cattle trade

loans.name: Andresita

texts.en: Andresita is 53 years old married with 5 children living in Bañadero, Ozamiz City. For a living, she helps her husband by operating a store selling goods like home use products in their village. She has been doing this for many years. Recently, she borrwed a loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC in order to purchase goods like noodles, biscuits and candies to sell. She hopes to expand her business so their family can have better living conditions in the future and for children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery stocks to sell.

loans.name: Isabel Jimenez

texts.en:
People like my food, and I like making it for them.  The happiest time in my restaurant is lunch-time when it fills up and people who know each other talk and enjoy a break before going back to work.  
We serve many traditional Honduran foods, including pinchos and refried beans.

loans.use: Buy frozen meat and dishes

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
My name is Josefina G. and I make and sell tortillas. I have had my business for 3 years and I have my children's help to distribute my products. I have a good clientel as I distribute my product in grocery stores and markets as well as by commission for reunions and parties. My business generates enough income to support my family and my goal is to expand my inventory in order to increase production. With the additional earnings I will be able to remodel my store and hire a woman to help me make the tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Josefina G. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, tengo la ayuda de mis hijos para la reparticion de mi producto, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que reparto mi producto a pulperias y mercaditos tambien hago por pedidos para reuniones y fiestas, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi invetario para tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio y contratar una muchacha para que me ayude con la produccion de mis tortillas.

loans.use: To purchase cornflour, salt, calcium, firewood, matches, coal, bags.

loans.name: Manzuma

texts.en: After Manzuma lost her husband 10 years ago, she started working at the market with the help of a friend. At that time, she had two young children. She knew from her experience with children that she would be good at selling children's clothes and shoes. By now, Manzuma feels comfortable with her business, and she goes to the wholesale market herself. She would like to open a second business site where she would be selling women’s clothes. Her son will be helping her after school. She will invest the money she has collected and will add the new loan to open the second site.

loans.use: Opening new business site

loans.name: Yadigar

texts.en:
Yadigar is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. This 42-year-old man has 2 children. His daughter is 3 years old and his son is 4 years old. His wife died and so he is bringing up his young children all alone.

For 6 years, Yadigar has sold building materials, transporting them with his own truck . Now he needs a loan of $1200 to allow him to make capital repairs on his truck.

loans.use: make capital repairs on his own truck

loans.name: Maria Israela

texts.es:
" I need to purchase merchandise for my business because our inventory is almost down to zero. Sales have fallen and I have not been able to replenish my stock. I request US$1,200.00 that will be invested in the business". “

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

“Necesito compra mercancía para mi negocio ya que esta casi vacío, debido a que han bajado las ventas y no he podido volver a comprar más” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Poeun

texts.en: Mrs. Poeun I., age 48, runs a butcher stand at the market, earning about $7.30 per day in revenue. Her husband is also a butcher and helps at the stand. They have four children, two of whom work in a garment factory making about $120 per month and two of whom are married and have moved away from home. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to increase her inventory of pork and beef to meet her customers’ growing demands and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory of meat

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en: Sharif is 24 years old and lives in south Lebanon in the region of Nabatieh. Sharif loves everything that is related to computers and his business is to provide computer maintenance. He needs to buy the required computer parts in order to make his business successful. He would also like to decorate his shop to attract more clients. Sharif would like a loan of $1000 to help him achieve this goal.

loans.use: To buy computer parts and decorate his shop

loans.name: Milegnith

texts.es:
Señora Milegnith belongs to the interim group "Jerusalén" (Jerusalem). She lives in the region and province of San Martín in the district of Tarapoto. Her house is located at 121 Pasaje Jerusalén. She has a business at 379 Mercado N. 2 Santa Rosa, which is called Almacén Santa Rosa. She sells dried, salted fish both retail and wholesale.

The opportunity to receive a loan from Manuela Ramos opened the doors for her to buy larger quantities of her products since she has a large demand. Her goal is to buy products directly from the provider to eliminate third parties, and to accomplish this, she needs good capital. With the necessary capital, she will be able to supply more clients and to fulfill her personal goals.

With this loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy 50 kilogram sacks of fish in large quantities of every variety.

Milegnith is 46-years-old, and she lives with her two children and her husband. She separated from the father of her children when they were still very young, and she had to work to be able to take good care of them. This is why she's thankful to Manuela Ramos because they offered opportunities to a woman like her to get ahead and to develop her abilities by having her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Milegnith pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Jerusalén”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en el Pasaje Jerusalén Nº 121. Desarrolla un negocio en el Mercado Nº 2 Jr. Santa Rosa Nº 379 (Almacén Santa Rosa) y se dedica a la venta al por mayor y menor de pescado seco salado.

La oportunidad de un préstamo de Manuela Ramos le abrió las puertas para comprar en mayor cantidad sus productos ya que tiene buena demanda. Su meta es comprar productos directo al proveedor sin intermediarios y para lograr ello necesita un buen capital. Con el capital necesario le permitirá abastecer a más clientes y cumplir con sus metas personales.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará pescado en sacos de 50 kilos en mayor cantidad y de toda variedad.

La señora Milegnith tiene 46 años, vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo. Ella se separó del padre de sus hijos cuando éstos estaban pequeños y tuvo que trabajar para sacarlos adelante, es por ello que agradece a Manuela Ramos porque brinda oportunidades a mujeres como ella para salir adelante desarrollando sus capacidades mediante un negocio propio.

loans.use: Purchase of fish

loans.name: Rosario Segunda

texts.en:
Rosario Segunda G. D. A. has a general store in the neighborhood of Juanjuicillo, outsiD. the main city of Juanjui, San Martin.  She started the store three years ago in a front space of her home selling commonly used goods.  She has now expanded the business to incluD. the sale of specialty goods like picture frames, school supplies, clothing, and perfume.  Loyal customers are happy they don’t need to walk into Juanjui to buy these goods and have access to store credit. 

Rosario is forty seven years old, married, and has three children.  She started the shop because she was sick of working out in the fields away from her family.  She is happy she maD. the leap because now she earns more and has more friends.  Her children are very important to her and she saves to send them to University.

A member of the community bank Maria Magdalena, Rosario is requesting a $625 loan to repay in 4 months.  With the loan she would like to buy school uniforms, rice, beer, oil, and stuffed animals.

loans.use: To buy uniforms, rice, beer, oil, and stuffed animals

loans.name: Hassiba

texts.en:
Hassiba lives in district 14 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and has one son. She is an educated woman and a teacher. She has small courses where she teaches English, Dari, and Pashto, and she has good numbers of students in her courses.

Hassiba would like to expand this little business so she wants to take an individual loan to buy chairs, desks, and other necessary materials and supplies for her courses so as to attract more students and make a good income. She is happy that she can further her business with this loan.

loans.use: To buy chairs and desks, etc.

loans.name: Trust

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Trust S.. She is married, and has four children with ages between 10 and 21. She has one dependent. In 2001, Trust established her clothing business. Trust requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothing.

loans.name: Felista's Esuvat Group

texts.en:
Felista is 31 years old and a is married woman with 4children, ages 11,8,5 and 2 years old. Felista has catering business, which she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 7am to 3pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in clothes and shoe sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Banco Mujeres De Paciencia Group

texts.en:
Y. is a bright 29-year-old woman who lives with her husband, Eliberto, and her two children (ages seven and one) in the small community of La Cienaga. With this loan she will begin selling shoes on the street, walking from place to place for almost 10 hours a day. She is excited for the extra income her new business will generate because it is very difficult to depend only on her husband. When she is not working or taking care of her children she enjoys relaxing and watching TV at a local grocery store. In the future Y. wants to buy a house for her family to live in and wants to send her kids to a good school.

Thank you for your support!

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a wife of M. A. and the mother of six children, three sons and three daughters.

All of her children are well educated. Her first son, Bashir Hussain, has a Masters degree. The next son, Sohail Hussain is in 12th standard grade. Shahid Hussain, a younger son, is 18 years old and received education until the 8th standard grade and then started a livestock business (buffalo).

Her two older daughters are married and settled in their own houses. Her youngest daughter is 21 years old and she received education until the 10th standard grade.

Naseem and her husband, A., want to give their children a good education. Her husband is a farmer. He sells wheat and rice on contract and earns a good income. Naseem is a housewife who does houseworks and sews clothes for herself.

Naseem successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution. With the first loan, she bought a buffalo. Now she is applying to buy another buffalo. Her daily income is $42 per day.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Kurbonoy

texts.ru:
Kurbonoy A. lives in the Vakhsh district. She is 40 years old and married with five children. Her family is large, and, to support it, she engaged in the business of selling cattle. Kurbonoy wants to obtain a loan in order to grow her business and to purchase another bull. She will be able to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Арзиева Курбоной проживает в районе Вахш. Возраст 40 лет ,замужем и имеет пятерых детей.Семья большая , поэтому для того , чтобы прокормить семью она занялась торговлей крупно- рогатого скота.Для развития бизнеса хочет получить кредит и купить еще одного бычка. Погашать кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mrs. Phon L. is a villager in Roka Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Son Soeun, are farmers who cultivate twice a year. They have three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory and one who is a housewife who can make a small salary. Since the two children's work place is far from house and they need to spend a lot of money on transportation, Mrs. Phon L. asks for a loan to buy a motorbike for her two children.  She hopes this can reduce her family expanses.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her two children to travel to work.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeun C. (shown with her fishing lot), 40, and her husband, Mr. Sokhan Oeun, 41, live along National Road Number Five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1990 and have one son, who is a high school student.

Mrs. Soeun and her husband have been growing rice since 1980 and started fishing in 1995. Sokhan fishes in the lake behind the village and sells the fish to villagers.  Besides fishing and farming, the couple has been raising fish for two years. Soeun raises fish in her fishing lot in the Tonle Sab River.  Now the couple needs money to buy baby fish and feed for their fish-raising business. Therefore, Soeun is requesting a loan of US $1000 to purchase feed and baby fish to raise.

loans.use: To purchase feed and baby fish to raise.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas Y. is 39 years old. She is married with three adorable children. Mukaddas is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working woman. Her years of experience raising diverse types of animals has helped her progress in spite of the bad economical situation that her family went through. Her unconditional motherly love is what drives her to work. She cares and prays every day for her animals' wellbeing so that she can offer them at a very good price at the market. 

The desire to contribute to finishing her children's education satisfactorily is what drives Mukaddas to request your help to receive a loan in order to consolidate her small business. The well-being of her family and her business are in your hands. Mukaddas and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Adizatou

texts.fr:
Madame Adizatou Traoré est agée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants , elle vit dans une famille nucleaire avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier Nangosso de la préfecture de Koutiala(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Issue d’une famille de commerçants, madame Adizatou  Traoré a été très vite initiée aux activités génératrices de revenues (car ses parents n’ont jamais voulu qu’elle fréquente l’école). Après une longue phase d’apprentissage auprès de sa grand-mère, elle décida de se spécialiser dans le commerce de céréales depuis maintenant 10 ans. La demande de la clientèle est très importante à cause du fait que le riz constitue un des aliments de base au Mali.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire cette clientèle, elle décida de faire recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis  2004. Avec une expérience de 6 prêts en solidaire de groupe  (prêt de groupe) bien remboursés ,elle est à son 2eme prêt en individuel dont le 1er s’est terminé sans difficulté.
Avec ce prêt Madame Adizatou Traoré compte acheter une tonne de riz à Niono (une des plus grandes zone de culture du riz en  république du Mali) auprès des producteurs des casiers rizicoles.
Elle vend au grand marché de Koutiala à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant, en détali et à crédit. L’activité est très rentable et a une marge bénéficiaire importante si bien qu’elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 70.000FCFA par cycle. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et contribuer aux charges de la famille. Elle souhaite prochainement ouvrir un magasin de stockage des céréales au grand marché de koutiala .
texts.en:
Madame Adizatou Traoré is 37 years old, married and has six children. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and their children in the Nangosso district of Koutiala prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Born into a family of tradesmen, Madame Traoré was initiated into revenue-generating activities at a very young age (her parents never wanted her to attend school). After a long apprenticeship at her grandmother’s side, she decided to specialize in trading cereals ten years ago now. There is a very heavy demand from her clientele because rice constitutes one of Mali’s basic foods. Anxious to better satisfy her clientele, in 2004 she decided to turn to the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). With an experience of six solidarity loans (group loans) fully repaid, she is on her second individual loan; the first having been completed with no problem. With this loan Madame Traoré intends to buy a ton of rice at Niono (one of the largest rice-growing areas in the Republic of Mali) from the growers in the rice fields.She retails the rice for cash or credit at the big market in Koutiala to a clientele consisting of both men and women. This is a very lucrative operation, with a large profit margin, such that she expects to make a profit of 70,000 FCFA ($150) per cycle. This profit will be used to repay the loan interest and contribute to the family expenses. Soon Madame Traoré hopes to open a small warehouse for the cereals in the Koutiala market.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 30 años, es madre soltera, de Shijar de 12 años de edad. Desde hace 5 años y después de haber trabajado en varios oficios, Rosario decidió incursionar en el negocio de la venta de celulares. Trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, en su stand ubicado en una de las galerías más concurridas de la ciudad. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que es muy carismática y la venta se le hace fácil, ella sabe que si sigue trabajando arduamente podrá cosechar los frutos muy pronto. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más cantidad de accesorios para celulares y así poder aumentar su venta.
texts.en:
Rosario is 30 years old and a single mother of Shijar who is 12. For the past 5 yeras and after working in various jobs, Rosario decided to start a business selling cellular phones. She works from 8 am till 9 pm in her stand in one of the busiest markets of the city. She loves her work since she is very charismatic which makes sales easy for her. She knows that if she keeps working hard, she will be able to harvest the fruits of her labors sooner. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She will use the money to buy more accessories for the phones to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cell phone accessories

loans.name: Central B1-Kimata Sarah Group

texts.en:
Namugaya I. is a creative and hardworking business lady. She has a poultry farm, offers tailoring services and at the same time  fries and sells snacks like samosas,pancakes and cassava chips in her locality. She rears both broilers and layers. 

I. is using her loan to expand her business by purchasing grower feeds for the layers. Besides good feeding, she ensures her poultry are vaccinated against diseases and are in a clean environment. This has enabled her to attract more customers since her poultry are healthy and large. I. is married with 6 children and also looks after 4 of her grandchildren. Her ambition is to expand her business to selling chicks, mature poultry and eggs on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: Purchasing grower feeds for the layers.

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Mr. Phen S. is a villager in Roka village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he grows rice. His wife, Mrs. Pao Nim, is a pig breeder. Even though they try to work hard, they earn less income than they need to support their household. 

They want to start a new business using rice to make the wine to sell. Thus, Mr. Phen S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice and wine making supplies to make the wine. He hopes to increase his income and improve their living conditions. 

He is 59 years old and the father of five children. One child is employed in garment factory, two ohters help the parents with their work, and the remaining two attend the local school. His wife is presented with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more rice and wine making supplies

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina sells bed sheets, towels, and blankets at the central market. She has been in this business for 17 years. These types of goods are in high demand. Irina is divorced and both of her children are gown up. Her daughter is married and lives separately. Irina lives with her son. 

This business is the only source of income for Irina. Irina would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to purchase 50 bed sheet sets. She knows that having good variety of product is one of the main keys in making good sales.

loans.use: To purchase 50 bed sheet sets

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phùng Thị Thọ   năm nay 55  tuổi , chị và chồng đã ly hôn hiện chị đang sống cùng hai con tại Phường Hùng Vương thị xã Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2008. Hiên tại con trai chị đã đi làm công nhân còn chị kinh doanh hàng Internet  tại nhà. Công việc kinh doanh đang ngày càng phát triển và cho thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn để nâng cấp và mua thêm máy tính mới phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Phùng Thị Thọ is 55 years old and lives with her two children in Hùng Vương ward, in the town Phúc Yên, Vĩnh Phúc province. She is divorced from her husband. Mrs. Thọ has participated in the TYM Fund since 2008. Currently, her son has gone to work as a laborer, while she runs an internet cafe in part of her home. Her business is doing very well and provides her with an income of 5,000,000 VND (292 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to upgrade her existing computers and also to buy new ones for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Internet cafe

loans.name: Faghfor Group

texts.en:
Faghfor is the group leader of the Faghfor group. There are four members in this group. They would each like to borrow money for their businesses. 
 Faghfor and Marey want to take a loan for a baking business in their house and want to buy stock for their business.  M. Amen and Pary Jan want to take a loan for their general store. They all want to see progress in their businesses and to receive a loan to make their business larger. 
They want to say that loans can help them in their businesses. They all thank Kiva for aiding the process of small loans in Afghanistan that help support poor people in this country.

loans.use: To buy stock for their businesses, viz. a bakery and a general store.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchary que significa Despierta en quechua.
Haydee es casada, tiene 54 años y 4 hijos, Haydee tiene un hotel llamado Los Cactus que esta ubicado en la Provincia D. Sucre, actividad que inicio hace pocos meses, también esta implementando un recreo.
Haydee necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. mesas.
Haydee sueña con que su ultimo hijo culmine sus estudios e implementar un modulo D. ganado vacuno.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the Rikchary Community Bank which means Wake Up in quechua. Haydee is 54 years old, married and has 4 children. Haydee has a hotel called Los Cactus that she opened a few months ago. It is located in the Sucre Province. She is also establishing a retreat.

Haydee needs a loan of 600 PEN, money she will invest to buy tables.

Haydee dreams that her last son finishes school and does a course on cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar P. has been a widow for nearly eight years. She lives peacefully in the village of San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela. She has three children: Marjie, 36 years old, was luckily to be given the chance to work abroad as a Domestic Helper, second is Lenielyn, 34 years old, who was not able to finish her secondary schooling, and third is Noel, 28 years old. All of her children are married and striving to combat life’s difficulties. Pilar and her children are helping each other to surpass every challenge in life.

Pilar has been renting a one hectare piece of farmland that she and her son, Noel, along with his family, cultivate in order to generate income for their daily needs. Sadly, their income is not enough to sustain their business and to provide their basic needs. At present, Pilar is requesting to take a loan of PHP 11,000.00 ($250 US) in order to buy fertilizers and seeds for their farming. They also require diesel fuel for a hand tractor that they are using to cultivate their farm. Pilar hopes that through the loan, she will be able to manage the entire farming from planting through to harvesting. She hopes to generate a good yield after 4-5 months from now. Pilar is praying that lenders will lend her financial support in order to earn more profit from her farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Mycel

texts.en:
“Patience and hard work is the key to the attainment of anyone’s goals” said Mycel E. of Barangay Monguia, Dupax Del Norte in Nueva Vizcaya. Mycel got married at the age of 20; unfortunately, she is already separated from her husband.  Mycel did not lose hope and continues with her life. 

She is engaged in the buying and selling of vegetables and is a dealer of AVON products. Mycel is asking for a loan amounting to PHP14,000 as additional working capital in both of her businesses. She is hoping that her business will grow towards a better life.

loans.use: Business capital

location.town: Monguia, Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es: El señor Vidal López García, tiene la edad de 44 años, habita en el barrio San José de los Ríos, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa , ellos tiene cuatro hijos , de 19,17,15y 13 años , todos estudian actualmente y en tiempos libres le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda , desde hace 21 años don Vidal es agricultor , la mayor necesidad que se le ha presentada durante este tiempo es el mal invierno , el inicio este trabajo con ayuda de sus padres y ha venido haciendo prestamos en Afodenic para hacer mejoras a su producción, este es su séptimo ciclo el cual va invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder obtener una buena cosecha y vender a mejor en el mercado
texts.en:
Sir Vidal L. G. is 44 years old, and lives in a neighborhood in San Jose de los Ríos in the city of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife and their four children who are 19, 17, 15, and 13 years old. His children are currently in school and help out with the farm work, too. He plans to improve the living conditions of his family. He has been a farmer for 21 years and his hardest time is during the winter when the crops don’t grow well. He began the farm work with his parents, and now needs loans to improve production. This is the seventh time that he is using a loan to improve his crop yield and sales. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers and materials so that he will have a successful crop and he will then sell his production for the best price at the market.

(Translated by Elizabeth of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and fertilizers to improve his crop.

loans.name: Twanzane Laveri Musolo Group

texts.en: Laveri M. has a retail shop which she has been operating for over three years. She is using this loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, flour, soap, salt, sweets, biscuits, etc. adding stock to her business. She is 22 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school. Laveri is a hardworking business lady and she is an example to her fellow women. Her dream is to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, flour, soap, salt, sweets, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Melenia

texts.en:
Melenia U. is from the village of Lintugop, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 42 years old. Melenia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Melenia owns & operates a nipa (palm) weaving business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from weaving & selling nipa (palm) products to local businesses and community members. Melenia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melenia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Melenia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
