Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 60 years old and married with six children. She rents items like chairs, canopies and pots, and she has been in this business for the past four years. Roseline has been borrowing from LAPO for the past two years. She hopes for a loan of 150,000 nairas to purchase more chairs, canopies and pots to rent to her numerous customers. 
She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs, canopies and pots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat de TAXI-MOTO.

loans.name: Yatt

texts.en: Yatt T., 32 years old, married woman and is the mother of one young son. She is a local farmer who has been farming since 2000. As another source of family income comes from her husband’s selling ice-cream for kids in and around his community. Yatt T. will be using a loan to grow rice crop during this coming farming season.

loans.use: To grow rice crop during this coming farming season

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 43, es una mujer muy comprometida con el desarrollo y progreso de su hogar, vive en su casa propia y su deseo es brindar a sus hijos una profesión acorde a las exigencias del mercado laboral. Su actividad económica es la venta de balones de gas, cuya venta la realiza dentro de su domicilio, atendiendo las 24 horas al día y brindando a sus clientes balones seguros con garantía, pues lo que menos quiere es ocasionar un accidente en los hogares de las personas, por lo tanto exige a sus proveedores productos de calidad para evitar problemas a futuros. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y conocer a diversas personas de su localidad, quienes se han convertido es sus más fieles clientes. Desde hace 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad y para ella lo más difícil es lidiar con clientas que no retornan los balones de gas, perjudicando de esta manera su capital de trabajo. Para el futuro desea abastecer su depósito con un gran número de balones de diversas marcas, con el fin de ofrecer a sus clientas productos de calidad y variados.
Este es su sexto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRIMA, asimismo manifiesta que la puntualidad con que siempre paga es su mayor garantía dentro de su banco comunal. María solicita un préstamo de 500 soles para comprar más balones que aumenten sus ganancias.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 23 years old and she is already married to Richard.  They have a four year old daughter named Andrea Lhei who attends a Day Care Center and she is now pregnant with their second child.  Her husband is busy on his farm located in their village in Minallo, Naguillan, Isabela. Bernadeth has a lot of dreams for her children, which is the reason why she and her husband are working hard to provide the needs of their children.  

Bernadeth is raising hogs as her way of helping her husband earn a living.  She already sold her grown-up hogs and used her profit to purchase piglets.  As a business woman, she wants to have additional capital to become more profitable.  She is now asking for financial assistance from KIVA lenders who could help her become more successful in her business. She now wants to borrow a loan of PHP10,000 to have additional funds to purchase feed and to further increase the number of her hogs. Her business is very beneficial to her family and she hopes that as times passes by, her business will continue to grow.

loans.use: Additional capital for business growth

loans.name: Sandra Bertilia

texts.es: La señora  Sandra  es  originaria  del municipio de Totonicapán su principal fuente de ingreso  es bordado a maquina  sus principales puntos de ventas son Salcaja, San Francisco el Alto  y Totonicapán, actualmente necesita un crédito  que será invertido para la remodelación de su vivienda , que consiste en la construcción de un pequeño taller ya que programado para el mes de marzo  contar con dos operarais y con ello poder mejora su producción y como su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Sandra is from the municipality of Totonicapán. Her principal source of income is machine embroidery. Her main points of sale are Salcaja, San Francisco el Alto and Totonicapán. Currently, she needs a loan that will be invested in the remodeling her house, which will involve the construction of a small workshop since in the month of March she is planning on budgeting for two workers and with them be able to improve her production and standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Juan Ramón C. es un caballero que siempre se ha destacado por trabajar mucho y llevar el sustento a su hogar siendo uno de sus principales características el velar por su vivienda. Hoy en día trabaja en el área de jardinería siendo esta actividad la que le permite obtener los ingresos para su desarrollo. 

Actualmente la vivienda del señor C. se encuentra en mal estado por lo que muy preocupadamente ha solicitado un crédito para hacer reparaciones al techo y al piso y de esta manera continuar beneficiando a su familia. Espera en que su crédito le sea otorgado satisfactoriamente y así lograr la satisfacción de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón C. is a gentleman who has always stood out for his hard work, and providing for his household is one of the main characteristics he values. Today, he works in gardening since this activity allows him to earn income for his development. Currently his home is in poor condition. Very concerned, he has requested a loan in order to make repairs on the roof and floor and in this way his family can continue to benefit from his work. He hopes that his loan is approved and thus please his family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Aneyda Del Rosario

texts.es: Aneyda es casada, trabaja como  docente en la Escuela Diriangen  desde hace 5 años,  su esposo trabaja como como agricultor y asume los gastos del hogar, está solicitando su primer crédito a AFODENIC para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (terminar de construir una habitación),  aunque no tienen hijos ellos son muy responsables con sus padres, pues siempre están pendientes de lo que necesitan, Aneyda se caracteriza por ser honesta y muy trabajadora, actualmente está estudiando segundo año en la universidad URACCAN, ella vive en un barrio el cual se está iniciando a poblar, su sueño terminar de construir una habitación para tener mejor comodidad y así gozar de mejores condiciones,  tener estabilidad laboral para cuando lleguen los hijos.
texts.en:
Aneyda is married and has been working as a teacher at Escuela Diriangen for 5 years; her husband is a farmer and is responsible for the household expenses. She is soliciting her first loan from AFODENIC to invest in home improvements (she wants to finish a bedroom). Even though they don’t have any children, they are both very responsible with their own parents since they’re always attentive to their needs. Aneyda is characterized by her honesty and hard work; she is currently studying her second year at Universidad URACCAN. She lives in a neighborhood that is beginning to be developed; her dream is to finish building a bedroom to have more comfort and enjoy better living conditions, and to have stable work when the children arrive.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bedroom

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Phin S., 44, is married and lives with her son in Takeo province. To earn a living, she has been making and selling handicraft products at the local market. She earns approximately US $2 of profit every day. Her husband is a farm worker and makes less than US $1 per day. Phin S.’s son is a taxi driver who is able to make about US $5 of profit a day. 
Phin S. would like to take out a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike to transport her craft products to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport crafts to market

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
A. Habiba is 57 years old. She is married with three children. Since she has lived with her husband, she has worked at the business of buying and selling cattle. She walks through the farms and several settlements to buy cattle at the lowest price to be able to increase her profits. She currently has two cows and two calves.

Now Habiba wants to expand her business and as her children are grown up she thinks that she will be able to looking after more cattle with their help. So she is requesting 4000 Somoni in order to purchase cattle. Habiba expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves in order to expand her business

loans.name: Oscar Bonilla Group

texts.en:
The members of Oscar Bonilla Village Bank are from the city of Linares, an important urban center in the Maule region of central Chile. “Oscar Bonilla” refers to the neighborhood within Linares that the members are from. Maule is a major wine-producing region, and wine is one of the region’s most important exports. Despite the hard-working men and women in the region, Maule continues to be one of the poorest areas of Chile.

The members of this village bank work in various different independent businesses, such as hairstyling, grocery shops, decorative arts and crafts, and the manufacturing and sale of clothing.

Amanda, a member of Oscar Bonilla Village Bank, is pictured in the first row of the photo, towards the left and wearing green. She is a retired arts teacher, and she currently gives a number of specific artisan courses on distinct techniques, such as Bauer style painting, working with clay, wood working, and macramé (decorative knotting).

Amanda plans to invest the loan in the purchase of an awning, which she can use to cover all of her materials to able to present her work more professionally. Her hope is to also have more space from which she can sell her products. For Amanda, Fondo Esperanza has helped her to support and maintain a better quality of life. The rest of the members of this village bank plan to invest their loan in supplies and merchandise, so they can continue growing their businesses and reaching their goals.

loans.use: purchase of an awning to protect her products

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La señora Benita es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor”  desD. que se formó, vive en el distrito D. Juliaca, provincia D. San Román y departamento D. Puno, tiene 46 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 04 hijos. Ella estudió hasta tercero D. primaria, se dedica a la compra y venta D. abarrotes.

Benita nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es incrementar su negocio. 

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las charlas que da la promotora
texts.en:
Benita has been a member of Dios es Amor (God is Love) community bank since it was formed. She lives in the district of Juliaca in San Román province, department of Puno. She is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has 3rd graD. education and currently works buying and selling groceries. Benita tells us that the first loan she applied for from Movimiento Manuela Ramos, for 300 PEN, helped her increase her working capital. She is now requesting 3,000 PEN, with which she will buy rice, sugar, pasta, oil, etc. Her dream for the future is to expand her business. What she likes most about her community bank are the trainings given by the field promoter.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, pasta, oil, etc.

loans.name: Romelyn

texts.en:
Romelyn D. is a married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing business and running a general store. She lives in Talusan Brgy Bulanon in Sagay City, Negros Occidental, with her 39-year-old husband Ronnie, who makes his living as a fisherman. Together, they have three children between 3 and 16 years old.
Romelyn has been a member of Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, since 2000. She has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 PHP.
Romelyn is now requesting to borrow 19,500 PHP as additional capital for her fishing and general store businesses. This will be her ninth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Romelyn aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure its future well-being by following the 'Dungganon' way.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional capital for her general store and fishing businesses

loans.name: Felix Fausto

texts.es:
El Señor Felix es un cliente antiguo que retorna desde el año 2003 despues de haber trabajado con el Grupo Solidario "Vuelo del Condor" por tres secuencias, el cliente actualmente tienen casa propia y dos autos, su actividad principal es el transporte publico de pasajeros, y como su otra actividad es el negocio familiar tiene un local en el comedor de Mallasa (frente al zoologico) donde vende parrillas y platos extras los sabados y los domingos, es por este motivo que el señor Felix solicita este credito para capital de trabajo, ya que la zona de Mallasa esta de fiesta este mes, por lo tanto todo el mes sera de festejos y ferias donde se incrementara la cantidad de visitantes elevando asi tambien la demanda por comida. El destino del credito es para la compra de verduras, papa y otros productos para la elaboracion de sus platos.

Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.					

Si quiere saber mas sobre el Zoologico de Mallasa visita la pagina http://www.soprama.4t.com/zoologicoart.htm.
texts.en:
Felix is a long time client who returned in 2003 after having worked with the Vuelo del Condor Community Bank for three cycles. He currently has his own house and two cars. His main job is public passenger transportation. His other activity is the family business in the Mallasa restaurant (in front of the zoo). He sells grilled meats and prepared meals on Saturday and Sunday. That is why Felix is asking for a loan for working capital. The Mallasa region is celebrating this month, and there will be celebrations and fairs all month. There will be more visitors and also more demand for food. The loan is to buy vegetables, potatoes, and other products for making his dishes. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given in granting the loan. If you want to know more about the Mallasa Zoo, visit this page: http://www.soprama.4t.com/zoologicoart.htm.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: María Maritza

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada 20 minutos al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella es propietaria desde hace mas de dos años de una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros). Que adquirió con un dinero que tenía ahorrado. Este vehículo es alquilado a un chofer particular para su trabajo y constituye una fuente importante de ayuda familiar, ya que los ingresos que percibe su esposo como trabajador eventual no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

El contínuo uso brindado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por este motivo ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

María es una mujer emprendedora y bastante entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir colaborando con la economía del hogar para asegurarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 42, lives with her husband and two children in Lambayeque, which is 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over two years she has owned a mototaxi (motorized, three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) that she bought with some savings she had. She leases the vehicle to a driver and this is an important source of family income because the salary her husband earns as a temporary worker is insufficient to meet family expenses. The continuous use of the vehicle has caused it to begin to show signs of wear that require urgent repair if it’s to continue running properly. This brings about the need to call upon Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, to solicit a 500 new sol loan to reach this goal. María is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to continue to contribute to the family’s income in order to insure a better quality of life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For mototaxi service and repairs.

loans.name: Tenisi

texts.en:
Tenisi M. is 38 and married with 6 children (ages 12 - 20).  She owns a business venture, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  Tenisi has many years of experience in this business.  Tenisi needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Tenisi joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Tenisi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nagina Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Nagina Parveen is from the city of Multan in Pakistan, famous for its shrines and sweetmeats. She is 51 years old, married, and has four children – two sons and two daughters. Her younger son works in a local factory for a monthly wage, and her daughters are involved in an embroidered clothes business. Her elder son sells plastic utensils in different areas of Multan and generates profit from this business.
Nagina Parveen is a very caring lady. She stays at home and takes care of her family. She has given her children good manners and teaches them about discipline and respecting their elders. She has successfully repaid her two previous loans to Kiva partner, Asasah (a microfinance institution in Pakistan). Now, she is applying for a loan to purchase plastic utensils, such as cups and plates, in bulk to expand her elder son's business.

loans.use: To purchase plastic utensils to sell

loans.name: Koffi Basile

texts.fr: Ce monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail des télévisions. Il s’approvisionne au marché  local du port autonome de Lomé où les articles sont moins coûteux, comme cela il réalise de meilleurs bénéfices sur ses ventes. Actuellement il n’a pas beaucoup de télévisions en stock raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 6 télévisions afin d’augmenter son stock. il est marié et père d’un enfant. C’est avec le revenu de ce commerce qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who operates an income-generating retail business selling televisions.  He stocks up at the local market at the Autonomous Port of Lomé where goods are less costly.  Thus, he makes a better profit on his sales.  Currently, he does not have many televisions in stock.  This is why he is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying six televisions in order to increase his inventory. He is married and the father of one child.  With the income from this commerce, he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying TV's

loans.name: Living For Purpose Group

texts.en:
Michen G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Living For Purpose. She is 43 years old, married and has three children who range from eight to 22 years. She also cares for two siblings. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For five years, Michen has been selling used clothes at the Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner, which keeps customers returning.

She plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 26,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of used clothes.

Her goal is to grow her business and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Michen is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes.

loans.name: Lila

texts.es: Lila tiene 52 años, es una emprendedora mujer que trabaja incansablemente para cumplir sus sueños, ella es soltera y vive con su hermana en casa de ella. El trabajo al que se dedica, es la venta de productos de belleza, desde hace 4 años, al igual que su hermana. Su forma de trabajo consiste en adquirir los productos de una reconocida marca de cosméticos y ofrecerlos mediante de catálogos a sus amigas y vecinas quienes prefieren los productos por ser de buena calidad y a un bajo precio. Parte de la ventaja que tiene, es que conoce los productos que tiene, y sugiere a sus clientes que cosmético debe escoger, es así que se ha ganado el cariño de sus clientes. En un futuro quiere mejorar su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de productos de belleza y así aumentar sus ingresos. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP siendo muy responsable y puntual con los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de cosméticos para las próximas festividades por el día del padre.
texts.en:
Lila, 52, is an enterprising woman who works tirelessly to accomplish her dreams. She is single and lives with her sister in her sister's home. For 4 years she has been selling beauty products, like her sister. The way she works is that she acquires the products from a well-known cosmetics company and offers them through catalogs to her friends and neighbors. They prefer these products because of their good quality and low price. Part of the advantage she has is that she knows the products well, and can suggest to the customers which cosmetics they should choose, and in this way she earns her customer's loyalty. In the future she wants to improve her business, buying a larger quantity of beauty products and increasing her income. This is her 10th loan with MFP, and she has been very responsible and punctual with her payments. With the loan she requests, she will buy a greater quantity of cosmetics for the upcoming festivities of Father's Day.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics

loans.name: You

texts.en:
The best territory of the countryside is located in Kompong Cham Province which is a good location for most Cambodia people to earn a living farming. One of these citizens, Mrs. You S. S., became a domestic farmer in the village years ago.

You S. S. built a pigpen where she breeds a few hogs and also sells them to a slaughterer when they come to maturity. She has also been depending on income from her husband’s job, who works in the construction field (he appears in the photo). This couple takes care of two school-aged kids.

You S. S. is taking out her loan to buy more piglets for her stall.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for her stall

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam D. owns a shop inside the market, a good location for her to earn an income. In her store, she stocks various groceries. She carries many items such as cooking ingredients, rice, plastic goods, snack foods, and some sweets for children. Sam D. is able to generate around US $5 / day to help cover her family's expenses. She has another wage-earner in her husband who is a military policeman. Sam D. is taking out this loan to purchase another kiosk in the market, where she will store her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase another kiosk in the market, where she will store her inventory

loans.name: Bayar

texts.en:
Bayar N. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a relative’s ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His younger daughter Munkhzul is 17 years old and attends a secondary school. His wife Sarantuya is a builder, decorator. His son Azzaya is 26 years old and he works as a security guard. 

Bayar operates a trucking business with his truck, which has a capacity of two tons. He is a very hard-working person and his business is very important to him. 

Bayar says, “As a father, I would like to be financially available to provide a good education and other necessary expenses for my children until they grow up. Also, I would like to expand my business and to purchase my own apartment for my family in the future.” 

He is requesting a loan to change his old truck.

loans.use: To change his old truck

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
NELLY SE CASO A LOS 17 AÑOS, NO TENIA NINGUN ESTUDIO Y FUE SU ESPOSO QUIEN LE DIO LA CARRERA TECNICA D. CORTE Y CONFECCION, ERA UN POKO DIFICIL AL PRINCIPIO PORQUE TENIA QUE CRIAR A SU HIJO D. UN AÑO, SIEMPRE QUIZO TRABAJAR D. UNA MANERA INDEPENDIENTE,FUE UNA AMIGA QUIEN LA MOTIVO PARA QUE NELLY ALQUILARA UN PUESTO EN UN LUGAR CENTRICO PARA PROVEER UN INGRESO ADICIONAL, Y MEJORAR SU CALIDAD D. VIDA, PARA ELLO SU ESPOSO LE COMPRO SU PRIMERA MAQUINA D. COCER (RECTA SIMPLE), QUE TIENE HASTA AHORA D. RECUERDO. NELLY EMPEZO CONFECCIONANDO VESTIDOS, FALDAS; SUS VECINOS SABIAN QUE ERA COSTURERA, Y FUERON ELLOS QUIENES RECOMENDABAN A SUS AMISTADES, POR EL SERVICIO QUE ESTA SEÑORA, ASI FUE INCREMENTANDO SUS INGRESOS, POCO A POCO, TERMINÒ ESTUDIAR SU CARRERA Y ENTONCES EMPEZO A COMPRAR CON EL TIEMPO MAS TELAS E HILOS, CON LOS PRESTAMOS QUE RECIBIO,TUVO LA OPORTUNIDAD D. HACERSE CONOCIDA EN LOS COLEGIOS A LOS CUALES LES CONFECCIONABA EL UNIFORME A LOS PROFESORES, PERO LE ERA UTIL ADQUIRIR UNA REMALLADORA, ES ASI QUE ACUD. A EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, Y SOLICITA UN CREDITO PARA OBTENER LA MAQUINA; LE FUE BIEN EN SUS VENTAS QUE CON EL TIEMPO EMPEZO A CONFECCIONAR VESTIDOS D. NOVIA, COMPROMISOS PARA EVENTOS SOCIALES.DOND. LE GENERABA DEMANDA D. INGRESOS, SUPO ADMINISTRAR SU NEGOCIO QUE LLEVÒ ADQUIRIR MAS MAQUINAS, LOS INGRESOS D. ESTE NEGOCIO LE SIRVIERON PARA EDUCAR A SUS TRES HIJOS, QUIENES SON PROFESIONALES EN LA ACTUALIDAD, ADEMAS COMPRO UN PUESTO PROPIO EN UN LUGAR CENTRICO, ACTUALMENTE YA NO OFRECE SUS SERVICIOS A INSTITUCIONES PRIVADAS PORQUE LE VA BIEN EN SU NEGOCIO.
LO QUE AHORA LE GENERA SUS INGRESOS ES PARA ELLA, SU ESPOSO Y SEGUIR APOYANDO A SUS NIETOS. EL CREDITO QUE NECESITA NELLY ES PARA COMPRAR TELAS PORQUE TIENE PEDIDOS D. VESTIDOS, POR ANIVERSARIO PATRIO DEL PERU. TRABAJAR D. ESTA MANERA LE HACE SENTIR BIEN HABER REALIZADO MUCHAS D. SUS METAS Y SEGUIR APOYANDO A SU FAMILIA EN EL NEGOCIO QUE LE GUSTA COMO ES LA CONFECCION.
texts.en:
Nelly got married at age 17. She didn’t have a formal education and it was her husband who taught her how to sew and manufacture clothing. It was a bit of a challenge at first, because she also had to care for her one year old son. She has always wanted to work on her own and it was a friend who encouraged her to lease a workshop in a central location. This allowed her to earn additional income and improve her quality of life. Her husband bought her first sewing machine (basic), which she still keeps as a memento. Nelly began making dresses and skirts. Her neighbors knew that she was a seamstress and it was they who recommended her services to their friends. She began to increase her income little by little, completed her studies, and over time began buying more fabrics and thread with the loans she received. She had the opportunity to become well known in the various schools, where she maD. uniforms for teachers, but it became necessary for her to acquire a chain stitch sewing machine. For this reason she approached Edaprospo-Prosperidad to request a loan in order to buy the machine. Things went well for her and she began making wedding gowns and formals. This generated additional income for her. She did a good job managing her business and was able to buy more machines and the income provided her the means with which to pay for her three children’s education. They have all achieved professional careers. She was also able to buy her own workshop in a central location and no longer offers her services to private institutions because her business is doing very well. The income she now earns is for herself and for her husband, and to treat her grandchildren. Nelly will use the money from this loan to buy fabric because she has orders for dresses for the Peruvian Independence Day. It makes her feel good to have achieved most of her goals and to continue to be able to support her family by running the business she enjoys; dressmaking.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es: Damiana, de 39 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 3 jóvenes hijos, que le ayudan en las labores agrícolas. Desde que se quedo sola a cargo de sus 3 hijos, se propuso trabajar con más dedicación, y así siguió con la siembra de papa y olluco en sus chacras que son propias, y cuando sus hijos estuvieron jóvenes empezaron a ayudarle en tan sacrificada labor. Desde entonces los 4 trabajan cada día para salir adelante, vigilan con mucho cuidado sus cultivos, sobretodo de las plagas de insectos que muchas veces malogran producciones enteras. Durante la época de cosecha recoge toda la producción y la traslada hasta donde están los mayoristas de la ciudad, que le ofrecen regulares precios por la calidad de sus productos naturales. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado comprar algunas cabezas de vacas para criarlos y poder comercializar su leche, además quiere terminar de construir su casa. Es el onceavo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual en el pago de todas sus cuotas pues esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible este crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso, también  esta muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su grupo comunal pues esta integrado por personas muy solidarias y responsables. Tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes y abono, además destinará una parte del préstamo en la paga del jornal de los operarios que ha contratado para que la ayuden en la siembra.
texts.en:
Damiana is 39 years old. She lives in her own house with her 3 young children who help her in her agricultural work. Ever since she found herself raising 3 children alone, she decided to dedicate herself to her work even more. She continued planting potatoes and olluco in her own fields. When her children were young, they began to help her in this very laborious work. Since then, the four of them work every day to get ahead. They watch over their crops very carefully, especially guarding against the insect pests that often ruin entire crops. During harvest, she takes all of the prudiction and transports it to the wholesalers in town, who offer regular prices for the quality of her natural products. Since she is a very enterprising woman, in the future she plans to buy some heads of cattle in order to raise them and sell their milk. She also wants to finish building her house. This is the eleventh loan that she has with MFP and she promises to make all the payments on time because she is very grateful to the people who made this loan possible which will allow her to continue working and looking to progress. She is also very satisfied with the work in her community group because it is made up of people who are very supportive and responsible. She plans on investing the loan she has asked for in buying organic and chemical fertilizers. A portion of it will also be used to pay for the work of the laborers whom she has hired to help in the planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for the laborers who help in the planting.

loans.name: Gloria Fabiola

texts.es:
La Señora Gloria Fabiola G. es socia del banco comunal Tres Marías, vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca por el sector del Control Sur, la mayor parte de su población buscan en la ciudad una mejor oportunidad de trabajo para mejorar sus situaciones económicas.
 
La Señora Gloria se dedica a la comercialización de zapatos, lleva 7 años en este negocio, trabaja recorriendo diferentes lugares de la ciudad ya que no cuenta con un puesto propio, su horario de trabajo es de 9:30 a.m. a 2 p.m. de domingo a domingo.
 
Doña Gloria tiene de 32 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 18, 13, 9 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo estudia en la escuela de la ciudad, su esposo también es comerciante de zapatos, la casa en la que habitan no es de su propiedad por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Lleva 5 años trabajando en la banca comunal y los créditos otorgados le han beneficiado mucho en su negocio para la compra de mercadería, el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir para surtir más mercadería.
 
Su meta es llegar a tener un  almacén de calzado.
texts.en:
Ms. Gloria Fabiola G. is a member of the Tres Marías communal bank. She lives in the suburbs of the city of Cuenca, in the Control Sur sector. Most of the population of Control Sur looks to the city for better opportunities to work and improve their economic situations. Ms. Gloria sells shoes. She has been working in this business for 7 years. She works by walking through different places around the city, as she does not have her own stand. Her work schedule is from 9:30 a.m. to 2 p.m. from Sunday to Sunday. Ms. Gloria is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 18, 13, and 9 years old. Her two older children are studying in high school, and her youngest son studies at a school in the city. Her husband is also a shoe salesman. The house where they live is not their own, as they are renting it. She has been working with the communal bank for 5 years and the loans she has been granted have really benefited her business by allowing her to purchase merchandise. She is going to invest this new loan from Fundación ESPOIR to stock more merchandise. Her goal is to have a shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina A. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Tagasa, Bitoon, Daan Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store.  Her husband Manuel A., who is 47 years old, works as a Roving Guard to earn his living. They have five children who are 3 to 15 years old. Gina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so she can continue to save for her business and her children's education. Gina A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at Kiva.org.


"

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana F. sells doughnuts and chips at Abura. She will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare doughnuts to sell. Joana uses her income to pay utillity bills. 

Joana has two children and her husband is a driver. She has received a junior high education. With the revenue from her extended business, Joana plans to re-invest in her business.

In this picture, Joana is sifting the flour that she will use to make a fresh batch of doughnuts.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to prepare doughnuts to sell.

loans.name: Primo

texts.en:
Primo P. is from Oroquieta City. He is 27 years old. Primo is single. To make a living, Primo owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating these services. Primo has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Primo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Primo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Primo is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Primo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Đinh's Group

texts.en:
Quý Đinh Thị (20213020007) is a 37 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Quý is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is An Tập 01 (Nhóm 01).


Quý is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Quý owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling herbs & spices in the local community.  Quý has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Quý joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Quý has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Quý  from SEDA.  Quý plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Đặng Thị T. (0) is a 58 year-old female who is requesting a 6,048,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


2.  Chu Thị T. (0) is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Quý Đinh Thị (20213020007) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Quý là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là An Tập nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thảo mộc & gia vị trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Quý thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Quý kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  Vào 2008, Quý đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Quý đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.048.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Đặng Thị T. (0) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


2.  Chu Thị T. (0) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase herbs & spices to sell

loans.name: Lonie

texts.en:
Lonie C. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Lonie is separated from her spouse and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lonie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling junk food, candies, biscuits & snacks like rice cakes in the local community. Lonie has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lonie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lonie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lonie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to buy and sell

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a 59-year-old mother of four grown children. She has run her own daycare since 1990. Originally she lived and ran her business in northern Israel but during the recent war she was forced to close her daycare since her clients all evacuated the area for security reasons. During the war Sylvia ran into trouble with the bank. She never had a history of economic difficulties before but the war and the difficult situation in the north had their effect.

She relocated to central Israel and has reopened her daycare this year. During 2010 she became certified by the municipality and is promised clients with payments through the city. Sylvia wanted a bank loan but was unqualified due to her past problems during the war. She took this loan to purchase cribs, toys and additional supplies.  

Sylvia knows she has a promised flow of children through the municipality.  She hopes to move to a location with a garden attached to her daycare in the future and continue thriving in her business. With her children grown she looks forward to helping them establish their homes and helping them economically.

loans.use: To purchase cribs, toys and other daycare supplies

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La señora Cristina  es un cliente que esta desde la gestión 2006,  la cancelación de sus créditos fue buena y puntual, es una cliente con buena actitud, ella se dedica a la venta muebles  junto a su esposo, ellos fabrican los muebles en su mismo domicilio se encuentra la carpintería, la señora cristina no solo vende los muebles sino también los elabora , ella trabaja junto a su esposo en la carpintería lijando y barnizando. En la ciudad de la Paz Bolivia una de las características de la mujer es el empuje en el trabajo, las mujeres trabajan desde choferes hasta albañiles. Hace algun tiempo la señora Cristina se sintió mal y tuvieron que realizarle una operación ahora se recupera favorablemente, la pareja no tiene hijos porque la señora cristina tuvo problemas de salud y recién se esta recuperando, pero en un futuro su deseo es poder recuperarse por completo y tener hijos el crédito será invertido en la compra de herramientas, esta agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sra. Cristina has been a customer since 2006.  She has a record of repaying her loans on time and she is a popular customer of the bank.  Cristina operates a furniture business with her husband. She not only builds furniture but sells it too.  They make the furniture in a workshop at their house. She works with her husband in the shop, polishing and waxing.  One of the characteristics of women in La Paz is their dedication to finding work.  They do everything from driving cabs to construction work.  Cristina was ill a few years ago and had to have an operation.  She's mostly recovered now but the couple has been unable to have children because of her health problems.  She hopes that she will completely recover soon so that she can have children.  Cristina will use this loan to buy tools for her workshop.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they provide.

loans.use: Buy tools for furniture business.

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel is 32 years old and lives with her mother and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a brick house, in the outer ger housing districts of the city. Odgerel’s mother is retired and stays at home, while her daughter attends secondary school. Odgerel supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. 

In 2006, when she first began her business, she sold only leather belts and traditional Mongolian fabric belts. In the beginning stages of her business, she rented a stall at Narantuul from another person who had a rental contract with Narantuul. This was an unstable business situation for her because the middleman could dismiss her at any time. At the time her stall had 1 million MNT in working capital. Usually, it is very difficult to obtain a rental contract with Narantuul because the stalls are in such high demand.

However, in 2009, Odgerel had the opportunity to sign a rental contract directly with Narantuul in order to make her business more stable. Now her working capital is almost 4 million MNT, and she sells many clothing accessories like socks, gloves, hats, and belts. With this loan, Odgerel will purchase small clothing accessories from Ereen City, China. She is hoping to sell the clothing accessories to rural and urban customers who visit Narantuul before the traditional Mongolian Lunar New Year. At this time of year, it is the custom to give small gifts to family members and friends. Odgerel wants to use this loan to help support her in this very busy shopping season of the year.

Odgerel's business goal is to one day operate her own clothing shop. Odgerel also said, "It's my personal goal to support my mother and daughter so they can live happily."

loans.use: To purchase small clothing accessories for traditional Mongolian Lunar New Year

loans.name: Harselina's Group

texts.en:
Harselina G. is from the village of Maligaya, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Harselina is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Harselina is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Harselina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Harselina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Harselina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Harselina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Harselina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Harselina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Sarah Wambui

texts.en:
Sarah has been selling clothes in Olkalou town for the last nine years.  She is 44 years old, married to Benson K., and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD  by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She repaid both her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy school uniforms and women's clothing for resale.

In future, Sarah hopes to grow her clothing business into a big boutique.

loans.use: To buy school uniforms and women's clothing for resale

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a 30-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store.  She lives in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000.  Rosalie is borrowing PHP 23,000 so that she can continue to fund her business operations. This will be her 26th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosalie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya where she has been farming for 28 years. Her farm produces maize, milk and vegetables, which are sold locally. She also earns income from her business of selling timber to the local market. 

Judith is 46 years old and married with four children, whose ages range between 20 and 30 years. Two of the children are currently attending school.

She has requested a loan of 31,200Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from this loan will help her in providing for the basic needs of her family. She would like to own a pick-up truck in the near future to help her in transporting milk to the market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lilian Beatriz

texts.es:
La señorita Lilian de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene 21 años y  está cursando el 2° año de la carrera de Administración de Empresas en la Universidad Tecnológica de Comercializacion y Desarrollo.
Ella tiene 3 hermanos: una melliza de su misma edad, también universitaria, un hermano mayor que trabaja para la micro-industria familiar(Panadería) y otra hermana de 12 años.
Su madre ayuda también en la panadería, mientras Lilian se encarga del empaquetado de los productos, actividad que realiza durante la mañana ya que parte de la tarde se dedica a su estudio.
Su padre se encarga de la administración de la micro-industria familiar.
Lilian tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera y abrir su propio negocio, le encanta colaborar con la pequeña empresa de sus padres ya que ahí va aprendiendo mucho y eso le ayuda a esforzarse más y sobresalir entre todos.
Ella solicita el préstamo para el pago de su matrícula, su primera cuota de la facultad y algunos materiales que necesita.
Lilian agradece ya que esto le ayudaría en su estudio y al mismo tiempo podrá contar con referencias crediticias que en el futuro será  de mucha importancia para concretar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Miss Lilian of the city if Villarrica, is 21 years old, and is in her second year of Business Administration in the Technological University of Marketing and Development.

She has 3 siblings: a twin who is of her age and is also in the university, an older brother who works in the cottage industry (Bakery), and another sister who is 12.

Her mother also helps in the bakery while Lilian is in charge of packaging the products in the mornings since she studies in the afternoons.

Her father manages the cottage industry.

Lilian has many hopes of finishing her studies and starting her own business. She loves collaborating with her parent's small business since it is there that she has learned a great deal and that will help her strive more and succeed.

She is requesting the loan to pay for her registration, her first tuition payment, and some materials she will need.

Lilian is thankful since this will help with her education and also knows she can count on future loans references which will be important to fulfill her projects.

loans.use: To pay for her registration, her first tuition payment, and some materials she will need.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teófilo tiene 22 años, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Teófilo brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Transporte la gente en la ruta entre Olmos y sus caseríos. 

Desea realizar algunas mejoras a su vehículo que es su herramienta de trabajo. Asimismo desea comprar algunos accesorios que necesita para mantener su moto en buenas condiciones y seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y hacer algunos arreglos en su domicilio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Teófilo, 22, is single living with his family in Olmos District located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Department’s capital.

Teófilo provides passenger transportation services in his Mototaxi, a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin used to move people around.  He transports people on the route between Olmos and their settlements.

He wants to do some improvements on his vehicle which is his work tool.  He also wants to buy some accessories he needs to keep his motorcycle in good condition to continue to offer good service.  With help from the loan he hopes to increase his income and to some home improvements.  He, therefore, has considered it advisable to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Bëgg Diam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BËGG DIAM est composé de 12 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Cette cohabitation favorise la bonne entente et la cohésion entre les membres. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE NORD3

Madame AWA G. (debout tout à fait à droite de la photo, de blanc vêtue) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a aussi le charge de deux autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches.

Elle fait de l'embouche caprine. Elle va dans les marchés acheter des chèvres qu'elle embouche pendant au moins 05 mois avant de las revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires ou dans la ville. Et comme activité parallèle elle fait la cuisson et vente de beignets dans son quartier

Son crédit lui permettra d'acheter au moins trois chèvres

Son objectif est de soutenir mes enfants dans leurs études tout en augmentant mon niveau d'épargne
texts.en: The solidarity group BËGG DIAM is made up of 12 women all from the same neighborhood.  This cohabitation favors the good relationship and cohesion between the members.  The group is a member of the Montage Nord3 Banc Villageois.  Mrs. Awa G. (standing completely to the right of the photo, in white clothing) is the leader of the group.  She is 47 years old.  She is married and the mother of 5 children.  She also cares for two children who were entrusted to her by loved ones.  She raises goats.  She goes to the markets to buy the goats which she raises for five months before reslling them in the weekly markets or in town.  At the same time, she runs a business cooking and selling doughnuts in her neighborhood.  Her loan will allow her to buy at least three goats.  Her objective is to support her children in their studies, while augmenting her savings level.

loans.use: To purchase goats to raise

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO D. YANAHURA 5TO PARADERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Brigida; ella tiene 44 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. chicha (bebida a base D. maíz) y también tiene un terreno D. cultivo donD. siembra maíz y papa, la socia venD. la chicha en su casa en el distrito D. Urubamba, la socia por medio D. este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y choclos para preparar la chicha.                                  

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Brigida belongs to the San Isidro D. Yanahura 5th  Paradero Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Brigida is 44 years old, married, and has five children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling “chicha” (a drink maD. from corn).  She also has a piece of land where she grows corn and potatoes.  She sells chicha at her house in the Urubamba district.  It is through this business that she gets her children ahead.

She wants to expand her business of selling chicha.  She is requesting the loan to buy corn and corn cobs.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy corn and corn cobs to make "chicha" (a drink made from corn).

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: This client lives in Sisian together with her son and daughter-in-law. She works at school as a teacher. Unfortunately, her teacher’s salary is too low to meet the family needs. The client is also engaged in agriculture. She wants to increase her livestock and cultivate her land. With the requested loan, the client plans to purchase two calves and a special sort of potato seed. With the loan’s help, the client will increase her income and insure better living conditions for her family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for calves and special potato seeds

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es:
Ricardo, vive con su esposa, no tienen hijos y solamente él trabaja en un taller de zapatería el cual posee desde hace 30 años, trabaja en el mercado municipal, su horario es de 7:00am a 2:00pm.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para invertirlo en hule, hilos, suelas, tacones, pega y más materiales que son necesarios para la reparación y elaboración de zapatos, teniendo todos estos materiales atenderá  mejor a los clientes.
Para Ricardo el sueño ha sido instalar un taller amplio, con más capacidad, que sea más concurrido y ofrecer trabajo de calidad, así tener una mejor solvencia económica para él y su esposa.
texts.en:
Ricardo lives with his wife.  They do not have any children and he works alone in his shoe workshop which he has owned for 30 years.  He works in the town market, from 7.00am to 2.00pm.

Ricardo currently needs a loan to invest in buying rubber, thread, soles, heels, glue and other materials which he needs to repair and make shoes.  With all of these materials available, he will be able to better serve his customers.

Ricardo's dream has been to set up a spacious workshop, with more capacity, which is busier and allows him to offer good-quality work to his customers.  This would allow him and his wife to enjoy better economic solvency.

loans.use: to buy rubber, thread, soles, heels and glue

loans.name: Cristian Maria

texts.es: Cristian Maria de 51 años, ella se dedica a vender mercadería en general, anteriormente ella solo vendía ropa y perfumes, Comenzó hace 11 años con el paso del tiempo fue adquiriendo experiencia y decidió comenzar a vender otras cosas, ella siempre ha sido una persona muy triunfadora y que no  se deja  abatir por las malas situaciones. Trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de tarde, por lo que siempre tiene una gran variedad de clientes que le solicitan diferentes productos. Con este financiamiento comprara más mercadería como sabanas, perfumes, pinturas de labios, polvos, cremas entre otros.
texts.en: Cristian Maria is 51 years old. Now a retailer, she started her activity 11 years ago by selling clothes and perfumes only. In time she gained experience and so she decided selling other things. She has always been a industrious woman, who never lets bad situations get the best of her. She works from 7 am to 6 pm, and she always has a wide variety of customers asking for different products. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more products such as bed sheets, perfumes, lipsticks, face powders and creams.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets sabanas, perfumes, lipsticks, face powders and creams.

loans.name: Vet

texts.en:
Vet, 33 years old, is a grocery seller. Her husband is a guard at Angkor Wat temple. Their income is $7 per day. They have three children; one is also a guard but in different place from his father. 

Every month, Vet spends around $66 on expenses for the family. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy columns for repairing her house. Her house is so short that it makes her feel uncomfortable to stay and hard to keep things in a proper place. She wants to buy more goods to sell as now she has little inventory and does not meet the needs of the customers. For her children, she commits to send them to study until they finish university.

loans.use: to buy columns for repairing the house.

loans.name: Aigle Plus Group

texts.en:
Vital is the leader of the Community Bank named “Aigle Plus” which means “Eagle” in English. It is composed of 13 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Vital is 45 years old. He has been active in his business since 2005. He began his business selling slippers. Besides selling slippers, he also sells miscellaneous goods. He joined one of Hope DRC’s groups in 2010, and has already received three loans that he repaid properly. Thanks to Hope’s loans, Vital’s business has prospered and it generates a profit of $15 per day. He intends with the next loan to increase the inventory of his business by buying slippers in bulk for reselling at a profit in order to increase his capital. His ambition is to open a slipper shop due to the high demand in his environment; He works hard in order to achieve his dream. Vital is married and the father of five children whose ages vary between 2 and 17 years old. Three of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase the stock of his goods by buying slippers in bulk and reselling them for a profit.

loans.name: Maria Subrado Group

texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old and lives in Maningcol, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children. To earn a living, Maria has a seaweed production business. She has had this business for five years. She earns about PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of work. 

Maria has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase equipment for seaweed production. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she would like to have a progressive business and better family living conditions. Maria is the leader of a 5-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for seaweed production.

loans.name: Jose Abraham

texts.es:
José tiene 58 años de edad, es viudo, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona tiene como actividad agricultura y ganadería. 

José desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que sus animales llegan a su crecimiento óptimo podrá ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así pueda obtener muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar animales de otras especies, con la finalidad de obtener más clientes e ingresos y así mejoraría  la calidad de vida de su familia.  José es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca y que su familia se supere en la vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 58 years old, a widower, and lives with his children in his own house, which has no basic services. It is located in the rural zone of Cayalti district, pertaining to Lambayeque department. This zone's economic activity is agriculture and cattle-raising.

For some years now, Jose has raised and sold cattle. His corral is located at the back of his house. He feeds them balanced cattle feed and natural grasses. Once they arrive at their optimal growth, he puts them up for sale in the different markets of the area. That's how he can obtain very good earnings and cover his family's expenses.

Jose is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 new sols to buy animals of other species, for the purpose of obtaining more customers and more income, and thus, improving his family's quality of life. Jose is a hard-working and very responsible person who is only interested in expanding his business and helping his family get ahead in life.

loans.use: buy animals of other species to raise and sell.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam, 31, is a married woman and has three children that live under her as dependents. Presently, she is in the business of pig fattening in the Baray District, Kompong Thom Province of Cambodia. From this business, she earns around $3 per day, which is apart from the additional revenue taken from her husband. Currently, her husband is a motor taxi driver who can earn an average of US$ 4 profit per day. According to her husband, his motorbike is broken and the lack of money is why she wants to request a loan in order to purchase a new motorbike for servicing clients in time. This loan will provide her with additional income to meet her family’s needs and provide more financial stability. She is very grateful to all lenders that are good and kind.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 29 years old, married to Micheal and they have one child aged four years old. She has been selling second-hand clothes for the last two years, making a monthly profit of KES 8,800. She has been loaned KES 10,000, which she plans to use to buy more stock of clothes for sale.

With the anticipated profits, she plans to purchase household items and improve her business. She hopes to build her own business premise and become a supplier of second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Teofila has a shop that sells clothing, underwear & beauty products. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock from AVON, NATASHA & MSE to sell.

Teofila has been a member of HSPFI since 2000. In the future, Teofila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from AVON, NATASHA & MSE to sell.

loans.name: Ismaila

texts.fr: Monsieur Ismaila est un jeune sénégalais de 33 ans. Il est marié et père de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 3 et 11 ans. Il évolue depuis plus de 10 ans dans le secteur du  commerce. Il s’adonne à l’achat et la vente d’appareils   électroménagers. Parallèlement  il organise une opération de vente de moutons a chaque veille de Tabaski.  Il a choisi son activité par passion et est surtout intéressé  par l’aspect lucratif de cette activité. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis décembre 2004. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de moutons à revendre pour la Tabaski qui approche. Il souhaite renforcer son fond de roulement de sorte qu’il pourra  augmenter ses bénéfices  et  améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. Ismaila is a 33 year old man from Senegal.  He is married and the father of 3 children between the ages of 3 and 11.  He has been involved in commerce for more than 10 years.   He is dedicated to buying and selling household appliances.  Along with this, he organizes sales of sheep on the eve of Tabaski.  He chose his work out of passion for it and is particularly interested in the profits to be made from it.  He has been a member of l'U-IMCEC since December 2004.  He is requesting a loan of 300,000 frs. for the purchase of sheep to be sold for Tabaski which is coming up.  He hopes to increase his working capital in order to increase his profits, and to improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy sheep to sell.

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Sarantuya is 48-years-old, and a grocery seller. She is a widow and has one daughter. They live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Sarantuya has been running a grocery store since 2008 in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar. She is a very hardworking woman and always tries to support her family and relatives. 

Recently her cousin has opened the same sort of grocery store in another district. He needs financial support to obtain the commodities for his store for the first time. As we know creating working capital is absolutely important to this kind of business. Therefore Sarantuya is taking a loan to support her cousin to purchase the food commodities for his new grocery store.

loans.use: To support her cousin to purchase the food commodities for his new grocery store

loans.name: Hassanein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, single, and lives with five family members, one of whom works.

Hassanein has been an owner of a shop since 2008, selling gifts and antiques. He has sufficient experience in this field. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $1500 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more goods. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to pay the annual rent and to add more goods.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
La señora Griselda cuenta con 27 años de edad, está casada su esposo se llama rene, quien es campesino, tienen 3 hijos José Luís, Magali y Eduardo de los cuales solo 2 estudian, están cursando primero y quinto año primaria, ya que el mas pequeño apenas tiene 2 años, ella se dedica ala venta de pollos, desde hacen 5 años.
Doña Griselda dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y con la educación de sus hijos, también para tener una mejor solvencia económica, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas pollos, para continuar con sus ventas.
Ella tiene una meta para su negocio, dice que desea hacerlo crecer muchísimo, ya que quiere construir un pequeño local, para poner una polleria y tenerla mejor surtida, para así contar con mejores ingresos.
Esta muy agradecida con los donadores de kiva y FRAC, por todo el apoyo y confianza que le están brindando, ya que gracias a esta ayuda ahora puede continuar invirtiendo en su negocio y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en: Griselda is 27 years old and is married to her husband Rene, who is a farmer. They have three children: José Luís, Magali and Eduardo, only two of which are in school since the youngest is 2 years old. Griselda has made a living selling chickens for the past five years.
