She says she decided to start this activity because she was looking for a way to support her husband with household expenses and their children's education, and also to have better economic solvency. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of more chickens so she can continue her sales. She says her goal for her business is to grow it a lot because she wants to build a small store to set up her business with more supplies so she can increase her income. She is very grateful to Kiva donors and partner FRAC for all the support and confidence they are providing. It is thanks to this she now con continue investing in her business and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
For the last 10 years Esther has been practicing farming in Limuru town. She is 43 years old and married to Stephen. They have four children.

She was introduced to KADET  LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. She paid her previous loans well and in good time. She intends to use the loan amount to prepare her farm for planting season.

In future, Esther hopes to practice large scale farming, which will increase her income.

loans.use: to prepare her farm for the planting season.

loans.name: Nemataba / Nafore Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Naforé a en son actif plus de 13 cycles depuis l’inauguration à nos jours. Il compte 13 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles  font toutes le petit commerce.

Madame Mariètou (debout à l’extrême droite)  est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 35 ans, mariée  et mère de six enfants.

Elle est  vendeuse de l’arachide, du riz en détail de plus elle fait de la restauration dans le village.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son stock de riz.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’apporter un soutien à son mari sur la prise en charge sanitaire des enfants et leur scolarisation.
texts.en:
The Naforé group has been active for more than 13 loan cycles since the beginning of this institution. It comprises 13 women who all live in the same town. They all run small retail businesses.

Ms. Mariètou (standing all the way on the right in the photo) is the group leader. She is 35 years old, married, and has six children.

She sells peanuts and rice at retail and also prepares and sells meals in her town.

Her new loan will allow her to increase her stocks of rice.

The profits will allow her to support her husband in providing for the children's health and education costs.

loans.use: To increase her stocks of rice.

loans.name: Masasuli Shg B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Masasuli SHG B Group in Western Kenya! Neddy is the facilitator of the Masasuli SHG B group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Neddy takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Neddy had a good maize yield, harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Neddy was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Neddy and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Neddy will educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Masasuli SHG B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The picture shows Neddy and her group with the field officer far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es: Cindy, de 23 años, es una joven mujer amable, trabajadora y muy luchadora, es madre soltera de un niño de 4 años y por quien trabaja día a día para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Vive en casa de sus padres a lado de ellos y de sus tres hermanos. El trabajo de Cindy consiste en la transformación de trozos de madera en producto acabado, ella produce Parquets (tablillas de 10 x 30 centímetros que se usa para decorar casas). Su trabajo lo realiza en un aserradero que alquila para producir sus productos una vez a la semana, de ahí se dedica a colocarlos en los diversos centro de venta así como los envía a la ciudad de Lima. Tiene la ayuda del padre de su hijo que le brinda el espacio y algunas cosas más para que pueda realizar su trabajo. AL principio le fue muy complicado, poder hacer esta actividad ya que es muy pesado, pero con el tiempo se dio la manera de no quedarse atrás y hacerlo ya que necesita generar ingresos para poder cumplir como madre con su menor hijo. Ahora esta en proceso de crecimiento y desea más adelante poder aumentar su producción. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual ya que no desea quedar mal con su grupo, ya que ahí son muy puntuales. Con el monto solicitado 2,500 soles, comprará madera para seguir con la fabricación de parquet, además de comprar algunos equipos que necesita para poder dar un mejor acabado.
texts.en:
Cindy, 23, is a kind, hardworking, very tenacious young woman.  She’s a single mother of a 4-year-old son who she works for to provide him a better quality of life.  She lives in her parents’ house with them and her three siblings.  Cindy’s work consists in transforming pieces of wood into finished products.  She produces parquet (slats of wood that are 10x30 centimeters used to decorate houses).  She does her work at a sawmill that she leases once a week to make her products.  She then focuses on placing them in various sales points and also sends them to the city of Lima.  Her son’s father provides her with some help.  He gives her the space and some other things to do her work.  At the beginning it was very complicated to do this kind of work because it’s very heavy work but in time she found the way not to lag behind and to do it because she needs to be a good mother to her young son.  She’s now in a growth cycle and wants to increase production later on.

This will be MFP loan #2.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support because she’ll feel surer about advancing with her business that way.  On the other hand, she commits once again to make her installment payments in a punctual way because she does not want to disappoint her group because they are all very punctual.  She will use the requested 2500 soles to buy lumber to continue manufacturing parquet and will also buy some equipment she needs to produce better finishing touches.

loans.use: to buy lumber and tools.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina is 33 years old, married, and has two children.  She has been in the farming business for the past ten years, earning a monthly income of Kes 15,000 which she uses to support her family.

Albina is applying for her first  loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will increase her income and improve the living standard for her family.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Sophy, 44, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables and fruits for over six years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a construction worker. Two of her children are employed at a garment factory. Because the factory is far away from home, Sophy requests a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work. In the future, she would like to build a new house and support her youngest child to study to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work

loans.name: Jenny Patricia

texts.es:
Jenny, se dedica  a la venta de pupusas, vive con su esposo, tienen dos hijos de 6 y 8 años de edad, ella es la responsable del hogar, tiene el negocio desde hace 4 años, este surgió por iniciativa propia, ha adquirido experiencia, trabaja todos los días de las 4:00pm a las 7:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, piedra y pago de mano de obra para realizar la pavimentación del piso de la vivienda,  este préstamo le ayudara para mejorar la vivienda y tener mejor condición de vida con sus hijos.
El objetivo de Jenny es mantener su hogar, que sus hijas sientan su apoyo, que no les falte lo más necesario para subsistir y que puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
Jenny, who sells pupusas [a traditional meal made with thick tortillas], lives with her husband.  They have two children who are 6 and 8 years old.  She is responsible for the home.  She has had the business for 4 years, which developed through her own initiative.  She has acquired experience.  She works every day from 4 pm to 7 pm.
She is asking for a loan to buy construction materials like cement, sand, wood, and to pay for labor in order to pave the floor of her home.  This loan will help her to improve her home and to have a better way of life with her children.
Jenny's goal is to maintain her home, that her children feel her support, that they do not lack what is most necessary to survive, and that they can study.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, wood, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Suparman

texts.en:
Suparman just began working with Ruma on July 23, 2013 to run Ruma’s new business cashing in and cashing out customer’s money for Ruma’s bank partner. As a new agent with Ruma, Suparman needs and hopes to get a Kiva loan for working capital to start his new business. Suparman wishes this new business to be another source of income for his family.

Suparman lives in Gadungan, Selemandeg Timur, Bali, a rural area about four hours from Denpasar. Suparman is married, has two children, and lives with four people in the family house.

Prior to joining Ruma, Suparman worked on the BT Cocoa staff and was a farmer.

loans.use: to have additional capital to process branchless banking transactions

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Originally for a rural village of the Moung Russey district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living, Chan, 56, is married with two children. She and her husband grow rice as the main business for the family’s income. Having been in the business for 20 years, they can earn about 60,000KHR per day to respond to the family’s needs and manage to save about 30,000KHR each day. 
Chan is just with VisionFund for this cycle. And now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, Chan wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Alvera

texts.en:
Alvera is 35 years old. She is married with four children aged between 4 and 13 years, all of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been farming for the past 6 years. With the loan from kiva, she would like to pay the workers who harvested beans. The profits from the business will be used to buy a goat for rearing and pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who harvested beans.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is 48 years old, married with three children. To earn a living, she engaged in a transport business to provide the daily needs of her family and help her husband to earn an income. Able to continue cater for more passengers in her transport business, so Elsie avail a new loan of 20,000.00 to cover the cost of repair and maintenance, a new set of tires for safety travel. Elsie wants for the future to buy a new motorcycle for expansion her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motor maintenance.

loans.name: Jose Prudencio

texts.en:
I have had my grocery store for three years. We are open all week, and I sell the household Ã­tems used everyday like butter, bread, milk, eggs, and other tasty treats.

My business is widely-known for my kindness and my unforgetable smile! We open early and stay open late, so my whole family works in the store since together we are sending the children to school.

loans.use: Buy inventory like bread, ham, pens and paper, medicine, juices, and the like.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy shares

loans.name: Baheja

texts.en:
Baheja D/O A. Najib lives in District 6 of Kabul City. She is married to A. Alem and has nine family members. She and her son operate a grocery store. They buy grocery goods from the main market in Kabul and sell them in their shop. Baheja has finished her 1st cycle loan and now wants to begin a 2nd cycle. When they first opened their shop, they weren't able to offer much to their customers. Thanks to the AFSG loan program, they were able to increase their stock and their income. Now Baheja is requesting a loan of $225 so she can continue to grow her business.

***Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur.  In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet, but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.***

loans.use: To purchase rice, ghee, tea, sugar, and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Rehim

texts.en: Rehim N. (his employee is pictured) is a realtor in the town of Khachmaz which is located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Rehim is looking for funding so that he can modernize his office by purchasing a computer and more furniture.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and furniture to modernize his office

loans.name: Chey

texts.en:
Mr. Chey Samnag is 35 years old and lives with his wife and their child, who is of schoolgoing age, in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To provide for his family's living expenses, he works as an electrician fixing TVs, radios and other electrical equipment . He makes about $5 a day on average. His wife is a landlord and rents different rooms to the people in her community, earning about $2 each day.

Due to an increasing demand for rooms, this couple hopes to effectively use this $300 loan to build more rooms to earn more for their family's expenses.

loans.use: To build more rooms to accommodate his tenants.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Doña Yolanda is a brave and hard-working woman who learned knitting and embroidery on her own 38 years ago by watching others. She has been doing these manual activities from her home, even more so since her husband's death 14 years ago. Since that time, she alone has supported her five children and finds in them strength and motivation.

Year after year, Yolanda has searched for ways to increase her income, and this had led her to develop her culinary skills; she now offers these services on a seasonal basis. Her wish is to continue supporting her children and increase the family's quality of life, so she is requesting this loan of $200 to purchase raw materials and supplies for her knitting business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Yolanda es una mujer valiente y esforzada, hace 38 años aprendió a tejer y bordar sola, gracias a su habilidad visual; desD. siempre desarrolló estos trabajos manuales en las instalaciones D. su hogar y se acentúa aún más tras fallecer su esposo hace 14 años. DesD. entonces mantiene a sus 5 hijos, y encuentra en ellos su fuerza y motivación diaria. Año tras año, Yolanda ha buscado muchas formas D. generar ingresos adicionales y esto hizo que adquiera habilidades para la cocina ya que en ciertas temporadas ofrece sus servicios.Anhela seguir apoyando a sus hijos y por eso solicita un préstamo D. 200 dólares para comprar insumos con los que seguirá tejiendo prendas para incrementar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is an enterprising woman, always willing and able to learn. These qualities have allowed her to perfect her embroideries with practice and have made her one of the best embroiders in her area. This skill was acquired when, 17 years ago, her sister-in-law taught her the techniques of clothe embroidery and she started embroidering the pieces she was commissioned little by little. Then she became independent to be able to get ahead and now she has a great demand. Thanks to this craft, Graciela has been able to responsibly take on her role and the care of her three children, and she will continue working because she wants to give them a promising future. Among her plans is buying knitting machines to be able to obtain greater profits for the benefit of her children. This is why Graciela is working hard with the goal of saving and buying what she hopes for in the medium term. She would like to produce more and is requesting a loan to buy cloth and embroidery thread with the goal of continuing to create her crafts. Your contribution will be wisely invested, please help.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga and son, Kiva volunteers

Graciela, es una mujer emprendedora con mucha disposición al aprendizaje, estas cualidades le han permitido perfeccionar con la práctica sus bordados y la han convertido en una de las mejoras bordadoras de su zona. Esta habilidad fue adquirida cuando su cuñada hace 17 años le enseñó las técnicas del bordado de fustanes y comenzó bordando poco a poco los encargos que le encomendaban; luego se independizó para poder seguir adelante y hoy tiene gran demanda. Gracias a este oficio Graciela durante años ha podido asumir su rol y el cuidado de sus tres hijos responsablemente y seguirá trabajando porque quiere otorgarles un prometedor futuro. Entre sus planes está el de comprar máquinas de tejer para obtener mayores ganancias en beneficio de sus hijos y es por ello que Graciela está trabajando arduamente con el objetivo de ahorrar y comprar lo que anhela en un mediano plazo.Ella desea producir más y solicita un préstamo para comprar tela e hilos a fin de seguir realizando sus trabajos. Tu aporte será sabiamente invertido, anímate a colaborar.

loans.use: Buying cloth and thread to continue her work for the benefit of her beloved children (Compra de tela e hilos para continuar con su labor en beneficio de sus queridos hijos.)

loans.name: Lucinda Group

texts.es:
The communal bank "Lucinda" started 1 year and 8 months ago. Currently, they have 8 cycles and 24 members. From being a part of the bank, the members have learned to be punctual, honest, and how to invest in a business. They also say that they have passed through difficult times in the bank, but also through happiness, and this has brought them closer together as friends. They also like it because they can get away, laugh, and learn.

The members have different businesses like selling vegetables, groceries, cereal, firewood, fruit, agricultural products, fish, books, candies, clothing, tubers, and making bread. Each member has a different history, like Margot, who started selling books in her home and now has a large bookstore. She will soon open a restaurant. On the other hand, Edith will use the loan to buy merchandise for her grocery business, which is located in the Las Américas market.

The members need different sums of money. Some amounts of the loans are 200, 400, 600, and 1000 soles. There will be a total of 13,100 soles in loans for the communal bank. The loans will be invested in buying medicine, vitamins, cabbage, carrots, celery, sweaters, pants, polo shirts, bread, peaches, plantains, flour to make bread, and fish. Their savings will be used to increase the capital of their businesses, constructing or improving their houses, a sickness that could arise, their kids' education, or enrollment in a university. The dreams of the members are to see their children become professionals and to have larger and more stable businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Banco Comunal Lucinda es un Banco Comunal que se inició hace 1 año y 8 meses; actualmente tiene 8 ciclos y 24 socias. Las socias cuentan que en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser puntuales, honestas, cómo invertir en el negocio. También dicen que el Banco Comunal pasó por muchas dificultades y también alegrías que las unió más como amigas, además que les gusta mucho las reuniones porque se distraen, ríen y además aprenden.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. verduras, abarrotes, cereales, leña, frutas, productos agropecuarios, pescado, libros, golosinas, ropa, tubérculos y elaboración D. panes. Cada socia tiene una historia diferente como es el caso D. Margot quien empezó vendiendo libros a domicilio y en L. actualidad tiene una librería granD. y próximamente va a abrir un restaurante. Por otro lado Edith utilizará el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su negocio D. venta D. abarrotes, que está ubicado en el mercado Las Américas.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos. Algunos préstamos son D. 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 13,100 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal. Los préstamos lo invertirán en L. compra D. medicinas, inyectables, vitaminas, col, zanahoria, apio, cebolL., chompas, pantalones, polos, panetones, durazno, plátano, harina para L. preparación D. panteones y pescado.

Sus ahorros los utilizarán para aumentar el capital D. su negocio, construir o mejorar su casa, alguna enfermedad que se pueda presentar, los estudios D. sus hijos, matrícuL. en L. universidad. Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales, tener negocios más grandes y estables.

loans.use: The members need different amounts of money for their loans.  Different amounts include 200, 400, 600, and 1000 soles.  The toal will be 13,100 soles for the communal bank.  The loans will be invested in the purchase of medicine, vitamins, cabbage, carrots, celery, onions, sweaters, pants, polo shirts, bread, peaches, plantains, flour to make bread, and fish.

loans.name: Munisa

texts.en:
K. Munisa is 25 years old and married with two wonderful children. Her daughter is 4 and her son is only 2 years old.

The difficult economical position of her family forced Munisa to start her own business. For two years, she has sold clothes for women in one of the local markets. Her husband assists her with her business.

Until now, Munisa has been renting her clothes store. Today she is requesting a loan of US$1,000 for a term of 12 months. Munisa wants to enlarge her turnover capital and to purchase her clothes store venue. Munisa has been provided with several loans by IMON and has shown herself to be a responsible client with good credit history.

loans.use: To increase her working capital and buy her own trading premises

loans.name: Muazama

texts.en:
R. Muazama is 42 years old. She is married with three children. Her husband and elder son help Muazama in the business.

Muazama has been baking the national bread “lepeshka” at her house for the last five years. She is known in her neighborhood as a nice and hard-working woman. Muazama is planning to expand her bakery shop. For now she needs to make majors repair in the bakery and for this purpose she requesets a $600.00 US dollar loan for the term of 12 months. Muazama hopes for support and thanks all for their trust because this is her first loan.

loans.use: Major repair of the bakery shop.

loans.name: Cesilia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Cesilia M.. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children (a 12-year-old, an 18-year-old, and a 28-year-old). In addition, she has one dependent who lives with her because her parents live in a remote area. In 2000, Cesilia established her general store business. Working seven days a week, and 13 to 16 hours a day, she earns about $50 each month from this business. She is assisted by her husband. Cesilia has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, oil, flour, and sugar in bulk. In the future, Cesilia plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services.

Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, oil, sugar, and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan Manuel V. started his business three years ago when he was left without work and needed income to support his wife and two children who were in primary school, Jonathan, 10 years old, and Sarriá, 8. He saw the opportunity to open an office supply store because, near the school his children attend, there was no such enterprise so he opened his own.

Today, he seeks a loan of $500USD, to be repaid in five months, to purchase merchandise. With your help, Manuel will continue to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Manuel V., emprendió su negocio hace 3 años cuando se quedo sin trabajo y ocupaba un ingreso para sostener a su esposa y sus 2 hijos que estaban estudiando la primaria, Jonathan de 10 años y Sarriá de 8. Vio la oportunidad de poner una papelería ya que cerca de la escuela a la que van sus hijos no había ningún negocio de este tipo, por lo que abrió la suya.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda Manuel seguirá progresando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
Born in 1967 in Amégnran (Vo prefecture), Edoh A. lives in the same village where he practices his trade as a taxi driver. Married and the father of one child, he manages to support himself and his family, thanks to his trade. A very energetic individual, he deserves another car because of the quality of his performance. And so, he is applying for financial support to acquire a car in order to loyaly serve his customers. He is very confident that this project will be highly profitable, to the extent that he will change out his car.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Né en 1967 à Amégnran dans la préfecture de Vo, monsieur Edoh A. vit dans le même village où il exerce son métier de conducteur de taxi. Marié et père d’un enfant, il arrive à prendre en charge ses besoins et ceux de sa famille grâce à son métier. Très dynamique, la qualité de ses prestations lui valait un changement de voiture. Ainsi, il sollicite un apport financier pour l’acquisition d’une voiture afin de servir loyalement sa clientèle. Il est très confiant que ce projet lui sera très rentable dans la mesure où il changera de voiture.

loans.use: Taxi purchase

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Lim K. E., 22, is a garment factory worker and earns $2 per day. Her husband Mr. Phal Phan, 26, has been a blacksmith since 2002, making around $3 each day. This couple has no children yet but they have an older mother to take care of. Now Phal wants to get a loan from Kiva to purchase more blacksmith tools.

loans.use: To purchase more blacksmith's tools to make her husband's work faster and easier.

loans.name: Narkhol

texts.en:
Narkhol A. is 39 years old. She is a widow, and she has two children. Narkhol has never had anyone's assistance in helping her children get ahead, so for the past 11 years she has been working in the sales industry; more specifically, she sells fuel and lubricants. This line of business has been her only source of income to support and to educate her children, and it has not been easy for her to bear such responsibility for her family. Even so, the love she has for her children is what drives her forward from day to day. At present, her older son helps her with the business. 
Narkhol is now requesting a loan in the amount of 300 Somoni ($100 USD), the proceeds of which will be used to meet her clients' demands and to thereby increase her sales volume. She promises to repay the loan in 4 months. The well-being of this brave woman and her family is in your hands, so please help them by contributing to the growth of her business. They sincerely thank you for your support.

loans.use: To meet her customers' demands and to increase the business' sales by diversifying her product line through the purchase of additional goods

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 27 years old, married, and has one 2-year-old child. She has been operating her own card design and creation business since 2006. Every month, she can earn a profit of around $185 from her sales.

Asha would like to continue her business and is now requesting a loan in order to expand her customer base and improve the quality of her service.

loans.use: To improve her business by increasing her inventory

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is a market entrepreneur from Nikopol where she lives with her husband and two daughters. Natalya has been in the grocery business for three years. Currently, she has about $2000 invested in inventory. Net profit is about $200 a month.

Natalya is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas ($US525) to increase turnover capital and generate additional profit as a result. She is hoping to see her venture growing and is planning to buy at least one more vending facility in the market. Nataliya is very good with finances. She knows how to manage money and make right investments. We believe the current loan will allow her to maintain a good product selection and continue to earn an adequate income to support herself and her family.

loans.use: Increase inventory and expand her business.

loans.name: Ilyas

texts.en: Ilyas I. is a 56 year old man who sells different kinds of goods as soft drinks, tea, sugar, onion, flour, candies and garden supplies. He is married and has five children. Ilyas started his business in 1983 when poverty and unemployment pushed him to start his own business and support his family. He achieved good results with long years of experience.  In the beginning of his business he was renting a place, but now he has built his own shop next to his house. Ilyas's business generates income just enough to cover family needs but it is not enough to expand it. He requests additional funds to purchase more inventory which will help generate more income and improve his life. Your contribution will be very helpful for Ilyas`s business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Davlatsho

texts.en:
Davlatsho is married with two children. He’s a businessman from Dushanbe where he sells men’s jeans, pullovers and shirts in the city market. Davlatsho is very enterprising, has vast experience working as a vendor and is full of creative ideas. A reasonable pricing policy and client-friendly service have always been priorities in his work and have helped to ensure the success of his business, which he has been running for five years. Currently, he has about $6,000 invested in the business and his monthly income is about $300-400.

Davlatsho is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni (US$750) to increase his inventory. He promises to repay the loan within nine months. He believes that having this additional turnover capital will help him minimize his sales risk and provide stable financial support for his family. Moreover, it will help him get closer to his ultimate goal of purchasing a big store of his own one day.

loans.use: To increase his inventory.

loans.name: Emerencia

texts.en:
Emerencia T. is married to Ngwa Michael and they have five children, three of whom are below the age of fifteen years. This will be Emmerencia’s fourth loan with GHAPE.  Emerencia and her family live in a three room house in the Nkwen neighborhood. Nkwen just outside downtown Bamenda.  She is the bread winner of the family, and she finds it very difficult to take care of the family single handedly.  In addition, she sustained serious injuries after being robbed by thieves.  Faced with her low level of education, she could not secure a good job for herself and thus she embarked on farming and retail trade which she has been doing for 10 years.

Becoming a member of GHAPE, she was fortunate enough to have acquired some techniques which have helped her to improve her business.  She has proven successful with her previous loans, which she had consecutively managed, and repaid loans worth $930 USD.  She is planning to contribute 70,000 CFA ($140 USD) of her personal savings towards this business plan. 

She will help her community as she will be able to supply the market with food crops like cassava and vegetables, and she will also provide the community with good palm oil. She intends to pay her children’s school fees and health costs with the profit from this loan, as well as reinvest in her business.  She plans to repay the loan in 18 months and repayment shall commence on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil, piglets, pig feed and seedlings

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: El Sr. Cesar tiene 58 años de edad, habitante del barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, estado civil soltera, tiene cinco hijos mayores. Sus planes para la familia es tener un patrimonio para sus hijos. Don cesar se desempeña como vendedor de ropa variadas de niño y adulto vende al contado y al crédito, su pequeño negocio lo tiene desde hace treinta años, lo inicio con fondo propio, los planes para su negocio es aumentar el volumen de venta mediante nuevos productos y nuevos sectores de mercado. Con esta solicitud es la tercera lo cual ha sido de muchos beneficios ya que ha hecho mejoras a su vivienda con este préstamo de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, bloques, zinc y así  seguir mejorando la infraestructura de su casa obteniendo mayor seguridad para su familia
texts.en:
Cesar is 58 years old, living in the South Laureles neighborhood in the capital of Managua. He is single and has five grown children. His plan for his family is to have an inheritance for his children. Cesar works selling various clothes for children and adults. He sells for cash and on credit. He has had his small business for 30 years. He started it with his own money. His plan for his business is to increase his sales through (selling) new products and (reaching) new sectors of the market. This is his third loan. The loans have been of much benefit, as he has already made several improvements to his home. With this loan from Kiva partner Afodenic, he will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, bricks, and zinc, so that he can continue improving the infrastructure of his house and gaining better security for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to fix up his home

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov S. is married and sells vegetables in a busy market earning around $2 of profit each day. 
She is 47 years old and lives with her husband and six of her children in the Kampong Cham province. Her husband is a security guard in the market and makes $8 a day. Four of their children are vegetable vendors like their mother and one is a student. 
Mrs. Nov S. would like to take out a loan to expand her vegetable stand by increasing her stock.
Nov S. is pictured with her husband.

loans.use: To expand the vegetable stand and increase stock.

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "El Carmen",  representadas por la señora Nelly  quien presenta  nexo consanguíneo con la señora Maria Elvira quien es su hermana, cave mencionar que ambas tienen ingresos totalmente independientes una de la otra. gran parte de las socias se dedican a la venta de comida, algunas son promotoras de cosméticos y ala venta de frutas otros se dedican a la reparación de computadoras y a la elaboración de refrigerios y comida .como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia de la oferta y la demanda, pero los socios (as9 saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia en el mercado y su gran calida humana. este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación de productos y para ampliar sus negocios de venta de comida, también a la compra de materiales e insumos para incrementar sus ingresos y dotar a sus familias de una mejor calidad de vida. los socios (as) van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando puntualidad y honestidad por lo que la fundación les brinda la oportunidad de un nuevo financiamiento.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "El Carmen" is represented by Nelly, who is related to the sister of one of the other members, Maria Elvira. It is important to point out that each sister works independently and has her own income. The members of the group have their own business that specialize in such things as the sale of foods, cosmetics and fruit, in the repair of computers, and in the preparation of snack foods and meals. The members are aware that their businesses face competition but they also know how to work hard and get ahead, thanks to their experience and their good character. This loan will be used to buy diverse types of products, to expand their businesses selling food and also to buy materials and ingredients. The members will then be able to increase their income and provide their families with a better quality of life. The members of this group have received two previous loans and they have been able to prove that they are punctual with making their payments. They are thankful for the opportunities that the foundation has given them by providing them with financing for their businesses.

(Translated by Nikki of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Businesses

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hải  năm nay 40 tuổi , gia đình chị có 4 con trong đó có  H. con đang học. Chị Hải tham gia Quỹ tình thương đã được 10 năm. Hiện tại chị đang chăn nuôi lợn tịa nhà còn chồng chị làm nghề đánh cá. Ngoài thời gian chăn nuôi chị Hải còn tranh thủ đi làm thuê để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị Hải đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua 1 con bò và mua thêm cá giống về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hải, 40 years old, has four children, of whom two are still in school. She has participated in the TYM Fund for the past ten years. Currently, she raises pigs, and her husband is a fish farmer. When she is not taking care of her animals, Mrs. Hải takes advantage of any spare time to earn some extra money working part time. With a total monthly income of 5,000,000 VND (288 USD), the financial situation of her family is improving and becoming more secure. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (575 USD), to buy a cow and some breeding fish.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow and breeding fish

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Mrs. Noun N. is a villager in Saen Born village in Takeo province. She is a chicken breeder. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to request a loan to purchase more baby chickens for breeding and she would use the rest of money to buy chicken feed for her chicken business. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Khun Phoeun, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice and he also is a coconut seller.

Mrs. Noun N. is a 29-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase more baby chickens and chicken feed for her business

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La sra. Ana tiene su librería bazar cerca del  colegio 26 de Junio, con ocho años de antigüedad, es muy conocida por la zona, tiene dos niños, su esposo es docente de una universidad privada, ambos se ocupan de los gastos de la casa. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materiales para la librería, como polietileno, hojas, folders, plastoformo. Cliente Muy puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana has run a bookstore and stationer's near the 26 de Junio College for 8 years, and is very well known in the neighbourhood. She is married to a professor at a private university and the couple have two children. Both she and her husband contribute to the household income. The loan will be used to buy products for Ana's bookstore, including paper, folders, binders, and duotangs. Ana is a very punctual and responsible client of the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock a bookstore

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Ánh Thị Nguyễn was born in 1984. She sells vegetables in the market near her house. Her husband is a builder. They have two children, one of which is going to school. They have a monthly income of about 2,500,00 Vietnamese dong (or about $140 US). This is her first microfinance loan. She wants to borrow 2,232,000 dong ( or about $125) to buy more vegetables.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
“No one can reach the top without taking a single step,” said Elsie, a business woman. She has engaged in a small business in order to assist her husband in supporting the needs of their family. She dreams that someday, they will become successful in life through hard work and patience. They have two children who are both attending elementary school. She is hoping that they may able to provide them with a good education for their future.

Her husband is working as a welder in Barangay Inaban, Dupax del Norte while Elsie is engaged in vegetable vending and selling some snacks. She is now requesting to take out a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 as additional capital for her business. She works hard and always prays that someday, she will become successful in the business which is very beneficial to their family, especially in sending her children to school. She will use the loan to buy more products for she believes that “the more products to sell daily, the higher the income generated”.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 32 años, es una mujer muy alegre y responsable, vive sola en una casa alquilada y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Cada día, muy temprano se dirige al mercado Santa Maria (mercado exclusivamente de frutas en la ciudad de Juliaca), pasa todo el día bajo el sol en espera de que sus clientes le compren las deliciosas frutas que vende, ella es muy alegre por lo cual su carretilla es muy concurrida, llegada las 6 de la tarde enrumba a su hogar para prepararse para la venta del día siguiente. Lleva 8 años realizando este negocio, lo que más le gusta es que puede conversar con sus clientes y hacer más amena la venta, por otro lado, considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto sin poder moverse, aun así sabe que todos sus esfuerzos los realiza con el único fin de mejorar su vida y tener una vejez tranquila. Para un futuro cercano desea tener una tienda donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad sus productos y atender mejor a sus clientes. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Juana con MFP y está dispuesta a separar una parte de sus ganancias diarias para pagar el crédito sin problemas, en su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que le da alegría a las demás socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más fruta para implementar mejor su puesto de venta, en espera de que esto le genere más clientes.
texts.en:
Juana, 32, is a very happy and responsible woman. She lives alone in a rented house. What she wants most of all is a better quality of life. Every day, very early in the morning, she heads towards the Santa Maria market (a market in the city of Juliaca that sells fruits exclusively) She spends the whole day under the sun, waiting for her customers to buy the delicious fruit she sells. Because she is very happy, her little cart is very popular. At six in the evening, she heads home to prepare for the next day’s sales. She has been in this business for eight years. What she likes the most is talking with her customers; that make selling more pleasant. On the other hand, the most difficult thing is having to stay at her stand all day without moving. Yet, she knows that all of her efforts are to improve her life and have a peaceful old age. In the near future she would like to have a store where she could more comfortably sell her products and tend to her customers. This is Juana’s fourth loan with MFP. She is prepared to put aside part of her daily earnings to repay the loan without problems. With the 1,000 PEN, she will buy more fruit to improve her stand in the hope of getting more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en: Charlyn M. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 26 years old, married, and has one infant child. Charlyn owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Charlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Charlyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Рахматулло мужчина 28 лет. Семейный мужчина имеет одного ребёнка. Рахматулло занимается бизнесом несколько лет, куплей- продажей б/у мебели из рук. Он покупает мебель дешево, ремонтирует и продаёт за прибыльную цену на местных базарах. Этот вид бизнеса приносит ему двойную выгоду: он зарабатывает и деньги и учится мастерству своего дела
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Rahmatullo is a 28 year old man. He is a family man who has one child. Rahmatullo has been doing business for several years buying and selling used furniture from people. He buys the furniture cheap, then repairs it and sells it for a more profitable price on the local markets. This type of business makes him double profit: he makes money and learns the craft of his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture

loans.name: Omonike

texts.en: I. sells sarongs and ready-made clothes, and is also a fashion designer. She has been in the business for 10 years. I. lives in Lagos. She is grateful to LAPO-KIVA for their financial assistance in these hard times. She is 29 years old and married with 3 children. I. hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more sarongs and ready-made clothes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and ready-made clothes to sell

loans.name: Zoila Albina

texts.es: La señora Zoila Ortiz de 48 años de edad, reside en el barrio anexo Villa Venezuela, tiene un hijo de 18 años de edad, madre soltera y trabajadora, logro tener su propio negocio el cual comenzó con un poco de ahorros y con préstamo,, logro tener un cafetín en el colegio lleva diez años administrándolo, para esto metió una carta de solicitud al colegio para que le permitieran estar con su cafetín lo que logro positivo a si como las ventas son buenas ya que siempre están los alumnos como maestros se siente contenta hasta hoy y con el apoyo de Afodenic ha logrado para incrementar su inventario es su tercer ciclo, el cual comprara materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras a su casa y poder gozar junto con su familia. sus planes es poder ayudar a su hijo que sea profesional para que goce de mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Sra. Zoila Ortiz is a 48 year old hardworking single mother who lives in the neighborhood annex of Villa Venezuela. She has an 18 year old son. With her savings and the help of a loan, Sra. Zoila started a cafeteria at the local high school and has been in business now for 10 years. Ever since she received permission from the school to start her business, she has been experiencing good sales and the students and faculty are pleased with her service.

With the help of AFODENIC, she has managed to increase the inventory for her business. For her third loan cycle, she is requesting to buy construction materials so that she can make improvements to her home that she and her family will be able to enjoy. She hopes to encourage her son to become a professional so that he will be able to live in better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for home improvements

loans.name: Asikafo Group

texts.en: Ama is thirty – five years old. She is married and has given birth to two children. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Ama is a trader. She is the leader of a trust bank group called “Asikafo” which literally means wealthy people. Most of the members in this group are engaged in trading activities such food selling, services, clothes selling, provision store, etc. They normally sell in their community market and treks to sell in other communities as well. They procure their stocks from Accra and nearby towns. The experience some of these traders have amassed over the years has given them the urge to expand their business scope, hence the need for the loan to buy goods in bulk to realize this dream. The group leader, Ama, stands in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Sarith

texts.en:
Mr. Sarith T., 50, (pictured with his wife), has been married since 1988 and has three children: one young daughter and two sons. Both of his sons are in school. The family lives along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. His wife, Mrs. Yun Lang, grows vegetables like tomatoes, corn and so on.

Sarith has been a musician since 1986 and hopes to teach his children to become musicians. Hence he is requesting his first loan of $1,000 in order to purchase a piano to teach his eldest son who is learning musical skills. In this way, Sarith’s son will become a musician as well.

loans.use: To purchase a piano to teach his son to become a musician

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
To have a successful life is the dream of Rosalinda A.. At 43 years old, she has seven children and really wants to send all her children to school.

Rosalinda runs a fishing business in Danao, Panglao. She started this business way back in 1990. In 2007, she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because it provides good benefits and leads the members to do well.

Now, Rosalinda is requesting a loan of Php 12,000 to help finance her business by buying fishing equipment.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Emenciana

texts.en:
Emenciana V. is from the village of Kinuman Sur Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 71 years old. Emenciana is widowed and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, Emenciana owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Emenciana has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Emenciana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emenciana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Emenciana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Emenciana from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units, with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: April Joy

texts.en:
At the age of 23, April Joy is engaged in buying secondhand motorcycles and selling them again in her village, though most of her customers are from different places. Her father is her business partner. Every time they sell a motorcycle, she has a net income of Php 5,000.

April Joy plans to obtain a loan of Php 8,000 as additional working capital for her business. She hopes that Kiva will grant her loan immediately. According to her it will be a great help in meeting the needs of their customers.

April Joy is married to Roel R., who works as a call center agent at Metro Manila, Philippines. They have one daughter named Mariah Kristen Kaye, two years old. They live in the village of Calaocan, Cabatuan, with her parents-in-law. Their house is located near Iglesia Ni Cristo church.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her motorcycle-trading business

loans.name: Nancy Amada

texts.es:
La señora  NANCY AMADA FERNÁNDEZ G. D. V. , tiene  43 años, vive en el distrito D. la MOCHE provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE ADELANTE  II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to D. secundaria y tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente D. ella. La socia se dedica a  la venta D. ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles compro  ropa para damas  como: jeans, polos, chompas, poleras, etc y ahora con su próximo crédito D. 1,000 nuevos soles viajara a la ciudad D. Lima a comprar ropa como: faldas, pantalones, polos, jeans y juguetes para vender en las fiestas D. fin D. año.
Ella sueña con alquilar un stand en un centro comercial en donD. vender con mayor frecuencia y facilidad.
texts.en:
NANCY AMADA FERNÁNDEZ G. D. V., 43, lives in the MOCHE district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the SIEMPRE ADELANTE II (Always Forward II) communal bank. She finished 11th graD. and has three children who depend upon her for support. She sells clothing for women, men and children. With her initial, 300 new sol, loan she bought clothing for women like: jeans, polo shirts, sweaters, t-shirts, etc. and now, with her next, 1000 new sol, loan she will travel to Lima to buy clothing like: skirts, pants, polo shirts, jeans, and toys to sell during the end-of-year festivities. She dreams with renting a stand in a shopping center where she can sell more frequently and more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing like skirts, pants, polo shirts, jeans, and toys.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny H. lives in Prey Mean village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Siem Moeun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Although this couple works hard, they still earn little income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Ny H. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets, pig food, and fertilizers, and she would use the rest of money to buy some food to make soup to sell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. She is 45 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more piglets, pig food, fertilizer, and to buy ingredients to make soup to sell.

loans.name: Adèle

texts.fr: H. Adèle est née en 1985 et vit depuis 24 ans environs au quartier Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ABOUBAKAR Mohamed, un revendeur, Adèle est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Adèle vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Adèle n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire, et a appris ensuite la coiffure. Adèle exerce cette activité depuis neuf ans. Adèle vend également des produits de cheveux (mèches, pommades, défrisants, shampoing, etc.) devant sa maison. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Adèle s’approvisionne. Adèle a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. C’est dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle que Adèle sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Adele H. was born in 1985 and has lived for the past 24 years in the Fregnon neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Mohamed Aboubakar a retail salesman. Adele is the mother of a school-aged child. Adele lives with her child and husband. Together, the couple meet the needs of the family. Adele attended primary school and has studied hair dressing. She has practiced this trade for the past 9 years. Adele also sells hair products such as hair pieces, conditioners, fragrants, shampoos etc., from her home. Adele buys her supplies from Dantokpa the international market in Benin. She has benefited from 2 previous loans with ALIDe, loans that she has duly repaid. Adele is requesting this third loan to increase her stock and better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of hair pieces and hair products

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Jovita tiene 25 años, vive en la compañía de su esposo Félix, de 26 años, y sus dos pequeños e inquietos hijos; Nicole de 6 y Edilson de 3 años. Ellos viven muy felices y con ganas de salir adelante en su casa que es propia.

Desde hace 7 años ayuda a su esposo en la siembra de papa, alverja, olluco y habas. La labor agrícola es un oficio cansado y la carismática Jovita lo sabe muy bien, es por eso que dedica gran parte del día a esta actividad. Desde muy temprano debe vigilar que sus tierras no se echen a perder por plagas u otros motivos, y en la tarde debe regresar a su casa para atender a sus pequeños y cocinar; que dicho sea de paso, lo sabe hacer muy bien, pues prepara todo tipo de comidas, pero su especialidad es la trucha frita (pez de río).
Así transcurren los días de esta trabajadora mujer; en el campo y atendiendo bien a su familia. Jovita sueña en tener un restaurante donde pueda ofrecer sus deliciosos platillos, además quiere sembrar en mayor cantidad para aumentar su productividad y obtener mayores ganancias.

Esta es la novena vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está segura de cumplir con todos sus pagos para no quedar mal ella y no atrasar a su grupo, que está integrado por personas responsables y trabajadoras. Jovita tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes, también comprará semilla de alverja para sembrar en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Jovita is 25 years old. She lives with her husband Félix, 26 years old, and their two small, restless children: Nicole, age 6, and Edilson, age 3. They live very happily and with the desire to advance themselves in their home, which is their own.

For 7 years, Jovita has helped her husband in the planting of potatoes, peas, olluco (a tuberous vegetable), and beans. Agricultural labor is tiring work, and the charismatic Jovita knows this very well because she dedicates a large part of each day to this activity. From very early on, she has to watch that her fields don't go bad due to a plague or some other cause, and in the afternoon she has to go back to her house to take care of her little ones and cook, which, incidentally, she knows how to do very well. She prepares all types of food, but her specialty is fried trout.

Thus pass the days of this hard-working woman, in the field and taking good care of her family. Jovita dreams of having a restaurant where she can offer her delicious dishes. In addition, she wants to plant larger quantities to increase her productivity and obtain better earnings.

This is the ninth time that she has had a loan with MFP and she is sure of completing all her payments so as not to give a bad impression and not to set back her group, which is made up of responsible and hard-working people. Jovita is thinking of investing the money she is requesting in the purchase of a number of bags of compost and fertilizer. She will also buy pea seeds to plant in larger quantity.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Nely Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Nely es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Kactus II”, vive en la provincia de Huancané, departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y  tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de animales caseros.

Este es su primer préstamo, ella solicitará al Movimiento Manuela Ramos S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo que comprará perros, gatos, gallinas, etc. y alimento para estos

Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su casa y agrandar su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de Manuela Ramos es la facilidad de los préstamo.
texts.en:
Nely is a member of the "Flor de Kactus II" Communal Bank. She lives in the province of Huancané in the department of Puno. She is 28 years old, is in a common-law marriage and has 2 children. She completed her primary school education and now buys and sells domesticated animals. This is her first loan, which she is requesting from the Manuel Ramos Movement in the amount of 500 new soles and with which she will buy dogs, cats, chickens, etc. as well as food for animals. Her dream for the future is to make improvements to her house and to grow her business. What she likes most about Manuela Ramos is the ease of getting of loans.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dogs, cats, chickens, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa L. is a married woman who supports her family by operating a bakery. She lives in Prs Santana 2, Old Sagay, Sagay City, Negros Occidental with her husband Romeo, who is 52 years old and runs a fish-vending business.  They have one child who attends school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dunganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her bakery business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $138.

Rosa is now borrowing 12,000 PHP that she can use as additional capital for her bakery business. This will be her 12th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dunganon. Her previous loan of 13,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosa hopes to elevate her family’s standard of living and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dunganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dunganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dunganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la fotografía es el esposo de Silvia.

Silvia S. J. y su esposo se han esforzado para tener un patrimonio seguro a sus tres hijos, es por ello que quieren hacerle mejoras a su vivienda para preparase en un futuro y dejarle un techo donde puedan vivir cómodamente. Con este crédito será el segundo con la institución donde  pudo realizar su proyecto. Ahora en la casa quiere terminar el baño de esa misma casa para no tener que salir afuera y en esta temporada de frió y puedan contagiarse de alguna enfermedad.
El esposo de Silvia es quien sostiene los gastos de la casa por medio de su pensión.
texts.en:
The person appearing in the photograph is Silvia's husband. Silvia and her husband have worked hard to create a secure life for their 3 children. That's why they want to make improvements on their house and prepare for the future with a home where they can live comfortably. This loan will be their 2nd with this institution for this project. Now they want to complete their bathroom, so they don't have to go outside in freezing temperatures and risk illness. Silvia's husband covers the costs of the house by means of his pension.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUILDING A BATHROOM IN THEIR HOME

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a single woman who lives with her two younger brothers. Ghada works as a secretary in Al-Amal hospital in Jineen. She loves the comfortable atmosphere of it and that it's relatively rewarding.

One of her brothers is a school teacher and the other one is still in college. Ghada is taking a loan from FATEN to pay her brother's tuition fees and purchase a computer he needs for school.

Ghada appears in the picture smiling in FATEN's office in Jineen.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and pay tuition fees

loans.name: Esperanza Marcelina

texts.es: La señora Bogorge A., es una señora trabajadora que le ha gustado trabajar desde joven, para ser independiente, con las utilidades de su negocio ha logrado educar a sus hijos y mantener su hogar, con el préstamo compra gaseosas y frutas para los refrescos naturales que realiza, para mejorar su negocio y obtener mayores utilidades, para el sustento de sus hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bogorge A. is a hard-working woman who has enjoyed working from a very early age in order to be independent. She has used profits from her business to educate her children and support her household. She will use the funds to buy soft-drinks and fruits for natural beverages that she makes in order to improve her business and earn higher profits to support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks and fruits for beverages.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is a single mother of five children.  She owns a two-room house where she stays with six people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Teopista takes care of additional family members. She owns a poultry farm and she sells rears broilers and layers and sells to all categories of people both on retail and wholesale . She works six days a week. Besides this poultry farm she also owns a shop selling  twenty third loan.  .   She wants to use this loan to buy more chicken feeds and chicks and bags of maize bran. She is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and own2000 chicken plus owns poultry feeds store. Her She joined MCDT because it was near her home and giving out loans  to low income women who  are in groups

loans.use: To buy more chickens feeds, chicks and maize bran

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia G. is a 43 year-old woman living in the village of Hda. Ester, Barangay Rizal, Sagay City. She is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a restaurant serving local foods to customers in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2002, Virginia joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from NWTF. Virginia is now requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 13th loan taken out by the borrower from NWTF.  Virginia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Afiwa Mawutoè

texts.en:
Madame Afiwa Mawutoè A. has a general store in the Kégwé region of Lomé. She is 52 years-old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a surveyor. Afiwa has had her store since 1975 and she has one employee. She sells all kinds of food products at her shop in Lomé. 

Afiwa requests 300,000 CFA to purchase more merchandise for her shop. This is her first loan from Kiva partner WAGES.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es: Dionisio C. G., tiene la edad de 60 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Dionisio también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Dionisio is 60 years old, married and lives with his wife. The loan he is requesting will be used for his farm, specifically for raising coffee crop. He plans to purchase compost and fertilizer. Dionisio wishes to adequately maintain his coffee crop in order to achieve a better quality and to obtain the highest possible price when it is time to harvest. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and is very happy with the services that have been provided to him. Don Dionisio has worked as a farmer for many years. Looking forward, he hopes to be able to provide his family a better quality of life and greater financial stability. He also hopes to continue to grow as a person and a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Assistance for his coffee crop.

loans.name: 02.06.10 - Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en: Son N. T. (65) is a 70-year-old female living in the town of Thieu Hoa -Thanh Hoa. Son is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.06.10 Thieu Hoa (02.06.10 Thieu Hoa). Son is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Son raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. Son has been engaged in this business for more than 30 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) a month from it. In 2002, Son joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Son has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.280.000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND, which will also be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. It will be the ninth loan Son has taken from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Son plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. N. T. Tam (48) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock. 2. N. T. Hoa (67) is a 40-year-old female who is also requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Son N. T. (65) là 70 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thieu Hoa -Thanh Hoa. Son là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.06.10 Thieu Hoa (02.06.10 Thieu Hoa). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Son thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 30 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Son kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2002, Son đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Son đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.280.000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 9th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. T. Tam (48) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. N. T. Hoa (67) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."
