loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Sarit's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarit H. is 47 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its sixteen members wH. are located in Pou Doh village, Takeo province. Some of members in the photo are blocked by others. Each member of this village loan will use it’s to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Sarit H. is a farmer wH. owns 2 hectares (5 acres) of land she uses to cultivate rice and she is a farmer wH. works very hard to support her five children. Her husband, Mr. Khoeun Dok, is an ice cream seller in the local village from which he is able to earn a small profit to add to his wife’s earnings to improve the family living. This couple has five children: one is a construction worker, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other three are students in the local school.

In order to increase her income to improve the family living, Mrs. Sarit H. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en: Bushra is married to Amjed P., who operates a medical store in the main market of the city of Lahore, Pakistan. Bushra herself is a housewife. She carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and a mother as well. Life in a big city is not easy. It takes continuous effort and hard work in order to make money to fulfill basic needs. As inflation in Pakistan is increasing day-by-day, it has become harder to meet the basic needs of the family. To run a business in this situation, one can only survive when one has good existing stock to compete with other businesses. Therefore, Bushra has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will buy medicines in bulk and expand his medical store.

loans.use: To purchase medicines for a medical store

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda B. is married and has four children. She has received junior high education.  Matilda sells smoked fish in Takoradi. To smoke her fish, she goes to the seashore to buy fresh fish from the fishermen. She comes home with the fish, cleans or dresses them, and drains the water that comes about as a result of washing the fish. She prepares her traditionally-made oven with firewood to smoke her fish for sale. Her husband is a teacher. 

Matilda uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Matilda will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new earnings from her expanded business, Matilda plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Lizeth Noemi

texts.es: La Señorita Lizeth viene por recomendación de sus padres que también son clientes de la institucion ellos se dedican a la confección de chamarras, la cliente tiene un puesto de venta en la calle Illampu, en la cual vende chamarras importadas Coreanas, la misma que adquiere por cantidad. Ella vive en la casa de sus papas de la zona alto Chijini, además medio tiempo se dedica a estudiar en la Universidad ya que ella tiene ganas de superarse y tener un mejor futuro.  la inversión del préstamo será para la compra de dos cajas de chamarras para surtir el negocio.
texts.en:
Lizeth comes on the recommendation of her parents who are also clients of this institution; they make jackets. Lizeth has a post on the Llampu road where she sells jackets imported from Korea, which she buys in bulk. She lives in her parent's home in the Alto Chijini neighborhood. In addition, half of the time she is studying at the University, since she has a desire to succeed and have a better future. She will invest this loan in the purchase of 2 boxes of jackets to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will buy 2 boxes of jackets

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita G. is from the village of Tabon. She is 57 years old and is married with four adult children. Rosita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty-seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
This is Arlyn G., 30, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Reymond G. and is the mother of three young, hardworking adults. By the grace of God, she has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Arlyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.

Arlyn earns by buying supplies at the wholesale price and selling in small quantities. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Arlyn is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Arlyn dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work in her business. She faithfully meets up every week with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El Señor  Alfredo R., tiene 43 años de edad, es viudo con 2 hijos, todos mayores de edad.
Se dedica a esta actividad hace más de 25 años, empezó trabajando con su tío, el cual se dedicaba a éste rubro hace ya más de 30 años. 
Luego su tío falleció y se quedo sin trabajo, se le vino en  mente la idea de abrir una carpintería propia, para comenzar con su carpintería, tuvo que vender un terreno, que recibió como herencia de su madre. 
    Nos cuenta también que su señora en vida lo ayudaba mucho para que puedan seguir adelante y así poder darles la posibilidad de estudiar a sus hijos  para tener una mejor calidad de vida. 
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de maderas para fabricar  muebles ya que tiene muchos pedidos de los mismos. 
Agradece mucho a la Fundación Paraguaya el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Alfredo R. is 43 years old and a widower with 2 children who older in age. He has been in this field (furniture making) for more than 25 years. He started working with his uncle, who worked in this area of work for more than 30 years. Later, his uncle died and he found himself out of work. He had an idea to open his own carpenter’s workshop. He had to sell a plot of land which he had received as an inheritance from his mother.

He also tells us that his female companion helps him a lot so that he can make progress. Therefore, he is able to give his children the possibility to study so they can have a better quality of life.

The requested loan is for buying wood to make furniture, since he now has many orders. He is grateful for the Fundación Paraguaya for the loan offered.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This is Rosalinda V., 46, resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to an aircraft maintenance man and mother to their three children, one of whom is already working. By the grace of God, Rosalinda has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosalinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling retail.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.
  
Rosalinda dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites Sta. A. is from the village of Brgy. Maddiangat, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 34 years old. Marites is married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Marites sells vegetables at the market and around her village, using her jeep as transportation. Marites has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for her vegetable business. This loan will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair jeep used to take vegetables to market for sale.

loans.name: Aminahon's Group

texts.en:
Aminahon A. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Aravan. Aminah is 51 years old and married. Her husband is retired and he receives a monthly pension in amount of 3000 soms. In order to make money to cover family expenses Aminahon and her husband breed cattle. They have been doing it for 19 years. They started with the initial investment of 10000 soms and now, selling some cattle after fattening, they make 5000 soms per month. With money received from the loan Aminahon wants to purchase a cow for breeding. In the future she wants to increase the number of cattle, start building a new fence and repair the kitchen in the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is a single energetic man who is 31 years old. He has a boutique which sells a variety of items. He decided to request this loan to purchase more merchandise to sell and he has planned to build a home from the profits he anticipates. He would like to have a booming business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items for sale

loans.name: Tujijuke Group

texts.en: Olive is 30 years old, married, and has one child aged two. Her husband works as a charcoal seller. Olive is the group leader of a borrowing group known as Tujijuke in Kinyarwanda, which means “Be literate” in English. This group is composed of sixteen members who have different businesses. Olive sells sodas and local beer and has been doing this business for three years. Olive will use the loan to purchase beans, sorghum and drinks.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Olive plans to buy goats for raising and to buy cattle in the future.

loans.use: To buy beans, sorghum and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina C. is from the village of Commonwealth, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 55 years old. Josefina is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Josefina owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as sugar, canned goods, noodles, coffee, shampoo, soap, toothpaste and other dry good products, in the local community. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Josefina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Josefina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Gertruda

texts.en:
If one would dream for one’s self or one’s family, why not dream for the best? Gertruda R., 34, dreams for the best, but more than that, she acts to make it a reality. Ruby, as she is called by friends, reached college and is married to Joseph Ryan, a general manager. They have a child who is in elementary school. Together they live in Pasay City.

With the learning she gains as a Community Partner in CCT*, Ruby runs her own sari-sari (variety) store to capitalize on the big target market she has in her community. She has been doing business here for two years. It is quite easy for her since it is a residential business, and there is not much need at present to hire employees. She earns Php800 a day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she would like to request for a Php15,000 loan. This she plans to buy more grocery items to put in her store, so that it would not have to look bare and incomplete. Ruby takes effort to maintain her business in good shape, because a profitable business translates to family needs being met and the schooling of her child being supported. 

Ruby struggles with time management when it comes to balancing business, health and family life. One proof of this is her health problem. However, she sees to it that these struggles will not prevent her from reaching her dreams for her family. She desires to see her small store grow and eventually expand. She dreams of good health for everyone in the family, having their own house and lot, and permanent job for her husband, and a big happy family. Deep inside, she knows that if there is faith, and action, it will be possible.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Grocery items and rice for her store

loans.name: Fares

texts.en: Fares is a 53-year-old, married man who lives with his wife and three children in Jericho. In 2000, Fares opened his own flower shop in which he sells flowers and pots. He is now hoping that through this loan he will be able to buy new plants and pots for his store, which will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to be able to buy new plants and pots for his store

loans.name: Irlanda Carolina

texts.es: Irlanda Carolina tiene 28 años, ella tiene un Kiosco. Tiene más de 6 años con este medio de vida, Irlanda se levanta muy temprano ya que diariamente viene a su negocio, pues la mayoría de sus clientes son niños cercanos a un colegio. Poco a poco fue incrementando su capital, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. Este financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas, jugos, gaseosas entre otras cosas. Su sueño es que sus 3 hijos logren ser profesionales y realizarle ciertas mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Irlanda Carolina is 28 years old and has been managing a kiosk for more than six years. She wakes up very early each day so that she can open her business. Most of her customers are children who attend school nearby. Over time she has gradually increased her capital, so this is not the first time she has received financing.

This loan will be used to buy candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, juices, sodas, and other items. Her dreams include seeing her three children become professionals and making certain improvements to her home.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, juices, sodas, and other items

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita C. is from the village of Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old. Lolita is widowed and has six adult-aged children. 

To make a living, Lolita raises a variety of vegetables for sale. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Lolita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Elephant Group

texts.en:
J. M., who is in his early twenties, is married. He has been running chicken, fruit and vegetable businesses for one year.  He works from 10:00am to 9:00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be J.'s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to start the fruit and vegetable business and has paid back his loan successfully.  He hopes for a loan to buy more chicks for his chicken business. His dream is to one day build his own house.

J. will share this loan with his loan group "Elephant", which has a total of 21 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture J. is in the back, holding a baby.

loans.use: To buy more chicks to raise.

loans.name: Juan Enrique

texts.es: Juan tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos  hijos. Vive en casa propia en la zona urbano-marginal del distrito de Lambayeque, en el norte de Perú. Cuenta con servicios de  luz,  pero no de agua potable. Su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias. Desde hace más de 2 años, brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Desea usar el préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi. Pretende comprar una nueva carpa y arreglar los asientos. Necesita mantener su vehículo en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles. Juan tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien trabajador y honesto. Ha manejado préstamos de Edpyme Alternativa y tiene un buen historial crediticio. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos para seguir solventado sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in his own home in a small, poor, urban community in Lambayeque district, in the north of Peru.  His community has access to electricity but not drinking water.  Juan's community is small, consisting of approximately 100 families.

For more than 2 years, Juan has been offering a passenger transport service with his motorcycle taxi (a vehicle which consists of a motorcycle with a cabin in back for transporting passengers).  He would like to use his loan to have some repair work and maintenance work done on his motorcycle taxi.  He would like to buy a new roof and repair his seats.  Juan needs to keep his vehicle in good condition in order to continue offering a good service to his customers.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Juan has good references from his neighbors and acquaintances.  The people who know him consider him to be hard working and honest.  He has had previous loans from Edpyme Alternativa and he has a good credit history.  With the help of this loan, he hopes to increase his income in order to continue covering his family expenses.

loans.use: to repair the seats and buy a new roof for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Faustina; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella vende chompas, maletines, collares y aretes, también la socia trabaja deshojando maíz son trabajos eventuales que realiza, el trabajo de artesanía ella vende en la plaza de armas de Andahuaylillas y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Las Triunfadoras" communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Andahuaylillas in the Quispicanchis province in the department of Cusco.

Faustina is 39 years old and married.  She has 5 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling handcrafts.  She sells sweaters, bags, necklaces, and earrings, and she also works husking corn from time to time.  She sells the handcrafts in the central plaza in Andahuaylillas, and through this business she is moving her children forward.  She wants to expand and improve the handcrafts business.  She is asking for a loan to buy wholesale handcrafts.  

She is happy because of the loan, and she is committed to paying back the installments on time.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale handcrafts.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia tiene  34  años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mucho tiempo que posee una tienda, negocio que instaló en el interior de su casa, la necesidad y la ganas de salir adelante la motivo para generarse sus propios ingresos, además que puede administrar su tiempo sin descuidar su hogar. La mayor parte del tiempo se encarga de la tienda, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposo y la de sus hijos, para ellos es un negocio familiar y entre todos deben apoyarse. Siempre procura abastecer su tienda con diversos productos que tiene  mucha demanda por parte de sus clientes, además por ser una de los pocos negocios que hay en su zona, la convierte en la prefijada de todos lo de su comunidad. Ahora se propuesto suministrar su tienda con la mayor variedad de productos. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, tiene buenas referencias de  trabajo en banco comunal por sus vecinos que tiene esa experiencia por lo que se animo a formar parte de este banco comunal y por su parte se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Claudia, 34, lives with her husband and two children in her own house.  She’s had a store for a long time, a business she installed inside her house.  Need and the wish to get ahead motivated her to earn her own income while at the same time managing her own time without neglecting her home.
She spends most of her time tending to the store but occasionally gets help from her husband and her children.  For them, it’s a family business and they must support each other mutually.

She always strives to stock her store with diverse products that are in demand by her customers.  Besides, because it’s one of the few businesses in her area, it becomes everyone’s first choice in her community.  Her purpose now is to stock her store with a greater variety of products.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She has good work references in the communal bank from her neighbors and good experience that motivated her to be part of the communal bank.  She commits to be punctual with her payments.  She will use the loan she’s requesting to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen, a mother of four, is married and hails from the Kyenjojo district. She is 39. She needs a loan to purchase clothes for resale. She owns a boutique and offers bridal services. 

She dreams of educating her children and completing the commercial house she is building so that she can earn an extra income from it. She acquired her initial capital from her husband.

loans.use: To purchase women's and men's wear for resale in her boutique

loans.name: Karen Narobia

texts.en: Karen, 26 years old, started her business of selling clothes and cosmetics door-to-door approximately three years ago with the help of a small loan from her grandmother.  Since that time, Karen has built up a strong client base and her business has grown steadily.  With the increased demand for her products, Karen plans to use the proceeds from this loan to update and increase her inventory so that her business can continue to expand.

loans.use: to update and increase her inventory

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 43 años de edad, convive con su pareja Yovana de 40 años y tienen 04 hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en el centro poblado de Villa Virgen anexo del distrito de Vilcabamba, donde viven en su propia casa. Juan empezó desde muy niño como ayudante en distintas tiendas comerciales, creció con los anhelos de poseer su propia tienda comercial, su deseo se hizo realidad desde que empezó a ahorrar sus salarios y desde hace 15 años viene trabajando de forma independiente  Hoy, con una sonrisa muy despejada y fortalecida, siente que ha cumplido uno de sus primeros objetivos, lo cual le está arrojando buenos resultados económicos, debido a la calidad y la variedad de productos que ofrece a su clientela. Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. Gracias al préstamo solicitado llevará acabo uno de sus anhelados deseos, que es montar un Mini Marquet donde pueda ofrecer variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Espera contar con el apoyo financiero para poder reordenar y ofrecer sus productos de manera organizada ya que con ello piensa mejorar y prestar un servicio adecuado a sus compradores exigentes. Este será su primer crédito y esta muy contento de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su proyecto planeado. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles adquirirá variedad de productos como arroz, golosinas, bebidas.
texts.en:
Juan, 43 years of age, lives with his partner, Yovana, who is 40, and they have 4 school-aged children.  They live together in the Villa Virgen village, an annex of the district of Vilcabamba, where they have their own house.  From a young age, Juan worked as an assistant in different stores and grew up wanting to have his own store.  His dream became a reality when he started to save his salary, and he has been working independently for 15 years.  Today, with a bright and strong smile, he feels he has accomplished one of his main objectives, which is yielding good financial results given the quality and variety of products he offers to his customers.

Normally, he works on his own but on occasion gets help from his children.  Thanks to the loan requested, he will be able to finish one of his wishes, which is to start a Mini Market where he can offer a variety of basic products.  He hopes to be able to count on the financial support to place new orders and offer his products in an organized manner.  By doing this, he wants to improve and provide an adequate level of service to his demanding buyers. 

This will be his first loan, and he is very happy to know that he will have financial support.  This will allow him to feel secure in advancing with his planned project.  He will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles to buy a variety of products such as rice, snacks and beverages.

loans.use: buy sacks of rice, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham has been in farming for four years, employing one farmhand and producing milk which he sells to the local market. He is age 31 and single. He runs a "posho" (cornmeal) mill in the local market in Eldoret town.

Abraham has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to enable him to venture into poultry farming by purchasing poultry. He says he wants to venture into poultry to supplement his dairy farming. He also wants to expand his half acre piece of land by purchasing more land and thereafter increase the number of his dairy cows.

Abraham says the common animal diseases have become very expensive to manage.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Siomara Velmina

texts.es: La Señora Siomara es casada, tiene 02 hijos de 2 y 8 años de edad, de los cuales el mayor ya asiste al colegio; Siomara se dedica  a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (tienda de abarrotes); la Señora viene brindando este servicio desde hace 02 años, ,el desafío que enfrenta la familia es el fuerte frio que viene atravesando la ciudad donde radican ; Siomara va a invertir el dinero en la compra de mercadería para ampliar el negocio, tales como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche,  entre otros; Siomara como toda mujer emprendedora tiene muchos sueños, uno de ellos es ver crecer su negocio y poder construir su casa de material noble. Ella esta muy agradecida por el crédito que se le está brindando.
texts.en:
Siomara is married and has two children who are 2 and 8 years of age; the oldest attends school.  Siomara sells basic need items (grocery store).  She’s been providing this service for two years.  The challenge her family faces is the intense cold the city they live in is experiencing.  

Siomara will invest the money in the purchase of merchandise to expand the business, such as: rice, sugar, noodles and milk, among others.  Like all enterprising women, Siomara has many dreams.  One of them is seeing her business grow and being able to build her house out of substantial building materials.  

She is very grateful for the loan she’s being granted.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is a 39-year-old married woman living in the village of Nagbukel, San Isidro. She is blessed with two children who are now school aged. She is glad because through her vending activity she is able to provide for her children's needs. According to her, she is able to earn about PHP 2,000 per month as a direct seller of Avon and Personal Collection products.

Mylene has been in the business of direct selling for five years. Due to the high cost of commodities, she has been encouraged to avail herself of additional capital from the lenders which will be used in improving her business and her family's lifestyle. Mylene is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase lotion, detergent soap, toilet cleaner and perfumes to sell in her village. She is hoping that she can receive this loan amount because this will be a big help in maintaining her business and increasing her income.

loans.use: to purchase lotion, detergent soap, toilet cleaner and perfumes to sell in her village

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: Saturnina de 44 años de edad, convive con Roberto de 35 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en la comunidad de sector teresa del distrito de Pichari. Saturnina nunca olvidará aquellas tardes de su juventud en las que observaba a sus abuelos a remover la tierra y a la vez colocar semillas de cacao. Desde entonces apostó por la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de cacao, para así sacarle provecho todos los conocimientos que le dejaron sus abuelos, como el aplicar nuevas técnicas de siembra. Pero cuando es temporada de cosecha es cuando contrata peones. Actualmente el cacao, es un producto que tiene mucha demanda a nivel nacional e internacional, es por ello, que se siente satisfecha por las ganancias que recibe al vender su producto en Centros de Acopio de su localidad. En adelante ella piensa comprarse más terrenos, para así, competir de manera equitativa con sus vecinos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que pueda concretar sus objetivos. Con los 1500 soles que solicita, comprará una moto pulverizadora
texts.en: Saturnina, 44, and her partner, Roberto, 35, have 3 chidren.  They live in a house that they own in Sector Teresa, a rural community in the Pichari district.  Saturnina has never forgotten the afternoons she spent as a teenager watching her grandparents prepare their fields for cacao.  She's a cacao farmer herself now, practicing everything that she learned from her grandparents then.  Using new technologies, for example, for sowing crops.  At harvest time, though, she hires farm laborers to help her.  There's a lot of demand for cacao now, both in Peru and abroad, and Saturnina is happy with the money her crops can make.  She sells what she harvests at the local Centros de Acopio [warehouse].  For the future, she wants to buy more land so that she can compete on an equal footing with neighboring farmers.  This is Saturnina's first MFP loan.  She is counting on your support to help her meet her goals.  She will use the 1500 soles loan to buy a motorized sprayer.

loans.use: to buy a motorized sprayer for her farming business.

loans.name: Nigela

texts.en:
Nigela is 33 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in the Philippines. Nigela has a retail shop that sells clothes such as t-shirts, blouses, underwear, sandals, and other shoes. She has had this business for seven years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy clothes and sandals to sell.

Nigela is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nigela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 60 years old and married to Jeniffer. They have been blessed with six children who are now all adults. He has been operating his quarrying business for the past two years making a monthly profit of KES.16,000. This will be his first loan. He has been loaned KES.30,000 which he plans to use for the purchase of another quarrying site.

With the anticipated profit, he plans to open another business in the area. In the near future, he hopes to purchase a lorry that will assist in transportation.

loans.use: to purchase another quarrying site

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en: Moustafa is a 40-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He has owned a barber shop since 2004 with seven years of experience working in the same occupation. He is well known in the whole region for his good business reputation and his great welcoming. Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to purchase a special machine for the black color below the eyes and for facial treatment necessary to improve his business. This is his third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loans helped a lot in improving his business, at the same time he is a borrower with a good standing history. His income is considered almost reasonable and he struggles to be able to face the uncomfortable life circumstances. In the future, Moustafa is planning to improve his work and enlarge his shop to add new beauty and massage services, in addition to selling cosmetics, beauty products and perfumes.

loans.use: To buy a special machine for the black color below the eyes and for facial treatment necessary to improve his business

loans.name: Sika Ahuefa

texts.fr:
Sika est une femme âgée de 32 ans, elle est célibataire sans enfant.
Sika est propriétaire d’un restaurant à Lomé depuis 2010. Son restaurant est très fréquenté et sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé. Actuellement elle manque de rafraîchissement raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour l’achat de  boissons à la brasserie de Lomé.
texts.en:
Sika is a 32 year old woman, she is single and does not have any children.
Sika has owned a restaurant in Lomé since 2010.Her restaurant is very popular and her clientele made up of the general public. She buys her provisions at Lomé. At present she is short of refreshing drinks which is the reason why she requests a first loan from WAGES in order to buy drinks at the Lomé brewery.

loans.use: purchase drinks.

loans.name: Talifaia

texts.en:
Talifaia is 50 years old and is married with six children. She owns and operates a business venture selling ice-cake. She has three years of experience in this business. Talifaia needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or $83 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Talifaia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Talifaia's third loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is), and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from a university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en: 45-year-old Prima is a married woman with 5 children aged between 2 and 20. She is a basket weaver. She sells her products to store owners who sell native products. Aside from basket-weaving, she also raises pigs in her backyard. Prima sells the pigs at her town's market. She requested a loan to purchase materials for basket-weaving and additional piglets to raise. Prima hopes to support her children's college education through her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for basket-weaving and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Lesvia Esperanza

texts.es: Lesvia Esperanza tiene su negocio que es el destace de cerdo y venta de mercadería en general, desde hace más de 20 años que tiene con este negocio. Ella inicio con fondos propios que tenia de ciertos ahorros y necesitaba generarle a su familia ingresos. La mayoría de sus clientes la conocen por los deliciosos nacatamales que ofrece. Los fines de semana se levanta temprano desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche que empieza a preparar los nacatamales y venderlos. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de cerdos.
texts.en: Lesvia Esperanza butchers pigs and sell merchandise in general. She has been doing this for more than 20 years. She started the business with her own funds that she had from savings as she needed to generate a family income. Most of her customers know her for thee delicious tamales she sells. Se gets up early at the weekends, working from 6 in the m orning until 7 at night, and starts preparing and selling the tamales. The reason for the credit is to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a stock of travel bags and briefcases.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María es una persona muy responsable con su trabajo y carismática con las personas. María es soltera, tiene 50 años y vive con su hijo en San Gabriel que se encuentra en la Provincia de el Carchi al Norte de Ecuador.

María se dedica a la compra venta de cerdos por un tiempo de 15 años, ella empezó su negocio con una cantidad mínima de cerdos y con un socio lo que las utilidades tenían que repartirse, ahora tiene sus propios cerditos. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de cerdos y para la reparación del corral, esta inversión le ayudará a que su negocio se incremente y que sus ventas crezcan y así poder obtener muy buenos ingresos.

Su sueño es poder contruir un corral mejor donde puedan vivir bien sus cerdos y en lo familiar desea tener una vida digna y llevadera.
texts.en:
María is a person who is very responsible in her work and displays her charisma with other people. She is 50 years old, single, and lives with her son in San Gabriel, which is located in the province of El Carchi in northern Ecuador.

María has been buying and selling pigs for 15 years. She started this business with a minimal number of pigs and split the profits with a partner. Now she has her own piglets. This is the first loan she is requesting from FODEMI. María will invest in the purchase of pigs and repairs to her animal pen. This investment will help grow her business and increase her sales so that she can generate a better income.

Her dream is to build a better pen where her pigs can live well. She also hopes that her family will have a decent and bearable life.

loans.use: to buy pigs and to make repairs to her animal pen.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a vegetable gardener. She grows "pechay" (chinese cabbage) and other kinds of vegetables. Fe sells her harvest to her community. She also sells eggs and soft drinks. Fe earns 700 PHP per day with her business.

Fe is requesting a loan to buy seeds and more items to sell such as eggs and soft drinks. Fe hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes to help sustain her family of a husband and three children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and more items to sell such as eggs and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Doña Rosa,Tiene 41 años de edad es casada y tiene 4 hijos ella se dedica a la venta de animales en su casa desde hace 20 años nos cuenta que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de pavos ya que por esta epoca es cuando se vende este tipo de animalitos,y el precio sube un poco mas es por eso que ella quiere aprovechar para aumentar su capital,espera que fape y Kiva le pueda ayudar con el credito.
texts.en: Doña Rosa is 41 years old, married and has 4 children.  For the last 20 years she has been selling animals from her home.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of turkeys.  This is the time of year that this animal sells and its price goes up.  She wants to take advantage of this and increase her income.  She hopes that FAPE and Kiva will be able to help her with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase animals for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 43 years old, and is a single mother of three children. She has been in the quarry business for the past 11 years with a monthly income of Kes 15,000, which she uses to support her children.

She is applying for her fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Agnes will use the loan to purchase another quarry. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a lorry for transporting the quarry stones.

loans.use: To purchase another quarry site.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 53 years old. She is married, with two adult children. The family resides in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Marina used her last loan to purchase manure and a young mango tree of another type. Marina's business is progressing and she is taking out a new loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Jeaqueline Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jacqueline, vive con su esposo y un hijo, tienen casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de meriendas y licuados, este negocio nació por el interés de tener ingresos que le permitieran a ella cubrir alguna necesidad familiar, en apoyo con su esposo, este negocio tiene 4 años de existir, es muy rentable por la ubicación que transitan estudiantes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de frutas frescas para la preparación y extracción de jugos, además para hacer licuados, tambien comprara un extractor de jugo y una licuadora. Con estas herramientas nuevas podrá mejorar la capacidad de su venta y generar mayor y mejor atención a los clientes.
La aspiración de Jacqueline es que su negocio crezca, tambien adquirir mayores conocimientos para mejorar la preparación de los productos.
texts.en:
Jacqueline lives with her husband and one child. They have their own house. She works selling snacks and fruit smoothies. This business arose out of her interest in having income which allows her to cover some of the family's needs, in support of her husband. This business has existed for 4 years, and it is quite profitable thanks to its location in an area where students pass by. 

She is requesting a loan to buy fresh fruits to extract and prepare juices, and also to make smoothies. She will also buy a juicer and a blender. With this new equipment, she will be able to expand her sales capacity and provide more and better service to her customers. 

Jacqueline's aspiration is that her business will grow, and she also wants to acquire better knowledge to improve the preparation of her products.

loans.use: to buy a juicer, a blender and fruit to prepare smoothies.

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Thu was born in 1954. She has two sons who had their own families. Thu’s husband slaughters and sells pork to earn a living. He earns about 5,000,000 VND per month.

Thu sells groceries, vegetables and tofu in a market. She earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for eight years. Besides that, she also grows rice to earn more money. Her challenge in work is lacking capital to invest in her grocery store. Her dream is having more capital to invest in her grocery store and having a stable life. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach this dream. She is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman.

She has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program since 2006. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy more beer, beverages, noodles and salt for her grocery shop. She always wants to expand her grocery shop.

Other members who are part of Thu’s group include the following: 
Luong is 33 years old. She has two children. She breeds chickens and does carpentry. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to invest in her business.
Tan is 51 years old. He has two children. He does carpentry. He wants to borrow 9,374,000 VND to breed chickens and do carpentry.
Tien is 42 years old. He has two children. He breeds pigs. He wants to borrow 6,758,000VND to breed pigs.
Thi is 45 years old. She has two children. She breeds chickens and does carpentry. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more beer, beverages, noodles and salt for her grocery shop

loans.name: Precious

texts.en: Precious is 29 years old and lives with her parents and her three children in the Chikomba West District. She operates a poultry business and uses the profit to pay her children’s school fees. Precious is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase more chicks, vaccines, and feed to expand her business. Precious plans to use the profit she earns to expand her business into a large poultry farm. Precious volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching her students about active citizenship and personal confidence. Patience will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work at the school.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks, vaccines, and feed

loans.name: Oscar Geovanny Irã­a

texts.en: Iâ€™m an itinerant bread salesman.  Twice a week I go to Tegucigalpa and buy my bread supply for the week directly from the bakeries.  Upon returning to my community I travel in my car throughout my neighbouring villages selling the bread. Iâ€™ve had my business for three years and in this time my clientele has increased significantly, particularly with small grocers. At the moment I do not have enough capital to cover the demand that I have.

loans.use: Restocking his store with the most popular types of bread.

loans.name: Elena Gerenarda

texts.en:
My name is Elena Gerenarda, and my principal occupation is in trade. I hope to start a traveling sales business of natural medicines. Since natural medicines are already popular with the people in my town, I hope to develop an even stronger customer base. The results of this business will help me contribute to familial expenses and to the ever-growing costs of my children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Elena Gerenarda, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de medicinas Naturales, el que distribuyo de manera ambulante, cuento con muy buena clientela ya que este producto tiene muy buena aceptación en mi ciudad, gracias a este negocio puedo contribuir con los gastos familiares, ya que cada dia los gastos soy mayores debido a que mis 4 hijos estan estudiando.

loans.use: To purchase medicines, aloe vera, chlorophyll, noni juice, deodorants, dental paste, calcium/magnesium, and vitamin E.

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en: Zebo is married and has two children. Her main goal is for her children to get University degrees. Zebo has been in trade for over 5 years. At the beginning, she had a very small place she was renting at an open-air market. Now she is renting part of a store. She sells food products. She decided to give her previous place at the open-air market to her son, who is helping her in their business. Now these two places bring them higher income. Her son works only after his classes at school. He is a high-school student. The next loan will be used to buy goods for both business sites.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock her business with products that she subsequently can sell to increase her revenue.

loans.name: Success

texts.en: Mrs. Success O. is a married woman of 35 years with 3 children. She has a chemist store where she sells medicines. She is  proud of her business. She needs an additional loan to buy drugs direct from the manufacture/distributor to enable her  to sell  wholesale, which will lead to an increase of her income. Success   has had this business for four years.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Eusebia Narciza

texts.en: Eusebia, aged 42, married and mother of three children, is a very diligent woman. Her children are studying in the community, and her husband works as a print media journalist. Eusebia needs a loan in order to restart her business activities. Before, she was selling skin care and hair products, as well as cosmetic products. She had to stop that activity for one year under a doctor´s advice. Now that she has recovered her health, she will open her business again. She plans to fix her old showcase and buy a new one to put the merchandise she has already purchased. Eusebia says that having her business back will make her feel independent and useful in her community.

loans.use: To purchase skin care and hair repair products, as well to buy a new showcase in order to open her business again.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed learned bread-baking in one of the skills development centers established by an NGO for school dropouts. After the training, Mohamed started his business with $20 in capital, using a local bakery. With his first and second loans from SMT, his business expanded and production increased. With his third loan Mohamed built a small bakery from bricks. He has seen his business growing, and has been able to pay his loans on time. He is requesting more loans to hire laborers, purchase more supplies and expand his market outlet. Mohamed is 22 years old and married with one child. His vision is to eventually see his children through their educations and for them to not drop out of school like him.

loans.use: To hire more laborers to help increase his productivity.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah N. sells fresh food like Matooke (mashed, cooked bananas), potatoes, and coleslaw in the Rasubi trading center. She is a 35 year old widow with 4 children. She needs to pay school fees and is taking the loan build up her store’s inventory to increase her sales and profits.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Total 2087(B) Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 42 years old and divorced with four children. Jane and Agnes sell fresh foods in the market. Agnes wants to use the extra profits from their business to secure another stall at the market. Eleth sells second-hand clothes and wants to use the loan to add inventory. Joyce has a beauty salon. Lydia sells sand.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To re-invest in the businesses

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: B. Islam is a 35-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and three children in the small village of Saatli.  He has been selling milk and yoghurt to the local bazaar traders for six years. He applied for 1000 USD to expand his business and improve the conditions of keeping cattle.

loans.use: Going to expand his business and improve conditions of keeping cattle.

loans.name: Griselda's Group

texts.en:
Griselda is thirty-two years old and a proud mother of one boy and one girl who both attend school.  She leads a group of five women who operate various businesses in the Invicea community of San Cristobal.  Griselda sells an assortment of trendy silver jewelry.  She started her business about seven months agp with a loan her group took from FSMA.  The entrepreneur wishes to add new styles of jewelry to her stock.  This will help her  attract more people to her business, because she will offer more variety.  
The other members of the group are:
Jeniffer Pamela O. S., who will use her loan to buy shirts and pants for her clothing store.
Claudia R. M. will buy materials for her manicure and pedicure center.
Leticia N. will buy products to keep producing food for her customers.
Gabriela S. will spend her loan to buy chickens to resell.

loans.use: To purchase silver jewelry and other goods for various businesses

loans.name: Mahanga Fanikiwa Shg Group

texts.en:
Hellen is a middle-aged married woman with 5 children of her own.  Her late sister's 3 orphans also live with her.  

Hellen started her business nine years ago after working for her aunt helping around the house.  With the little money that she got from her earnings, Hellen was able to save money and start a small second-hand clothing business.  She gets her stock from the famous Kibuye market in Kisumu Town and sells to customers who are mostly from the local neighborhood.  

With the little profits that she gets from the business, Hellen is still able to feed, clothe, and educate her children.  With the help of her loan, Hellen will be able to purchase more bails of clothes which she hopes will increase her sales.  Her long term business vision is to open up a boutique in her home town in Luanda, Western part of Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase more bails of clothes.

loans.name: Dassou

texts.fr:
Dassou G. is a good and honest woman, 65 years old but very active. Born in Aviahonou, her principal business is commerce in pearls and in cosmetics. This business brings in a lot here, providing an income that helps her to support her family.

She is therefore applying for a loan for a supply of pearls and cosmetic products in order to meet her customer expectations better.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Dassou G. est une brave femme de 65 ans mais très active. Née à Aviahonou, elle s’est mariée à un cultivateur dans la même localité. Mère de quatre (04) enfants, son activité principale est le commerce des perles et de produits cosmétiques. Cette activité très génératrice de revenu dans nos milieux, lui procure une source de revenu qui l’aide dans les charges de sa famille. Elle sollicite ainsi un crédit pour s’approvisionner en perles et en produits cosmétiques afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Inventory of pearls and cosmetics

loans.name: Ni Luh Roteh

texts.id:
Ni Luh Roteh used her first loan to buy pig food because previously she already owned a female pig and a piglet. Ni Luh Roteh already obtained some profit from the pig farming business. Despite the humble barn made of bamboo, Ni Luh Roteh is still very keen to develop the business. Using the second loan from Dinari, Ni Luh Roteh bought one female pig which cost Rp. 800,000. Since she started breeding it, it has produced 12 piglets. In three months, she could sell 12 pigs for Rp. 3,000,000. Her profit is Rp.2,000,000 after deducting the revenue with the pig food expense for 6 months. She hopes she can add one more female pig in the future so that she can gain more revenue.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Pada pinjaman pertama Ni Luh Roteh mempergunakan untuk membeli pakan karena sebelumnya ia sudah memiliki 1 ekor induk dan 1 ekor penggemukan. Ni Luh Roteh telah mendapat keuntungan dari usahanya beternaknya.Dengan kondisi kandang yang sederhana memakai kandang bambu Ni Luh Roteh tetap bersemangat dan ingin meningkatkan usaha peternakannya. Dengan mendapat tambahan modal pinjaman periode ke dua dari Dinari Ni Luh Roteh membeli 1 induk seharga Rp.800.000,- untuk dipelihara. Pada masa pemeliharaan sampai dengan saat ini sudah beranak sebanyak 12 ekor.dan bibit babinya dijual setelah dipelihara selama tiga bulan dengan harga Rp.3.000.000,-untuk 12 ekor. Dengan keuntungan sebesar Rp.2.000.000,- setelah dikurangi untuk biaya pakan selama enam bulan. Harapan kedepannya dia ingin menambah 1 induk lagi agar penghasilannya bisa bertambah.

loans.use: To buy female pig

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of more chickens and supplies

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is married with 7 children aged between 12 and 27 years old. She has owned and run a small beauty salon since 2005. Every day, she works from 10am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her services.

Subira now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more salon items for her business

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad cuenta con 45 años de edad, es una vendedora de productos de belleza de el Rancho La Reforma, comunidad localizada en Montemorelos Nuevo León.

Ella inició en el negocio de las ventas de productos de belleza hace 3 años, la idea de realizar esta actividad se debió principalmente a la necesidad de apoyar la economía familiar mediante la aportación de ingresos. La familia de Soledad se compone por su esposo y sus tres hijos.

Actualmente, solicita un préstamo por USD$350 a un plazo de 4 meses para la compra de productos de belleza.

¡Los invito a apoyar a Soledad para que pueda contribuir más al ingreso familiar de su hogar!
texts.en:
Soledad works at the age of 45 years old as a merchandiser of beauty products from Rancho La Reforma, a community located in Montemorelos Nuevo León. Presently she is requesting a loan for $350 over a period of four months to purchase beauty products. She began the business of beauty product sales three years ago. The idea of doing this activity came mainly from the need to support the family economy by contributing an income. The family of Soledad consists of her husband and her three children. I invite you to support Soledad so that she can contribute more to the family income!

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products.

loans.name: Keob

texts.en: Mrs. Keob L. is a farmer in Dock Por village in Takeo province. Mrs. Keob L. is 47 years old and the mother of four, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. In her plantation, she faces a small problem because her field is infertile which has a bad affect on her crop, so she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizers to support her field. Her husband, Mr. Chu Kheng, is a coconut seller who usually sells it door-to-door. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: Keob would like to purchase fertilizers to support her field.

loans.name: Katerine

texts.es: Katerine tiene 28 años, es madre de 3 hijos, vive junto a su esposo, quien la ayuda en lo posible y necesario.  Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, que es manejado un chofer particular, brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros desde hace un año. Se siente contenta porque su vehículo está bien cuidado, porque la persona que trabaja con ella es muy responsable y hacendoso. Este negocio le es muy rentable, ya que recibe ganancias diariamente. Esta muy satisfecha, le va muy bien. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita será utilizado en reparar algunas fallas de su motocarro, para que trabaje al 100% y ella se sienta tranquila y segura.
texts.en:
Katerine is 28 years old and the mother of three children. She lives with her husband who helps her whenever needed and whenever possible. She is the owner of a motorcycle rickshaw, which she drives as a private chauffeur, and has been providing passenger transportation services for the past year. She is happy because her vehicle is well-cared for, and because her co-worker is very responsible and hardworking. This business is very profitable, as she receives daily earnings. She is very satisfied, things are going very well. This is the first time she is requesting a loan with MFP. The money requested will be used to do some repairs on the van so that it can work 100% and she can feel comfortable and secure.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle rickshaw repairs

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan Jiménez es originario del municipio de Condega en la ciudad de Estelí donde se dedica arduamente a su actividad agrícola destacándose en la siembra de hortalizas como lo es tomates y chiltomas. Su actividad económica agrícola la dedica desde muy joven y a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha logrado basta experiencia en esta labor.

Hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de mejorar la condición económica de su actividad para mejorar de igual forma la condición de su familia y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito con el cual dar asistencia técnica al cultivo de las hortalizas. Por este motivo es que espera que su crédito sea otorgado para continuar con su actividad en el municipio de Condega.
texts.en:
Juan Jiménez is a native of the Condega municipality in the city of Estelí, where he works arduously in agriculture. He excels in planting vegetables like tomatoes and sweet peppers. He has been working in the farming business ever since he was very young, and as time passed by, he has managed to acquire a vast amount of experience in this field.

However, today he needs to improve his business’ financial situation so that he can also improve his family’s living conditions, which is why he now turns to Ceprodel for a loan so that he can maintain his crops. For this reason, he hopes that he will be given the loan so that he can continue with his business in the municipality of Condega.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crop maintenance

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: Enrique tiene 27 años de edad, vive con su conviviente quien le dio una hermosa bebe, la misma que le inspira a seguir adelante. El se dedica a brindar servicio de transportes a pasajeros, a razón de ser propietario de un motocarro, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace ya 4 años, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar un buen trato a sus pasajeros y sobre todo la confianza necesaria para que viajen seguros y así puedan buscarlo en otra oportunidad para pedirle su servicio. Su negocio le es rentable, ya que es él mismo maneja y administra su herramienta de trabajo, le va muy bien. Es su primer préstamo con MFP, prometiendo pagar puntual sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita va a remodelar a su motocarro, para lo cual debe de comprar los repuestos necesarios.
texts.en:
Enrique is 27 years old and lives with his common-law wife, who has given him a beautiful daughter, who inspires him to want to get ahead. Being the owner of a motorized buggy, for the past four years he has provided transportation services to passengers. What Enrique likes about his job is treating his passengers well, that they are confident of their safety and will look for another opportunity to request his services. His business is profitable and because he does his own driving and repairs he does very well. This is Enrique’s first loan with MFP and he has promised to make his payments on time. With the money from this loan he is going to refurbish his buggy and he needs to purchase the necessary parts.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbishing his motorized buggy

loans.name: Abdurazzok

texts.en:
Abdurazzok S. is 43 years old. He is married and has three children. Abdurazzok has a middle special education. His specialization is accounting. But he went over to agro-business because the salary was small. And with that small salary he has to feed his family and pay for his children’s education.

Abdurazzok works hard to cultivate his produce such as wheat, onions, carrots, and other vegetables. He works from early morning till late at night, hoping to have a rich harvest. Abdurazzok sells his produce in the market where it is always in high demand due to its good quality. He also raises cattle.

His works fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and grow his business. Today Abdurazzok is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for a term of 11 months to buy greater quantities of fertilizer and also calves. Let's help Abdurazzok as he works hard to improve the quality of life for his family!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer and calves

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: C., age 27, lives in a small village in Pursat Province where she raises pigs, next to her house. She normally sells all her pigs to a buyer five or six months after she begins raising them. She lives with her husband and three children. Her husband’s name is Sina, age 25. He earns a living cultivating rice crop. As the dry season is coming, C.’s husband plans to plant rice but he is not enough operating capital. Therefore, C. is requesting a loan for her husband to use for growing rice and to buy a water buffalo for plowing the field.

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo for plowing a field

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en:
K. Khosiyat is 39 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 4 children. With the purpose to support her family, Khosiyat is selling underwear for women. She has been in this business already for 14 years. Over these years, she gained the experience in choosing goods of good quality that meet the requirements of customers with various levels of income.

The business is very stable which allows Khosiyat to improve the living of the family. Khosiyat has been working with IMON for almost 3 years. She managed her previous loans with accuracy and made all the payments in a timely manner. Today Khosiyat is requesting 1275 US Dollars in order to expand her inventory. Khosiyat would like to thank everyone supporting her and to ensure them that she’ll pay back the loan in 12 months.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for expanding her inventory

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en: Mrs. Nhor N. was born in 1951 and she lives in Krang Roung village in Takeo province. Currently she is a farmer who grows rice on her own piece of land. Her husband, Mr. Khat Choeun, is a recycling middleman. His business is doing well, so he wants to expand it. In order to help her husband grow his business, Mrs. Nhor N. requests a loan to combine with her savings to buy a motorbike.  Then she can drive to buy more recyclables to resell. She hopes to increase her income to help improve life for her family. She has two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is employed in a company. She and her husband are pictured.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for driving to buy more recyclables to resell

loans.name: Lusmila

texts.es:
Lusmila es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatun Sacha que significa Árbol Grande en quechua.
Lusmila es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Lusmila junto a su esposo realizan transporte urbano a diferentes ferias y en algunas oportunidades compra frutas que luego comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Lusmila necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas y camote.
Los sueños de Lusmila son tener mas capital, aumentar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lusmila is a partner of Ccatun Sacha Communal Bank which means "Big Tree" in Quechua. Lusmila, who is 22 years old, lives with her partner and one son. With her husband, she runs a taxi service to different markets and, in some cases, she buys fruits that she sells comercially in the wholesale food market in the city. Lusmila needs a loan of 1000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of fruits and sweet potatoes.
