In order to earn extra profit and to make the business more successful, Mrs. El L. will be using the loan she requested to accumulate a larger quantity of her inventory items. The other borrower is Mr. Y.. He is a grocery seller who is asking for a loan to sustain her business growth.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger quantity of her inventory items.

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Mrs. Huon M. is a 33-year-old married woman.  She is a villager living in Ampil village, Kandal province. 

Mrs. Huon M. and her husband, Mr. Met Kuok, are farmers who own a plot of rice field that they use to cultivate rice for a living. 

For this farm, they do not have enough money to buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice. So Mrs. Huon M. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed to cultivate rice.  Aside from being a farmer, her husband is also pig middleman.  

This couple has five children who are attending the local school and also help in their parents' businesses.  Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Batochir

texts.en:
Mr. Batochir D. is 47 years old, married and has two sons. His elder son, Gankhulug, 22, is married and works as a policeman at the railroad police department; he lives with his family in his own house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Batochir’s younger son, Gankhuu, 19, is a student at the police academy and will be a policeman after he graduates. Batochir's wife looks after his grandson at home.

Batochir’s family is the most important thing to him. He says as a father he would like to be financially able to provide a good education for his children. His son Gankhulug's employer has given him a lease on an apartment; therefore, he is asking for a loan to pay 900,000 MNT for the first payment installment. He is short by this amount.

loans.use: For a loan to pay 900,000 MNT for a first installment on an apartment lease

loans.name: Oscar Alberto

texts.es:
Oscar es un padre de familia de 38 años de edad que reside junto  a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío Punto Cuatro del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola de pobladores humildes y trabajadores que se encuentra ubicada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de repuestos para bicicleta y motocicleta. El cuenta con un establecimiento en su domicilio en donde atiende al público en general. El negocio goza de buena acogida por parte de sus clientes ya que las motocicletas y bicicletas son unos medios de transporte bastante utilizado en el lugar.

Oscar desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más repuestos para poder atender a más clientes y percibir mayores ingresos de modo que pueda percibir más ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles
texts.en:
Oscar is a 38 year old father living with his wife and children in Punto Cuatro, Mochumí district, a farming area inhabited by humble and hard working people located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He sells replacement parts for bicycles and motorcycles.  He has an establishment in his house where he tends to the general public.  The business is well received by his customers because bicycles and motorcycles are one of the area’s most used modes of transportation.

Oscar would like to expand the business acquiring more replacement parts to tend to more customers and earn higher income for his family.  He has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy more replacement parts.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
La señora Alberta tiene 35 años, ella está separada de su marido ya que  la abandono y se fue con otra mujer, tiene dos hijos de 14 y 8 años, los cuales están a cargo de Alberta, y el padre de los niños des da una asistencia familiar de $us 58 cada mes para los dos niños, monto que no alcanza ni para el material escolar, entonces doña Alberta tiene que trabajar duro para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos.

Alberta actualmente vive con su padre ya que la madre acaba de fallecer aproximadamente 6 meses, para ella esa perdía es muy duro ya ella le cuidaba a los niños mientras trabajaba, vive en la comunidad de Chinchilla, su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda, cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos, además Alberta trabaja en las noches de  sereno en una Cooperativa.
El préstamo será destinado para la construcción de comederos (establo) para el ganado, con lo cual estarán más protegidos los ganados en estas temporadas de lluvia. 

Entre sus sueños y metas de Alberta son crecer en su actividad, hasta tener una pequeña granja de por lo menos 20 cabezas de ganado, y lo más importante que sus dos hijos terminen de estudiar una carrera profesional para que de ese modo tengan un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Alberta is 35 years old and is separated from her husband who left her for another woman.  She has two children, ages 14 and 8, who are dependant on her for their livelihood.  The children's father pays a total monthly child support of $58 which does not even cover the cost of school materials.  So Alberta has to work hard to provide an income for her family.

Alberta currently lives with her father since her mother passed away around six months ago.  The loss was very hard since her mother took care of the children while she worked.  She lives in a town in Chinchilla and her main activity is dairy production.  She delivers fresh milk to a company that produces dairy products.  Alberta also works as a security guard at the Co-op.

She plans to use the loan to build a stable for her cattle so they will be protected during the rainy season.

Alberta's goals for the future include growing her business until she can have a small farm of at least 20 cattle.  The most important thing for her is to see her children finish their education and have a profession so they can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To build a stable for dairy cattle

loans.name: Alice Kavithe

texts.en: Alice M. is 48 years old, married, and has two children.  She has been selling fruits and vegetables in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this is her first loan.  She plans to use the loan to buy tomatoes, onions, cabbages in bulk to sell. In the future, Alice hopes to expand her shop and stock a variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions, cabbages in bulk to sell

loans.name: Mech

texts.en:
Mech O., 50, is a local farmer who lives in Kompong Cham Province. Usually, she generates around $1 of profit a day for the needs of her family. 

Mech O. has no life partner because her husband died of senility many years ago. Currently, she lives with her niece and nephew and they are working in different occupations. Her niece is a mobile used-goods seller for earning daily income. 

This is rice-harvesting season and Mech O. needs capital to purchase rice to store in her stock supply to later sell when prices increase. With the rest of the funds, she will support her niece's business and buy used goods for selling. 

Note: Mech O. and her niece, nephew and young granddaughter are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To stock up on rice while prices are low for selling later

loans.name: Bedan Kimingi

texts.en:
Bedan, 59 years old, has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 15 years.  He mainly plants potatoes in his farm.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount for planting during the planting season. 

In future, Bedan hopes to increase his farming, hence the produce.

loans.use: To use in planting

loans.name: Union Por El Progreso Group

texts.es: El Sr. Moisés es casado, tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar y  tiene 40 años de edad,  actualmente asume el cargo de presidente  en la alcancía comunal “Unión por el Progreso” grupo  conformado por 7 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Moisés trabaja desde hace 2 años como chofer en una Moto taxi propia, este trabajo surge a raíz de que lo despidieron en la empresa donde trabajaba, pero sus deseos de superación eran mas grandes que sus problemas y es así que hoy en día a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, que le ha permitido construir su casa, y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos . Sabemos que Moisés  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Moisés is married and has three school age children.  He’s 40 years old and is currently the President of the “Unión por el Progreso” (Unity for Progress) communal bank, a bank that has 7 members involved in various commercial activities.

Moisés has been working driving his own mototaxi for the past two years.  This job emerged when he lost the job he had in a firm where he used to work.  However, his desire to get ahead was greater than his problems and this is how today he has managed to improve his income which has led to his building his house and provide his family with a better quality of life.

With the aim to continue growing he has requested a new loan to cover the cost of his children’s school supplies.  We know that Moisés will meet his goals with much work and effort and that Edaprospo loans will help him.

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Habari Njema Group

texts.fr: Eliza B.  est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe d’affaire Habari Njema, âgée de 48 ans, veuve, mère de 8 enfants qui étudient  tous. Son mari fut décédé suite à une maladie inopinée. La  cliente  Eliza B. est  vendeuse des poissons salés chipsi (le chipsi sont des muettement des poissons salés issus de l’Ouganda-Kampala). Elle installe son point de vente dans un dépôt situé au boulevard Nyamwisi -2 lampes. Elle démarra son activité avec un fonds propre reçu des petites commissions de 20$ dans les quelles elle  intervenait comme un intermédiaire. Il ya 8 ans qu’elle est en activité. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouvelles marchandises (125 Kg de chipsi).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, acheter une parcelle pour sa famille. La cliente Eliza B. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Habari Njema est constitué de 26 membres dont 3 clients ne sont visibles sur la photo du groupe..
texts.en:
Eliza B. is an entrepreneur, and president of the Habari Njema business group, which is composed of 26 members, three of whom do not appear in the photo. She is 48 years old, a widow, and the mother of eight children who all attend school. Her husband died from a sudden illness. 

Eliza B. sells “chipsi” (a type of salted fish from Uganda-Kampala). She has a booth with two lamps in a depot located on the Nyamwisi Boulevard. 

She started her business with her own money consisting of small $20 commissions earned as an intermediary. She has been in business for eight years. 

This new loan will allow her to replenish her stock (125 kg of chipsi). She also plans to expand her business and purchase a plot of land for her family. 

Eliza B. wishes to thank Hekima for helping poor women who cannot turn to traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy 125 kg of chipsi

loans.name: Lham-Erdene

texts.en: Lham-Erdene S. is 33 years old,  married, and has two children.  They live in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They have a decent standard of living. Her husband works as a fireman for a company in the winter. They used to live in the countryside and came to live in the city in 2002. Lham-Erdene began her clothing trading business in 2005 by renting a stall at the local market. She wants to expand her business and increase her working capital in order to have her own store in the future. They bought a car with their profits last year and her husband drives it as a taxi in order to earn additional income. She is a hardworking and patient person who says, " We would like to have an apartment in the future."  Lham-Erdene is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase more clothing from China for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Menzita

texts.en:
Menzita D. T. is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 50 years old. Menzita is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Menzita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and raising pigs for sale. She is also making and selling cheese cup cakes. Menzita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Menzita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Menzita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Menzita is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Menzita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Agustina Manuela

texts.es:
Agustina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 56 años de edad.  Está casada y tiene 7 hijos independientes.  Actualmente vive con uno de sus nietos quien aún está en edad escolar.  Agustina tiene educación primaria (incompleta).
La señora  se dedica  a la venta de tejidos como: chompas, suéter, hinaguas, medias y artefactos.  Trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace ocho meses.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de venta de ropa.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra de 50 kilos de lana para la fabricación de sus chompas y comprará algunos artefactos para luego venderlos en  distintas ferias, trabaja sola ya que su esposo es maestro en construcción.
Su sueño es tener su carro para ponerlo a trabajar en servicio urbano.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, las charlas y lo que ganan sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Agustina is a member of the communal bank named "Cinnamon Flower", located in the district of Puno of the department of Puno. She is 56 years old, married, and she has 7 grown children. She lives with one of her grandchildren who is still school aged. Agustina has a primary school education (incomplete). 

She sells knitted crafts such as jackets, sweaters, socks, tights, and accessories. She has been with the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva Field Partner) for 8 months. Her first loan was in the amount of S/.300 nuevos soles and she used it for her clothing business.

This new loan is in the amount of S/.1000 nuevos soles and she will invest in the purchase of 50 kg of wool to make jackets and to purchase a few accessories to resell at the different fairs. She works alone as her husband is a construction worker. 

Her dream is to have a car to be able to work in public transportation.

What she enjoys about her communal bank is the easy loan process, the training, and the interest earned on savings.

loans.use: to purchase wool and accessories.

loans.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, cuatro de ellos ya son mayores de edad y una chica de 11 años que estudia en colegio. Todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante. Ella es modista, aprendió esta profesión en un centro artesanal hace varios años.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser toda clase de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y también elabora ropa para niñas las mismas que coloca en una vitrina para la venta. Además de su taller de costura también tiene una papelería  en su mismo local el cual atiende al mismo tiempo que realiza sus trabajos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, lleva 5 años en su negocio y gracias a Dios nunca le ha faltado trabajo.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande con mas maquinas y operarias y, mejorar su papelería.
texts.en:
In the San Pablo parish of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí [province], known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the "Unión Y  Solidaridad" ["Union and Solidarity"] communal bank meet every fifteen days.

In this place we meet Rosa, who is 52 years old. She is married, and she and her husband have five children: four who are already grown, and a girl of 11 who is in school. All of her children still live with her. Her husband is a merchant. She designs and makes clothing, a profession she learned at a handicrafts center several years ago. 

She has a small tailoring workshop in her home, where she has worked for many years sewing all kinds of clothing. She works by fulfilling orders from individuals, and she also makes girls' clothing which she arranges in a showcase for sale. In addition to her tailoring workshop, she also has a paper goods shop in the same location, which she operates at the same time while doing her sewing work. She works every day from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m., and sometimes even later when she has orders to deliver. She has operated this business for 5 years, and she says that "thanks to God," she has never lacked for work. 

She will use this new loan to buy fabrics, thread, buttons and other materials for tailoring. She has been with the communal bank for 5 years, and she likes it because she started her business with the first loan. 

Her dreams are to have a bigger workshop with more machines and workers, and to improve her paper goods shop.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, buttons and other materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Claudia Lorena

texts.es:
Claudia, se dedica a la venta de artesanías, vive con su esposo y un hijo de 8 años de edad, ella vende en las escuelas de los pueblos, su mercadería son juguetes, pulseras, lápices y artesanías, lo realiza desde hace 10 años.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de  más mercadería, como artesanías, collares, pulceras, llaveros y accesorios para los jóvenes estudiantes, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar los ingresos de su familia.
Su aspiración es ser una comerciante estable, tener un local fijo para ofrecer la mercadería.
texts.en:
Claudia sells crafts. She lives with her husband and an 8-year-old son. She makes sales in the towns' schools, and her merchandise is toys, bracelets, pencils and crafts. She has been doing this for 10 years.

Claudia is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise like crafts, necklaces, bracelets, key rings and accessories for young students. This loan will help her to increase her family's income.

Her dream is to be a stable businesswoman with a storefront to sell her merchandise from.

loans.use: to buy crafts, necklaces, bracelets and key rings.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.en:
Forty-eight-year-old Timotea earns a living through buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for four years. Timotea buys and sells bananas, cassava and taro. She earns about 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month from this business.

Timotea's loan will be used to buy more vegetables, such as sweet potatoes, bananas and more. She hopes for this loan to help improve her earnings. She also hopes to earn better and send her four children to school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, such as sweet potatoes, bananas and more.

loans.name: Bayanbat

texts.en:
Bayanbat, 41, lives with his wife and 11-year-old-daughter, a secondary school student, in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Govi-Altai Province, Mongolia.

With the help of his wife, Bayanbat manages a coal and wood-trading business which he started in his town in 2003. Since then their business has stabilized, allowing them to rent a stall at a local market and buy a truck for their transportation service business in 2008. Bayanbat transports large amounts of coal during winter seasons and construction materials during summer seasons. He also bought a trailer with his earnings in order to carry more coal or construction material, thereby increasing his business profit.

Bayanbat is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase wood for his business and some auto parts for his truck. A polite and responsible businessman, he says, "I am planning to expand my business in order to better my life."

loans.use: to purchase wood for his business.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en: Emelda, 44 years of age, is married and blessed with four children. She is engaged in the direct selling business. She sells cosmetics and apparel products in their village. Her net income is 6,000 PHP monthly. She is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase lipstick, perfumes, lotion and powder to sell. She hopes that Kiva lenders will continue assisting her in the business so that she can further improve it and support her family with enough basic necessities.

loans.use: To purchase lipstick, perfumes, lotion and powder to sell

loans.name: Divino Maestro Group

texts.es:
El grupo Divino Maestro lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María del Socorro de 52 años quien se dedica al comercio de cosméticos desde hace 10 años con la empresa Avon. Ella con el crédito compra mercadería en perfumes, cremas, lápiz labial, sombras, vanidad…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Juana Mercedes de 58 años comerciante de ropa y calzado desde hace 4 años y Auxiliadora  vende ropa usada desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The “Divino Maestro” group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising women. One of them is María del Soccoro, who is 52 years old. She has been selling cosmetics for 10 years with the Avon company. With the loan, she will buy merchandise such as perfumes, creams, lipsticks, eye shadows, and other such items, etc.

The other members are Juana Mercedes, 58 years old, who has been selling clothing and shoes for 4 years, and Auxiliador, who has been selling used clothing for 10 years.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Ikhlas

texts.en: Ikhlas is a 50-year-old woman who started a small retail business at home 11 years ago to help her retired husband support their family of nine sons and daughters. Ikhlas’ business is based on selling different products such as cosmetic materials, cleaning products, and even clothes. From the profit she earned besides her husband retirement salary, they were able to raise their children properly and send them to school. And because of her good reputation in the neighborhood, she was able to keep on going for the last 11 years of business, Now Ikhlas wants to expand her business and open a small retail store that would be more accessible to others.

loans.use: To open a small retail store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth de 52 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Chocope que pertenece a la provincia de La Libertad.  Zona de actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Elizabeth cuenta con su negocio de comida en un puesto que a colocado en lugar concurridopor las personas de la zona donde vive, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, cuenta con su propia clientela, es conocida por la limpieza y la buena sazón que tiene, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar insumos y utensilios, para  seguir brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes y con sus ganancias cubrir sus gastos de su hogar.  Elizabeth con su trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante se ha ganado la confianza de sus clientes, con la finalidad de que en un futuro tenga un restaurante donde ofresca todo tipo de comida.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 52, lives in her own house which only has electricity with her husband and children.  It’s located in Chocope District that belongs to La Libertad Province.  It’s a primarily farming and livestock raising area.

Elizabeth has a business of her own consisting of a food stand located in her neighborhood in an area that has lots of passersby.  She’s been in this activity for several years and she has an established clientele of her own.  She’s known for her cleanliness and tasty dishes.  Income she earns will allow her to have better quality of life for her family.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy ingredients and utensils to continue providing good customer service and use profits to cover household expenses.  Elizabeth has won over the trust of her customers with her work and desire to get ahead.  In the future, she’d like to have a restaurant where she can offer all types of food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils to continue preparing her food.

loans.name: Seila

texts.en:
Seila, 29, is single. She lives with her brother and sister and widowed mother in a village along National Road Number 5 approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Seila is a garment worker. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike to drive to work.

Note: the motorbike behind Seila does not belong to her, it belongs to Maxima’s credit officer. Seila is just standing there to have her picture taken.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 43-year-old business lady married to Mwangi who is not working. They are blessed with five children. She has been running a retail shop for the past year with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family members. 

She is applying for her sixth loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Margret will use the loan to add stocks of sugar, rice, wheat flour and cooking fat to sell. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add sugar, rice, wheat flour and cooking fat to sell

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita works hard to support her family. Julita is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Julita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Julita has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Julita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Julia Justina

texts.es:
Doña Julia, de 57 años de edad, originaria de la cuidad de Granada, es comerciante, ella vende zapatos en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Granada, lleva 5 años con este negocio, ella empezó vendiendo chinelas de baño de manera ambulante sin tener un punto fijo de venta pero poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo fue adquiriendo su pequeño local. 
Ella esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar inventario de zapatos de diferentes estilos y medidas para vender. Ella espera vender un poco más al tener más variedad de estilos para vender y que le brinde la oportunidad de seguir adelante con su negocio. Ella desea ampliar su local, hacerlo un poco mas grande y contratar a vendedores que le ayuden a vender su productos en los diferentes zonas comerciales de Granada.
texts.en:
Doña Julia is 57 years old and is a native of the city of Granada.  She is a merchant who has been selling shoes in the municipal market in the city of Granada for 5 years.  She started out selling bath slippers in an itinerant manner without having a fixed location from which to sell.  Little by little and with a lot of hard work, she was able to buy her own small local.  

She is requesting a loan to buy different styles and sizes of shoes to sell.  She hopes that by having more variety of styles that she will sell a little more and have the opportunity to get ahead in her business.  She wants to expand her local, making it a little bigger, as well as hire sales people that will help her to sell her products in the different shopping districts in Granada.

loans.use: purchase an inventory of different styles and sizes of shoes to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children. Josephine has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas. She has had this business for three years. She requests a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy green and yellow bananas to sell. Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green and yellow bananas to sell.

loans.name: Vyukakare Group

texts.fr:
Pasteur est un commerçant âgé de 38ans qui habite  le centre de la ville de Gitega au centre du pays. Il vend divers articles de boutique (haricot, riz, farine, souliers en plastique, etc) depuis 2ans. Il est aussi cultivateur. Il a fait ses études jusqu’en 5e année primaire. Il est marié a Agnès et ont ensemble 6 enfants dont 4 sont a l’école.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 180,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités d’articles de boutique (haricot, riz, farine, souliers en plastique, etc) à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« VYUKAKARE»
texts.en:
Pasteur is a 38-year old trader who lives in the centre of the town of Gitega, which lies in the centre of the country. He has been selling various shop products (beans, rice, flour, plastic shoes, etc.) for the past two years. He is also a farmer. He did five years of primary school. He is married to Agnes and they have six children, of whom four are at school.

The Kiva loan of 180,000 burundi francs which he will get will allow him to increase his capital so that he can buy large quantities of shop products (beans, rice, flour, plastic shoes, etc.) and resell them for a large profit.

Pasteur is a member of the Vyukakare community group.

loans.use: to increase his capital in order to buy large quantities of shop products (beans, rice, flour, plastic shoes, etc.) for resale with the aim of making significant profits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add a room and enlarge the house.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 37 years old and married with two children, living in Hioma, Uganda. He is the only income earner in the family and his dream is to build a permanent residential house. 

He has owned a clothing business for the past 10 years. He started as an employee then later got capital to start his own business. He faces a challenge of the business being seasonal and of defaulters. Ronald wants a loan  to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zonia Blanca

texts.es:
Zonia es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte, tiene 64 años, es viuda y madre de 7 hijos. 
Zonia es modista, diseña y arregla prendas de vestir, es socia desde hace 20 años, el primer préstamo que recibió era en dólares y con ese dinero pudo comprar telas, cada semana ahorraba 2 dólares, gracias al apoyo de Finca logró educar a sus hijos y pudo comprarse en carro, ahora también vende cosméticos de catálogos, le gusta trabajar con Finca porque tiene ahorro programado en cada cuota que cancela además le permite traer ahorro voluntario, y asimismo las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal le enseña los valores y principios que debe tener una persona. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos y los distribuirá a sus clientes fijos. Su meta es sacar profesional a su ultima hija.
texts.en: Zonia is a member of the Communal Bank Buena Suerte [Good Luck], she is 64 years old and a mother of 7 children. Zonia makes, designs and alters clothes. She has been a member for 20 years. The first loan that she received was in dollars and she was able to buy material with this money. Every week she saved 2 dollars. Thanks to FINCA's support she managed to educate her children and buy herself a car. Now she also sells cosmetics from catalogs. She enjoys working with FINCA because savings are integrated into the membership fees and it is also possible to bring voluntary savings. Furthermore the training that she received in her Communal Bank has taught her about the values and principles that people should have. The loan that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of cosmetics and she will sell them to her regular customers. Her goal is to provide her youngest daughter with the opportunity to have a professional career.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Tat

texts.en: Mrs. Tat is a rice cultivator as well as a hog raiser from Pouk district, Siem Reap province. She has a life partner in her husband who is a construction worker, and they are blessed with 3 school-aged kids. She really tried hard to look after her pigs and make her wooden piggery clean every day in order to keep her pigs healthy. This year Mrs. Tat wants to enlarge her piggery and buy additional piglets for raising. Therefore, she requires some funds from HKL and Kiva to invest in her pig-raising business. She hopes that she will be able to generate more income and better her living condition.

loans.use: to enlarge her wooden piggery and buy additional piglets for raising.

loans.name: Astrid Evelyn

texts.es:
La señora Astrid Evelyn es casada tiene dos hijos, su esposo es quien trabaja en una agencia aduanal como tramitador, actualmente esta embarazada y pronto de que llegue su bebe, necesita tener pagada los gastos médicos y la clínica. Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para liquidar y que la llegada del bebe no tenga ningún problema. 
Doña Astrid Evelyn esta agradecida por el crédito anterior, ya que pudo liquidar los gastos escolares de sus hijos, y espera contar con su cooperación para este crédito que es para la llegada se su tercer hijo.
texts.en:
Astrid Evelyn is married and has two children. Her husband works as a claims administrator for a customs agency. She is currently pregnant and as soon as her baby arrives, her medical expenses and the clinic must be paid for. That is why she requests a loan, so she can pay for them and so the baby's arrival has no problems at all.
Astrid Evelyn is thankful for the previous loan, because she was able to pay for her children's school expenses. She hopes she can count on your cooperation for this loan, which is for the arrival of her third child.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses at the clinic where her child will be born.

loans.name: Jenty

texts.en:
Jenty is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food at a food stall in Yambio, South Sudan for three years.
Jenty is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and oil for sale

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El presente grupo se formó gracias a una de las miembros,  quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Ellas son personas personas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que siempre se esfuerzan por dar lo mejor a sus familias.
La sra. Maria es una de las miembros del grupo, ella se dedica a la costura y confiteria, esta casada  con el Señor Marcial hace 23 años quien se desempeña como constructor de obra, tienen dos hijos menores de edad y otro mayor de edad.  Maria sueña con abrir una despensa dentro de su casa para lograr asi brindar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas y demás insumos necesarios para poder abastecer su taller de costura y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando. Agradece a la fundacion y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le estan brindando.
texts.en:
This group came together thanks to one of the members who invited and organized her friends to become part of the program Committee of Enterprising Women. They are very hardworking people who work hard to give the best to their families.

Maria is one of the members of the group. She works in sewing and makes sweets. She has been married to Marcial for 23 years. He works in construction. They have two younger children and one child who is grown. Maria dreams of opening a small grocery store in her house so that she can provide a better quality of life to her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy fabrics, threads, needles and other items necessary for stocking her sewing workshop so that she can continue working. She is grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity that they are providing her.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, needles, clasps, buttons, and other items necessary for stocking her sewing workshop

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en: Cissy is married with five children and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members(mother and orphans). She operates a pub in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for four years. She works on a retail basis seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 1,700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy crates of beer, soda, local gin . Her major business challenges include on and off electricity. She aspires to see her business expand so as to serve more customers. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer, soda, local gin .

loans.name: Ikirezi Sub Group B

texts.en: Helena is a group leader; aged 45.She is married with 9 children aged between 14 and 22 years. The group is called IKIREZI means “Good people” in English. They sell different products,they wish to expand their businesses,make more profits and hence have a better for future. She has a shop and has been running this business for the past 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more chocolate,Pens,Glucose and Colgate for sale.With the profits from the business,she would like to pay school fees of her children.

loans.use: To buy more chocolate,Pens,Glucose and Colgate for sale.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio owns his business on the outskirts of Guayaquil, but his neighborhood has many people that are potential clients. He has 3 children and a wife who helps out in their store whenever necessary. Rogelio has 5 years of experience in the business but needs capital in order to buy from wholesalers at cheaper prices. He also states that he will use new capital to invest in products that are in high demand at his store but he cannot currently afford. Rogelio says loan sharks charge above 20% interest and he cannot afford to repay those loans.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Amassanh

texts.en:
Amassanh A. is married and the mother of six. She is locally known through her business selling produce from her garden. A very courageous woman who likes to compete, she finds herself compelled to bear all family expenses, since her husband lacks steady employment. The income from her small business does not cover all her needs. Despite her drive and best intentions, she is currently held back, particularly by finances. She came up with the idea to apply for financial support to expand her business. The $600 loan that she is requesting will serve as capital for the business of selling the produce from her garden. Bolstering her business will thus bring living hope to her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée et mère de six (6) enfants, Madame A. Amassanh est connue dans sa localité à travers son activité de vente des produits maraîchers. Femme très courageuse qui aime se battre, elle se trouve dans l’obligation de prendre en charge toute la famille car son mari n’a pas d’emploi fixe. Le revenu de son petit commerce n’arrive pas à couvrir tous ses besoins. Malgré son ardeur et sa bonne foi, elle est aujourd’hui limitée par les moyens surtout financiers. Elle se propose alors de solliciter un appui financier pour élargir son commerce. Le crédit de $600 qu’elle demande va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour la vente produits maraîchers. Le renforcement de l’activité apportera un espoir de vivre dans la famille.

loans.use: Selling produce from her garden

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.en: Abdullo is a photographer with 20 years of experience. Abdullo also acts as teacher for those who would like to learn making professional photos. His two sons work together with him. When he applied for the first loan last year, he had only 3 cameras of the old type. Since then, he was able to change the equipment in his shop; he bought a new computer, 2 digital cameras, and a printer. The quality of the photos that he was printing improved, and he increased his profit. He would like to use the next loan to buy one more digital camera and one more printer.

loans.use: Improving working conditions

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Six months ago Victor took out his first loan with Kiva and Mifex. He wisely invested the money in goods that would make perfect gifts during the busy Christmas season, specifically focusing on cell phone products and accessories. He made a significant amount of profit after making his investment. With the money he made, he decided to pursue a new business venture.

Victor has set up an ice cream shop in the home of his parents. He also travels around the neighborhood and the main streets of Guayaquil selling his products. He has seen a huge change since receiving his first loan. He now has a business of his own in his parents' house, and he feels much more optimistic about the future. He now hopes to receive a second loan so he may sell other products from his ice cream shop. He is planning on having a small store where he will sell all types of different products.

Victor still lives at home with his parents and his three children. His goal is to be able to buy a home of his own for his young and growing family.

loans.use: Buy different types of ice cream and introduce other products.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
Mr. Sabino has a vehicle and he is affiliated with the Trufi #5 syndicate, where he works from Monday through Sunday. His wife is a vendor, and they have two school-age children. To clarify, a "trufi" is like a taxi, but with a fixed route.

His home is located in the Alto Tacagua neighborhood of the city of La Paz. This is the third time he has requested a loan. The requested amount will be destined for the maintenance and repair of the motor of his vehicle.

His work and credit record allow approval of this loan, since he has experience as a transporter and the routes he works have a lot of passenger demand, which will give him the income to cover the loan.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El señor Sabino tiene una movilidad y esta afiliado al sindicato del trufi # 5 donde trabaja de lunes a domingo. Su esposa es comerciante y tienen dos hijos que en edad escolar. A manera de aclaración un trufi es un taxi pero con ruta fija.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para mantenimiento y reparación de motor de su movilidad

Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en como transportista y las líneas que atiende tienen mucha demanda de pasajeros, lo cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Vehicle repair.

loans.name: Martha Maria

texts.en:
Martha Maria T. has had a small business for 3 years selling soda water and juice from her home. The city of San Lorenzo is very hot, and so she has very good sales.

She is asking for this loan of $150 to purchase more soft drinks to sell. She plans to use the profits from her business to help with her family's monthly expenses.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
This young businesswoman is single with 2 children, with great wishes to succeed. Thanks to her parents and partner they gathered US$1000 a few years ago and established a modest and humble business.

This business has been located in the Israel Lewites market for more than 19 years. Prior to having this business she was a housewife, but she had to go to work due to the dificult economic situation that confronted her family.

Today her business has grown and she feels happy to have propered. She has worked with CEPRODEL for more than 2 years and has a very good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

Esta joven emprendedora, es soltera con 2 hijos y con grandes deseos de superación. Gracias a que sus padres y compañero de vida reunieron un capital de US$1,000.00 (dolares) con lo que hace varios años establecieron un modesto y humilde puesto .

El puesto que actualmente ella posee está ubicado en el mercado Israel Lewites desde hace más de 19 años, antes de tener su puesto ella era ama de casa, condicion que tuvo que abandonar debido a la situacion economica dificil que enfrentaba su familia. Hoy en dia su negocio ha progresado y se siente muy dichosa de haber prosperado. Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace más de 2 años con quien tiene muy buen récord crediticio.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Margreth

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Margreth L., pictured with 8-year-old son, Prince, who lovingly assists her (when there's a camera around, at least) in her business raising and selling chickens. Margreth established the business earlier this year and now requires a loan of $275 to purchase additional chickens. She is married to husband Paul, with whom she has four children under 11.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Munaku A(Ii) Group

texts.en:
Zaina is 30 years old and married with four children. She owns a retail shop, and with extra business profits, wants to construct a residential house. Robinah and Jackie have beauty salons, and Margaret sells firewood for a living. Ruth sells charcoal and wants to use the loan to purchase more charcoal to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more retail shop items.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is twenty-seven years old and she has four children, three of them boys. Martha has been selling a collection of fashionable jeans to men and women of the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal. Until now, she has been operating her business from her house, but she plans on renting a locale before long to run her activity. Martha will use her loan to expand the business and add an assortment of sneakers and blouses.  That way, the entrepreneur will attract more people and increase her income. Martha wants to provide a comfortable lifestyle with her family.

loans.use: Martha would like to purchase some sneakers and blouses in order to expand her small business.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Mariamu K.. She is 38 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 10 and 17 years old. In addition, she has one dependent who lives with her because she is in school and her parents live in a remote area. In 2004, Mariamu established her general store business. She is assisted by her children. Mariamu has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase a machine to process traditional herbs. In the future, Mariamu plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services.

Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to process traditional herbs.

loans.name: Blanca Luz

texts.es:
Blanca belongs to the community bank Mujeres Creativas 2, located at Asentamiento Human Rumbo al Futuro Mz 3 Lt.7, in the district of Manantay in the city of Ucayali. She is 39 years old and is mother of 3 children, her husband is a worker for the telephone company. Blanca used her first loan from Manuela Ramos in the amount of S/.300 to invest in a small grocery store.

Her grocery store has expanded and now she sells more bread products. In the morning she manages her house chores and cares for her children and gets them ready for school and in the afternoons she manages her grocery store.

With this loan in the amount of S/.800, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, and a pack of pasta, some preserves, soft drinks, breads, snacks, etc..

Blanca is happy because thanks to the loan received from Manuela Ramos she and her family are keeping well, and that makes her very happy.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Blanca pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas 2, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Rumbo al Futuro Mz 3 Lt. 7, del Distrito de Manantay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es trabajador de Telefónica, es así que Blanca con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad su bodega ha crecido ahora vende mas productos de pan llevar, en las mañanas se dedica a las labores domesticas y atender a sus hijos para llevarlos al colegio y en las tardes se ocupa de la atención de su bodega. Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 800, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 paquete de fideos, conservas, gaseosas, pan, golosinas, etc. Blanca esta contenta por que gracias al préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos ella y su familia están saliendo adelante y eso la hace muy feliz.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase more merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Laura Enith

texts.es:
Mrs. Laura Enith belongs to the Communal Virgen de la Natividad Bank located at Jr. Amazonas 398 in the District of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 40 years old and is a mother of four children. Her husband is a merchant. With her first loan for 300 soles received from Manuela Ramos, Laura decided to invest in a business selling food products. Currently her food sales and profits are growing and she plans to remodel her house to accommodate a future restaurant where she can offer more services to her customers as a place to have fun and eat delicious food. With the help of her children, she'll be open every day. With this loan, which will be repaid within 4 months, she will set up her home with tables, chairs, fresh paint and new lighting. She will also purchase meats and products she needs for her dishes. Laura is grateful to Manuela Ramos for lending support to many women through loans that help their families.

Translated by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora Laura Enith pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en el Jr. Amazonas 398, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Laura con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de comidas. En la actualidad con su venta de comida esta incrementando sus ganancias y remodelando su casa para que mas adelante poder tener un restaurante y ofrecer mas servicios a sus clientes puedan divertirse y comer muy rico, con la ayuda de sus hijos atiende todo los días. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,300 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, estará acondicionando su casa con mesas, sillas, pintado, luces, y también comprará carnes y víveres que necesita para sus comidas. Laura se siente agradecida con Manuela Ramos por brindar apoyo a todas la mujeres con los prestamos para surgir pro el bien de la familia.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for the preparation of her products

loans.name: Chheun

texts.en: Mr. Chheun R. lives in Sras Keo village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is currently in the car repairing business, and he requested a loan to buy more car equipment to fix his customers’ cars. His wife, Mrs. Yoeurn Chuon, is a fish seller in the local market. Mr. Chheun R. is 56 and the father of 4 children, 2 of whom are employed in a garment factory, while another is attending a local school. The remaining one is too young to work or study. Previously, Mr. Chheun R. obtained a loan to buy a spray gun to paint his customers’ cars. His wife is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more car equipment to fix his customers’ cars

loans.name: Martin

texts.fr:
Born on 6 June 1971 in Aklakou in Togo, Mr. Martin Y. is a very dynamic and dedicated electronic engineer. However, he lacks the funds to open a workshop. He is married and has four people in his care, whose needs he meets thanks to the meagre income he draws from traditional rearing of poultry and small ruminants.

WIth the goal of increasing his income in order to improve the living conditions of his family, he is asking for a loan to open an electronics workshop and to sell electronic accessories.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né le 06 juin 1971 à Aklakou au Togo, Monsieur Y. Martin est un électronicien très dynamique et dévoué. Cependant il manque de fonds pour ouvrir un atelier de travail. Il est marié et a la charge de quatre personnes dont il subvient aux besoins grâce au faible revenu qu’il tire de l’élevage traditionnel de volailles et de petits ruminants.

Dans la perspective d’accroître son revenu aux fins d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille, il sollicite un crédit pour ouvrir un atelier électronique et pour vendre des accessoires électroniques.

loans.use: To set up and equip his workshop

loans.name: Eudosia

texts.es:
Eudosia is a member of the Community Bank Solución (Solution). Eudosia is married, 48 years old, and has one daughter. Eudosia has a shop in the house of her parents-in-law located in the neighborhood of Belén, in which she sells groceries. Eudosia is constructing her home in the neighborhood of Puca Cruz and hopes to finish soon to move. Additionally, Eudosia sows cereals on her grounds in the district of Huamanguilla, products that sell in the grocery market of the city of Ayacucho, and she also travels to the trade markets of San Miguel where she also buys cereals.

Eudosia needs a loan of 1200 Soles that will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, soaps, detergents, and flour. Eudosia's dreams are to move into her home, boost her business, and see her children become professionals.

First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=30908&_tpos=2&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Primer Prestamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=30908&_tpos=2&_tpg=1

Eudosia es socia del Banco Comunal Solución. Eudosia es conviviente, tiene 48 años y 1 hija, Eudosia tiene una tienda en la casa de sus suegros ubicada en el barrio de Belén, en donde vende abarrotes, Eudosia esta construyendo su casa en el Barrio de Puca Cruz y espera culminar pronto para mudarse. Además Eudosia siembra cereales en sus terrenos del distrito de Huamanguilla, productos que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho y también viaja a las ferias de San Miguel donde también compra cereales.

Eudosia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, jabones, detergentes y harina. Los sueños de Eudosia son mudarse a su casa, surtir mas su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Eudosia needs a loan for 1200 Soles that will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, soaps, detergents, and flour.

loans.name: Gurgina

texts.es:
Gurgina  cumplió 43 años de edad, estudió hasta tercero de primaria, casada y tiene tres hijos, vive en la comunidad de Machacmarca.

Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal Ciudad Nueva de la comunidad de Machacmarca, Distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia del Collao,  a los 19 años de edad tuvo su pareja desde entonces se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno en las ferias de  Pilcuyo, Acora e Ilave, con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró 02 corderos para su posterior venta.

Con este crédito de S/. 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual pagará en 04 cuotas, tiene previsto comprar 02 toros, cada vacuno le costará un promedio de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles.

Su visión es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave, tener un establo para 10 cabezas de ganado vacuno para engorde y que su hijo menor estudie ya que los dos mayores ya tienen su familia.
texts.en:
Gurgina is 43 years old, she completed third grade in primary school, is married and has three children. She lives in Machacmarca. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Ciudad Nueva” in Machacmarca, Pilcuyo district, Collao state. At 19 years old she married and since then has been buying and selling cattle in the Pilcuyo, Acora and Ilave markets. With her first loan for S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles she bought 2 lambs for future sale. With this loan for S/. 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 2 bulls, each will cost an average of S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles. Her vision is to buy a house in Ilave city, have a stable for 10 head of cattle to raise, and that her youngest son study as the two older children now have their own families.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom U., 54, and her husband, Mr. Sut Pheng, 64, live along national road number one about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1985 and have three daughters. Two of them are garment factory workers and the youngest one studies in a local school.

Mrs. Sokhom and her husband have been farming since 2000. They plant different kinds of vegetables and flowers and sell them to a middle man who then takes them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. Sokhom is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase fertilizers and pesticide for her vegetable farm.

loans.use: Sokhom would like to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for growing vegetables.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Y. is married and has 5 dependants. She received schooling through senior high. Elizabeth has been selling groceries like Milo and milk at Ensuekyer near Elmina, Ghana since 1993. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Elizabeth uses her income to pay for utility bills and other expenses. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more Milo, milk, sugar and other groceries to sell in her shop. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to help her husband build a family house.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en: Mrs. Chinda P. is a farmer in Prey Totoeng village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Tuy Lay, is a fisherman. Mrs. Chinda P. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed and a pump to bring water to her field, which is distant from the irrigation system. Additionally, she would purchase fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. Mrs. Chinda P. is 22 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, a pump and fertilizer.

loans.name: Santa Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a member of the Señor de Luren Village Bank (Loan Group), which is named for the patron saint of Ica. She is 33 years old and is the single mother of two children. Catalina used to sell dry goods, but switched to clothing about five months ago. She buys clothing in Lima (the capital), and sometimes also buys shoes in Tacna (a highly-commerce city on the border with Chile). She sells her wares by special order to individuals. She travels two to three times per month, depending on how many orders she receives. The business has been doing quite well so far, she says.

Catalina is requesting a loan of 600 soles to buy more clothing in Lima. Her goal for the future is to build her own house and to open her own store.

loans.use: To buy more clothing in Lima to resell

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu R. is 42 years old and married with three children. She sells provisions such as drinks, juice and local gin.  She needs a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Azra Shahzad Sarwar Group
loans.use: To buy materials for making shoes.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị  Nguyễn Thị Nguyệt  năm nay 31 tuổi,  chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007 và đang  làm nghề kinh doanh sơn và nhôm kính. Anh Tuấn  chồng chị là thợ nhôm kính có tay nghề cao nên cũng hỗ trợ chị rất nhiều trong công việc kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị đang phát triển rất thuận lợi và cho thu nhập 4.500.000đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các loại sơn và nguyên liệu phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất , kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N. is 31 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2007, and currently she sells paints, glasses and aluminum frames. Mr Tuan, her husband, is a skilled worker in glass and aluminum frames so he can help her a lot in the business. The business of her family is going well and brings an income of VND4,500,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND20,000,000 to buy additional paints and materials for her family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy additional paints and materials for her family's business.

loans.name: Ijeoma

texts.en: Ijeoma sells electrical materials like wire, bulbs, etc. She is 35 years old and married with four children. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more electrical materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical materials to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Mrs. Nancy C. is 48 years old and lives in Purok Bonifacio, Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is a micro-entrepreneur and a new member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC – Ozamiz Branch. She is married and blessed with 3 sons and 1 daughter. Her husband is a driver and at the same time does some carpentry work. She decided to engage in business to provide support for their daily needs. She has an existing Sari-sari store that has been located in their house since 2000.

For the past 9 years, her business has been getting better and better. She is hoping that someday she can build a stall for her Sari-sari store and be able to send her children to school for a better future. She is applying for a loan of 5,000.00 Philippine Pesos as additional capital for her sari-sari store.

loans.use: Additional capital for her Sari-sari Store

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: Since 1998, Matilda E. has worked as a trader selling porridge and donuts in Elmina.  She is married, has one child and has received an education through Senior High School. While Matilda works as a trader, her husband is employed as a taxi driver. She is responsible for paying school fees and her family’s light bill. Her loan will be used to buy more products such as oil, flour and millet. She will use these products to prepare the food that she sells. She hopes to save the new profits from her business so that she can build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the porridge and donuts that she sells.

loans.name: Delicia Amparo

texts.es:
La señora Delicia Amparo Suárez C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cruz de Motupe II”, viven en el Psje. Huandoy Nº 248, del Distrito y Provincia de Huaraz y Departamento de Ancash. Tiene 38 años, es madre separada y tiene 03 hijos que dependen de ella.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 compró medias para incrementar su mercadería. Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio de venta al por menor, aunque siempre varía los productos de acuerdo a la temporada en la que se encuentre por decir fiestas patronales en el Callejón de Huaylas y el Callejón de los Conchudos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 comprará más medias y especerías siendo más del 80% que invertirá para su negocio y como se encuentra delicada de salud y tiene programado una operación de hernia el 20% lo destinará para su operación de riesgo menor.
Amparo, como la mayoría de las socias y amistades la conocen es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, porque manifiesta que desde que creció observaba como su madre trabajaba y por ello también desde los 12 años de edad la ayudaba a vender hasta que logró formar su propio capital y vender por sí sola y con el cual también ella ahora mantiene a sus hijos.  Muy orgullosa nos dice que su hijo mayor se encuentra estudiando en la Universidad y que destina los mayores esfuerzos para ellos.
texts.en:
Delicia Amparo Suárez C. belongs to the "Cruz de Motupe II" Village Bank. She lives on Huandoy Alley in Huaraz Province and District in the Department of Ancash. She is a 38 year old separated mother of three children, all of whom are dependents. With her first loan of 300 soles, Amparo bought more merchandise in the form of socks. She has been working with her village bank for the past two years. Amparo is still in the same line of work, and varies the products she sells according to the season. She is currently gearing up for regional holidays in the Callejón de Huaylas and Callejón de los Conchudos Valleys. Amparo will use 80% of her 1700 soles loan to buy more socks and spices. She is currently in delicate health, and will use the other 20% of her loan to pay for a low-risk hernia operation. Most of her fellow group members and friends consider Amparo to be a very hard-working, enterprising woman. She says that she when she was growing up, she used to watch her mother work. When she was 12 years old, she started helping her mother, and eventually put together her own capital and started selling on her own; this is how she currently supports her children. She proudly informs us that her oldest son is currently studying at the university and that she works as hard as she does in order to help her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy socks, spices

loans.name: Razia Kosar Muhammad Shafique Group

texts.en:
Farzana baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Nargis baji wants a loan to buy animal skins to sell.

Kubra baji wants a loan to buy paint boxes to sell.

Nabila shahzadi baji wants a loan to buy iron to sell.

Razia kosar baji, wife of M. S., lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. She has been a part of this city for the last eight years. Lahore is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods.

Razia baji’s husband is a blacksmith and he makes iron rods to sell to his customers. He has been in this profession for the last six years. Razia baji is a very caring lady; she performs her duties very efficiently. She is applying for a loan to buy iron for her husband so that he is able to make more iron rods to sell to his customers.

Note: The sewing machine belongs to Farzana baji.

loans.use: To buy iron for making iron rods to sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana G. is 28 years old. She is married and has no children at the moment. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Diana is a food vendor. She fries and sells yam with pepper in the mornings and afternoons. She sells on a tabletop at the lorry station in her community. She wants a loan to buy tubers of yam and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities. Diana has been in business for one year now. She aspires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy tubers of yam in bulk

loans.name: Nadège Sophie

texts.en: Nadège Sophie B. is married to Innocent Glanon, a carpenter by trade.  She is the mother of four children, who are all in school. Nadège lives with her family in Sèmè-Podji, a community not far from Cotonou, Benin.  Nadège's business activity is the sale of assorted goods, which she delivers to her clients’ homes. To supplement her activity, she also sells goods in a stall in front of her home. Due to the growing demand for her products, Nadège is seeking a loan from Alidé, a Kiva Field Partner. She would like to buy more bags of charcoal, boxes of spaghetti, oil, and fabrics. Nadège hopes to increase her sales with the help of a loan.

loans.use: To purchase of bags of charcoal, boxes of spaghetti, oil drums, and fabrics.

loans.name: Aura Maria

texts.es: Aura María L. tiene 50 años de edad. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio con esfuerzos propios, ella recorre las calles todos los días y ofrece a variedad de productos. Ella es una buena cliente de Fundación León 2000 ya que siempre se ha dedicado a pagar sus deudas en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra pantalón, camisas, trajes para damas y faldas.
texts.en:
Aura María L. is 50 years old. For a living she has been selling general merchandise for more than 11 years. She started this business with her own efforts, she sells in the streets every day and offers a variety of products. She is a good client of Fundación León 2000 as she has always been very punctual with the repayments of her loans. The loan requested is for work capital to buy pants, shirts, ladies' suits and skirts.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Zenaida es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Zenaida junto a su esposo venden madera en un local alquilado, productos que adquiere de los productores que le traen a su negocio. Zenaida tiene proyectado implementar su negocio con productos de ferretería.
Zenaida necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de calaminas, clavos,
Los sueños de Zenaida son tener una ferretería y un recreo.

loans.use: Para la compra de calaminas, clavos,

loans.name: Chérifatou

texts.fr: Cette dame vend depuis 2001 dans le Marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé des chaussures de fabrication chinoise. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière à son foyer pour l’éducation scolaire de leurs 03 enfants. Elle s’approvisionne auprès d’une dame qui se rend en Chine pour l’achat des chaussures en cartons. Elle revend sa marchandise le plus souvent aux vendeuses ambulantes de Hédzranawoé. Actuellement elle a besoin de renouveler son stock. Elle sollicite pour cela un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 50 cartons de chaussures de différentes gammes. Elle a l’assurance de vite rembourser son crédit à cause de sa longue expérience du marché.
texts.en:
Since 2001, this lady has been selling shoes and Chinese goods at the Hédzranawoé Market in Lomé.  This business enables her financially to do her part at home to educated their three children.  She supplies herself from a lady who goes to China to buy shoes in boxes.  She usually resells her merchandise to door-to-door saleswomen of Hédzranawoé. Currently, she needs to renew her stock.  To do so, she's requesting a WAGES loan to buy 50 boxes of shoes of different ranges.  She's certain of repaying her loan quickly because of her extensive market experience. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of shoes

loans.name: Manayon

texts.en:
Manayon is already 47 years old. She is married to Conrado C.. The couple is blessed with three children and all of them are already married. Manayon is a seamstress in their village. She sews pillow covers, bed sheets, and also dresses. She is thankful because through the business she is managing, she is able to earn money for the needs of her family.

She would like to ask financial support from KIVA lenders so that she could be able to purchase needed materials for her sewing business. She is asking the amount of PHP 6,000 that will be used for the development of her sewing business that helps her and her husband provide for their children with financial help when they needed it. Doing this is because of their grandchildren, too.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is involved in a hog-raising business and it has been her main source of income since she got married. She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to be used in purchasing feed for her grown-up pigs and to purchase additional piglets to raise. She would like to improve and grow her hog-raising business and hopefully she will be able to obtain the loan she has requested. 

Nenita is a 40-year-old businesswoman who lives with her husband and two children in the village of Santa Isabel Norte, Ilagan, Isabela. She sends her two children to school and, hopefully, her eldest child, who is now in college, will finish her studies and earn a degree. Her youngest is still in primary school and Nenita also aims to provide the education she needs to be able to acquire better opportunities in life someday.

Nenita hopes that her husband will always be patient in working on their farm so that they will be able to help each other in attaining their aspirations.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Liway

texts.en:
34-year-old Liway M. (with her child in the photo) grows rice for a living. All her life has been spent on the farm. The harvest she gets from her farm is saved for the family's consumption. The remainders are sold to other people for additional income for the family. 

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farming needs, and pay the rental of the equipment they will use for farm land preparation. This will ensure a quality and abundant harvest in her farm.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar A. is a 42-year-old mother of 10 school-aged kids, married, and a resident of Makawa, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She and her husband are both expert at making 'nipa' (palm) roofs and this activity is their major source of income. Despite having many children, Pilar and her husband are really working hard in order for them to support their family.

Pilar decided to join PMPC to gain access to financial services and now, she is already on her second loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional 'nipa' leaves because the orders from their customers are now increasing. The profit will be used to be sure their children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy 'nipa' leaves to be used in making palm frond roofs

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam P. is from the village of Gracia in Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. Miriam is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Miriam buys and sells dried fish products, and ready-to-eat and homemade foods such as longganisa (spiced sausage), chorizo (sausage) and lumpia (spring rolls). Miriam has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Miriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miriam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Miriam is requesting same loan amount, 5000 PHP, to purchase new items to expand the products that she offers. This will be Miriam's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's education.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
